title: Andy — thanks for welcoming us & sending us on our way. We had a great time and hope you are there when we come back!
text: From the moment we arrived to the second we left had an amazing time! Andy greeted us when we got there and we were so happy to see him again when we were checking out. After a long day of travel it was so nice to see a smiling face when we checked in — can’t thank Andy enough!! Turn town service was above and beyond, and every other staff I ran into that day was so kind and helpful. Rooms are amazing, amenities are unmatched and the location is great for not only its own backyard — but convenient to access other neighborhoods of Manhattan. Highly recommend and can’t wait to come back. Thanks again!

title: Love the double duvets! An excellent night's sleep
text:
This hotel is in a great location if you are going to the high line, wanted to pop down to chelsea or take a scenic cruise. I will note that the location is a little inconvenient if you have meetings in midtown - although Penn Station is a quick 10 minute walk.

The staff at this hotel were very attentive. I liked all the amenities. As you can imagine, the gym was great. I used both pools during my stay and had no complaints. 

What I really liked was the blackout shades and sound proof (?) room. The rooms are very smart with lighting under the bed so you can see if you get up in the middle of the night. And let's not forget the double duvets. At first I was skeptical about the need for two duvets but  I woke up very well rested. The mattress seemed to aborb motion from restless sleepers (another plus). The shower was massive with 3 different types of spouts. I also liked the  (local) hotel products - they smelled great and the sizes were large. I would definely return here!

title: Prime hospitality
text: Truly my favorite place to stay. The team at Equinox Hotel is so accommodating and the location is great with luxury and affordable retail just across the street. The staff is amazing, from the hotel, to the restaurant and even the gym. I couldn't help but extend my stay an extra night and it was definitely worth it. Prime hospitality!

title: Short and oh so sweet.
text:
This was my first stay at the Equinox, and it was a short stay, just one night.  However, what stood out to me, over and over again was how well trained, polite, attentive and kind the staff are.  Every single one of them!  The bellmen, the concierge, the check in desk, the bartenders!  Unbelievably on top of everything and there for you for anything you needed!  Just fabulous!  
The room was lovely, the restaurant was excellent, didn't have any room service.  But the staff - truly awesome.

title: Clean and Comfortable Luxury in a great part of Manhattan!
text:
I have been to New York many times and was looking for something really clean, safe and comfortable for me and my family during my daughters spring break. In a time where safety is certainly a concern for me when traveling, I wanted to find somewhere far enough away from times square but close enough that it was accessible without being a hassle. I came across the Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards which is an area I had never stayed in and let me say it was EXACTLY what i was looking for. The area feels roomy, LOTS of shopping options and most of all, felt quite yet active. The best part is there is a subway stop practically at the doorsteps of the equinox with a 1 stop over to the heart of Times Square. Although this location is geared towards adult travelers, I do think its a great option for families looking for a Luxury stay away from the hecticness of Midtown. It has a Spa, A world class Gym (obviously being managed by Equinox Fitness), Room Service and a Pool (although only accessible to ages 18+). The hotel was spotless and everyone from the valet attendant, to the bell services to the front desk to the housekeeping was absolutely 5 star service all across the board. My biggest wish would be to hope that this location would strong consider 2 things.
1 - hoping that could add some kids menu options to their in-room dining and Electric Lemon restaurant. Im sure there are plenty of guests who may be traveling with thier child or families who want to splurge on the amazing Equinox hotel experience and would truly appreciate at least a small amount of options for children. They already have one foot in the water with a Kids Menu on their breakfast menu but certainly we would of stayed and ordered more in-room or had dinner at Electric Lemon had they offered a Kids Menu. 
2 - My 2nd suggestion would be to offer the In-Room Dining at least till midnight. Currently it ends at 11pm. Heres my reasoning. If you go to an event (NBA game, Concert, Broadway Show) most likely you wont be returning until around 11pm which you just miss the cutoff for in-room dining. What we always love and favor about the Four Seasons hotels is their 24 hour in room dining option which is great for anyone who has a hectic day and sometimes only has that late night option, especially while staying at a hotel, as your probably out with a full schedule. I will say we had the Breakfast for our in-room dining every morning and everything we had was phenomenal! Hats off to your amazing chefs and the deliver was always beautifully presented. 

One last note to travelers. At a hotel of this caliber, we always make a point to ensure we leave a tip for housekeeping as they truly work hard to ensure you come back to a clean and relaxing room. This has been one thing that I have come to truly make sure I never forget to always leave a note with a tip as the housekeeping truly does an amazing job to make sure every guests gets to experience the clean and comfortable luxury that Equinox hotels strive for! Thank you  and please know that you have a really amazing and hardworking housekeeping staff.

Overall we cant wait to return and when we do we really hope to see the addition of Kids options on the menus. If your thinking about booking here don't hesitate and a tip to get some extra perks is to book with WHATAHOTEL, I always book with them for the great perks like breakfast credit and upgrades. Thank you so much to everyone at the Equinox! you all are AMAZING!

title: The staff made our stay 5 star!
text:
The concierge; exquisite, the best, all of them! Thank you Carlos, Edwin, Joseph, Tyrone and everyone of you. This team made our stay 5 star! Andy the doorman so helpful, friendly above and beyond service! My sister loved his eyebrows lol private joke!😁
Elizabeth front desk very friendly who helped book my reservation.  Jason who checked me in and out was exceptional with customer service. The staff at the hotel is what made this five star in my opinion.  The room was nice however the thermostat had issues hot than cold air we had 2 different engineers who  came up to help, very friendly but the thermostat kept failing. Housekeeping was excellent! If you do not want housekeeping service make sure to put no service or they will come in even though you tell them no service needed. The spa services were nice  the spa however was cold throughout and robes very thin and short. The electric lemon was very good food and William our waiter was so fun a great since of humor and he offered great suggestions for food choices. Thank you staff!!!

title: Top notch experience
text: The Equinox Hotel NY was a fantastic experience! The staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and made my wife and I feel very welcome. They even sent a little birthday treat for her! The wellness vibe was terrific, with lots of little goodies in the room. We slept in until 8am, not easy to do in Manhattan! The room was quiet and the dark shades really worked! We booked the room through AmEx, so took advance of the 4pm late checkout and the extra credits. It’s possible to drive right up to the main entrance of the hotel, and the valet was easy with an efficient pick up. About the only thing we didn’t do was hit the Equinox Gym, which looks amazing. Next time! Overall, one of the best hotels we’ve stayed in. Highly recommend.

title: Don’t go here!!!Go to an actual luxury hotel spa
text: Rather spend my money at an actual luxury spa for the price they charge. Theres no steam room, no locker, no toiletries small basic locker room. I’m a destination member of equinox and been to the spa before. If someone books you a spa day they make the check out process extremely complicated! It’s very unprofessional and low budget of them to do. They also charge more than whatever service you initially ordered. The facial was not good, and the massage is nothing special. Will NEVER use this spa again.

title: Not for me.
text:
Nice welcoming front door staff and great front desk Staff; Dan was exceptional.  
Hudson yards complex itself is a bit out-of-the-way; not super convenient to most other places in New York City unless you’re going to the Equinox Hudson Yards gym, which I do frequent when traveling to New York; but not the best location for me to be staying hotel-wise. 
I’m a huge fan of Equinox health clubs and have been going for years, and still hold the all-access membership etc. so I was really hoping to love this hotel.  
But I didn’t. 
Even though I had, I guess the deluxe room on a high floor it was seemingly small. 
There’s no work desk, rather a little bench seat with a coffee table, which you kind of have to try and turn into a makeshift desk. 
Definitely not comfortable for work- no chair to comfortably lean back in and be supported by while doing stressful computer work for an hour or two…. No work desks in the rooms!!! 
The minibar is like and Equinox store and it’s a little bit confusing as are the light switches, etc. and the shower water pressure is just so-so. The faucets don’t have a nice big stream and the sink is awkward and clunky, also with bad water pressure and the faucet doesn’t come up enough over the sink so you have to be really careful not to make a mess. Definitely not easy, comfortable and user-friendly, none of it. 
They tried too hard to be high-tech and trendy and it just doesn’t work. It’s not comfortable and it’s not easy. 
Not to mention, heading down to the front door needing a taxi urgently to get to a dinner (that I was late for) and having the door-staff say I need to go over to an iPad and enter my phone number to get a taxi. Another high-tech, “trying too hard” fail. and then, of course, the whole thing was glitching up and would not accept the information that I had entered.  
There’s so many nice standard, five star hotels in NYC that aren’t trying too hard to be something different or new and that’s what I will stick with moving forward like the Ritz Carlton, Central Park South, The Langham 5th Avenue, the NY Edition, the Lotte Towers and the Loews Regency. 
However, I had to try this at least once and now that’s done.

title: Wonderful Experience .
text:
Faultless experience from start to finish . Very peaceful hotel with amazing views . 
Beds are extremely comfortable and the split duvets are a wonderful idea.The attention to detail and cleanliness in the rooms and communal areas is exemplary.

Nothing is too much trouble for the staff they are smiling ,courteous and very happy to help , even at 6.30am when your car doesn’t turn up . ( Thank you Andy ).
Great location within easy reach of all that NYC has to offer .

Can’t wait to return .

title: Equinox - Great Hotel
text: Great hotel.  Amenities and comfort are top notch but the service is even better. Special shout-out to Andy who was so helpful with getting us in and settled.  The gym access is fantastic as well - high end gym with all of the equipment you could want. Looking forward to going back.

title: The BEST
text:
My favorite hotel.

Beautiful experience from start to finish. The bed is like sleeping on the cloud, and the housekeeping team are OUT OF THIS WORLD. They take such good care of you and make sure your stay is as comfortable as possible. It is the little things that count, and I was so pleasantly delighted to find toothpaste for example, when I did not even ask for it but was indeed missing the toothpaste. I love that I can go to the beautiful gym as well.

title: Excellent hotel - mediocre gym.
text:
We decided to stay at the Equinox Hotel because we wanted a luxury hotel that had access to a great gym.  

The location of the Equinox was perfect for us.  Very accessible to great restaurants and Broadway shows (we liked to walk before and after the shows so it was nice to be able to do that to/from the hotel).  We loved that it was less busy at Hudson Yards and still close to everything. 

The room itself was impeccable. We loved the lighting and the layout.  The shower and bathroom were big and well laid out.  We weren't fans of the double duvets however.  We also didn't like that our room temperature would not go lower than 66 degrees.  We're hot sleepers and this was problematic every night.  We finally got them to bring us a fan and that helped a little. 

The staff at the Equinox were all amazing.  They treated us like royalty and always greeted us when we came by. Our room attendant who we never got the privilege of meeting was amazing.  We loved coming back to our room and finding all the little touches that were made to keep the room tidy. 

Overall we loved the hotel and enjoyed our stay.  We did not, however, enjoy the gym.  We booked our stay at the Equinox mainly for the gym option. What we didn't anticipate was that the gym is accessible to many many non-hotel guests.  We used the gym daily - at different times during the day - and not once was it not fully packed with people.  So crowded that getting a decent workout was impossible.  Moreover / using the amenities (plunge pools, steam barrels, etc.) was almost impossible unless you wanted to wait forever.  We also found the equipment in the gym to be old and in desperate need of an upgrade. Overall the gym does not do the luxury hotel justice.  We were very disappointed.  

In the end we loved the Equinox hotel but unfortunately our experience with the gym left us disappointed.

title: Excellent midtown luxury hotel
text:
We stay here frequently and it's always awesome! The Hudson Yards location works great for us and is close enough to most things but out of the craziness of Times Square. 

We usually book through Amex FHR and they are pretty good with upgrades. Rooms are very modern feeling and equipped with tons of health gear you probably won't use but still a nice touch. 

Breakfast menu is fairly limited but food is excellent. Gym is obviously out of this world great and particularly if you can use it a little off-peak times.

title: Home away from home
text: Absolutely fantastic place to stay in NY.  Everyone who works there was at the very top of their game.   Gorgeous rooms, great bathroom, bath products - perfect for long or short stay. Gym in the building.  Extremely clean and houskeeping is amazing!  Runs like a well-oiled machine.  A true home away from home!  Convenient to all parts of the City. Thank you!

title: BEST HOTEL EVER - a functional medicine and wellness paradise
text: This was my favorite hotel stay EVER!!! My husband and I are functional medicine and wellness enthusiasts. We often wonder, "Where is the hotel with everything we want??" I.e., a great gym, sauna, spa, healthy food, filtered water, sleep-supporting rooms with blackout shades, and GREAT service. Well, I found it! Equinox Hotel in NYC is my dream hotel and more. It has all the amenities we could ask for, but even more than that - the service was top-notch. I stayed there with a close friend at the same time the Lakers happened to be staying at the hotel, and let me tell you, I never once felt like I wasn't the most valuable guest in the hotel. The entire staff has clearly been trained well to make people feel valued and loved. Diana, the manager, and the entire staff went above and beyond to make us feel special! I cannot wait to return! :)

title: Love this place !!!
text: I am absolutely obsessed with this hotel & the staff . I come to New York City at least 7 times throughout the year & I plan on staying here every visit ! The rooms are GORGEOUS, the views are UNPARALLELED, the staff are OUTSTANDING, from the moment you walk in all the way up to the highest floor . They have blessed my boyfriend & I with complete VIP service between the driver picking us up at the airport & greeting us at check in. Adrian & Diana even extended their personal numbers to me to contact if we ever needed anything . & sure enough it came in handy ! These people go above & beyond out of the kindness of their hearts & the sake of the hotel standards and I absolutely am so grateful! Go ahead & book y’all ! This place is like heaven !

title: top hotel
text: Excellent hotel, 100% recommended, thanks to the staff for their dedicated attention, I hope to return. Very comfortable beds, very good amenities, very correct reception staff, quality room service, very good shower, all 10

title: An incredible hotel with wellness at the forefront
text:
The Equinox Hotel is nothing short of spectacular. It's a peaceful oasis in Hudson Yards. 
Traveling to New York every second week and prioritizing my health and wellness has been difficult. Staying here makes it possible (and enjoyable) to maintain my routine. First class amenities and attention to detail everywhere you look. 
The staff are excellent, professional friendly and kind. The room service menu is the best I have ever seen!

title: Quality with a heartbeat
text:
I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel. First, let me say, being 63, I normally can’t handle vibrant, fast paced, and “young” type places but this hotel, although all of the above, checked all the boxes for me. The reason? The staff! The decor! The service!  The comfort!  I feel like they want me back and that they care. It’s a rustling, bustling hotel with a great healthy restaurant, lounge/bar and cozy attentive front desk. No need was not met. Although all of the staff were completely trained to the highest degree, one young valet stood out the most, Andy remembered my name (first and last) and would run to help me coming out of the elevator, into my car and even kept me company as I was waiting for my husband. The smiles, the service and the knowledge of how to make a guest feel special was evident in this young man.  They all had this quality but he just stood out and needed to be acknowledged. 
The beds were a little stiff and I asked for a topper which came up immediately. Our room had a beautiful large high tech bathroom with a large shower that had a glass window that with a push of a button, gave complete privacy or a view to the room and the view of the city. Absolutely lovely decor and wonderful room amenities.  What more can I say?  The gym.. amazing! Full of people but the layout gave space. I was probably the oldest person there except for my husband but felt like this hotel catered to all ages. They provided a choice of chairs that I could get out of!  Most “young places” only have low seating. This made it do-able for me. I could go on, but I’m just glad to know I can go to somewhere besides the Regis or the Ritz and still get the quality but with a heartbeat!

title: Pay employees properly + get rid of surprise gratuity
text:
Hotel experience was amazing — comfortable bed + spa experience was great.

The main purpose of this review is for management. They really need to pay their employees properly. The surprise 20% gratuity asks across basic spa services are distasteful and misleading

title: Amazing experience
text:
I rated everything as 5 except gym 
I stayed 3 nights and I enjoyed the excellent receptionist and concierge services 
The food with Gluteen free options are excellent 
The room is very comfortable and meant to satisfy athletes and sport people 
The gym is rated 4 as they have outstanding equipment but the welcome service for 1st time visitors is leas than my expectation also during weekend less number or group classes  
I stayed in 2019

title: We will be back!
text: We loved the Equinox Hotel. The location is nice with views of the harbor and easy access to the highline and anywhere we wanted to walk. We walked everywhere and never needed a cab. Most importantly, though, is that the staff is awesome. From Mr. Caputi checking us in to all the restaurant staff, and the housekeeping team. The housekeeping is very thorough and the rooms are fabulous. Great bedding (we are now adopting the "Scandinavian bedding" at home), pillows, towels, and robes. The extras like yoga matte, blocks, roller - awesome. I'm usually not a fan of hotels where the lobby is on an upper floor, but this was not an issue. Can't way enough about this hotel!

title: this hotel was excellent. We stayed on the 23rd floor.  the view was spectacular.  Dan and his concierge service amazing
text: Reilly enjoyed my stay.  Dan and his concierge terms were incredible.  their hospitality and attention to detail was a 10 out of 10.  The gym and swimming pool helped to keep me fit during my stay.  the breakfast had a lot of healthy options. Love😍

title: Best Hotel in Hudson Yards
text: This Hotel is a must if you need to stay in Hudson Yards.  Love everything about this hotel.  The Linens, beds, shower, and the view.  Toiletries were fabulous, best I have used in a hotel in quite a while.  My daughter travels for work and I am so lucky to have stayed at this Hotel with her.

title: Great Customer Service
text: Our suite could not have been more luxurious and beautiful. Dan at the front desk was so, so charming and helpful. Top knotch customer service. Andy downstairs was maybe the nicest most 5 star customer service I’ve ever experienced. Both him and Dan deserve a raise, real MVPs. My one bummer is that although it’s advertised as a spa hotel, it really isn’t. It’s a gym hotel. The pool is for lap swimming with the gym members and the jacuzzi is a sweaty gym jacuzzi. This isn’t a spa hotel. Also, the food and in room dining is extremely expensive. An herbal tea is $10, plus a service charge and tax. About $15 total. It’s very expensive. But overall, this is a sleek, sexy and great hotel. Very health conscious, the only milk in your room for coffee is powdered coconut milk with Mct oil…so it’s really health conscious. But we had a blast, and the customer service was wonderful!

title: Always amazing and a great stay .
text: The equinox hotel is always our go to . They do not disappoint and are always  consistent. The location is great. The service is always on point.  The rooms are clean and modern . Dan caputi  is the man . We are always greeted with a big welcome and he  always accommodates our needs .  He is super helpful and all around a great guy .   If you ever  need anything at the hotel reach out to him .

title: Amazing Staff!!
text: Nathan in Guest Services is amazing! He has helped us out with business travel details on many occasions. He is always responsive, efficient, professional and provides a top notch experience. My boss loves this hotel. Thank you!

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
I am so glad I decided to book the equinox hotel. It was such a phenomenal experience. Dan at the front desk was so accommodating and kind. He answered all my questions. 

I will be purchasing the sheets and towels and pillows for my personal home because my night sleep was incredible.

Don’t miss out on the little extra amenities that they give you such as reading the pamphlet in your hotel room about how to get a good nights sleep. I didn’t know that optimal temperature in a room should be 66°! Also! Drink the sleep tea provided!

 They also provide a yoga mat and a muscle roller, which definitely came in handy . If you forget your workout clothes, you can purchase workout clothes in your room. Lastly, I really appreciated the robe that were a collaboration with Reigning Champ.

Reshma in the spa was the nicest person 
Thank you again for a wonderful stay!

title: Incredible Service and Hospitality
text: The staff at the Equinox are simply incredible. As a hospitality student who came to experience this iconic NYC hotel with my parents who were in town for the weekend, I was blown away by the in-room amenities, the fitness club, the restaurant (Electric Lemon), but most of all - the service and hospitality. A highlight of our stay was having a tour of the fitness club from one of their very kind staff members, Dan. He was so gracious to chat with us, take us on a tour of the space, and was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about his job and the hotel. 11/10 experience - highly recommend!

title: Great stay and customer service experience
text: Great experience at this hotel from check in to our stay and spa experience. The customer service was above and beyond, especially Dan at the check in desk and the gentleman at concierge who helped with our dinner reservation and coffee recommendation. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a truly luxury stay - best service I’ve ever had.

title: Finally!  Luxury and Genuine Kindess
text:
I rarely write reviews, but it’s time I share how I feel about Equinox Hotel. My family and I have stayed at amazing hotels in NYC, and now I’ve finally found a place that offers both luxury and genuine kindness.  This was our 4th visit to Equinox Hotel this year, visiting our daughter who goes to school in NYC.  We’ll continue to return here because I know that I won’t find another hotel comparable to Equinox’s level of customer service and amenities.  The front desk staff are helpful, and they always follow through quickly with any request.  Love having access to the crème de la crème of Equinox gyms.  And, an excellent brunch and evening cocktails are only an elevator ride away to the Electric Lemon.

Love the attention to the room details in ensuring a restful and zen-like stay. The housekeeping staff does a fantastic job!  Rooms are so clean!!  

On our initial visit to the Equinox Hotel earlier this year, we were immediately greeted by Andy when we drove up to the private driveway (a huge plus).  He is the perfect example of how one person can make a difference. He set the tone of our stay - we felt welcome and taken care of.  This positive experience is why we keeping coming back. Many thanks to Andy and the best team of doormen!

title: Equinox Spa
text:
This was my Second visit  to The Equinox Spa.

The well-designed space is spotless - w/ sweeping views of the Hudson River and beyond.   Jonah and the staff were very attentive and welcoming. 

Highly recommend to anyone interested in a first-date medical spa Experience in a most picturesque Manhattan setting.

Dave Cowen NYC

title: bad experience.
text: Very disappointed.   My room was corner suite and first morning had construction on top of us.  Drilling, hammering from 8 am to 6 pm.  I was not warned or notified of the above.  I complained to 3 employees before the hotel offered to move us to another room (at 2 pm).  The hotel restaurant and bar are very small spaces.   Couldn't get a happy hour drink bc of private party of professionals.  I also had plans to stay at the hotel over Thanksgiving and canceled them.  Very much not worth the money.

title: Amazing stay
text: From the moment we arrived our experience was amazing. Our bags were immediately taken up to our room which was very upscale and clean. We had immediate access to bar and lounge, gym, and spa which were all first class. Each evening we had turn down service and the room was spotlessly cleaned each day. From the concierge, to the amenities, to the decor of the entire property, all 5 star. Will definitely be my go to hotel for all travel to NYC

title: Fantastic hotel!
text:
Absolutely the best hotel stay I’ve ever had. The staff are incredibly professional, polite, and very eager to help with any need. The room was luxurious and perfect for any health-minded individual. The gym facilities and pool were clean and very convenient. 

Overall, I was blown away by this hotel and will definitely be back as soon as I can.

title: Disappointing experience
text:
In my opinion this hotel is overrated. Rooms are nice but the price / value is not right; for $1198,- per night the room is too small and breakfast not included. We got a voucher of $70,- per day for breakfast as we booked through Skylark but even if you order just 2 juices, a bowl of yoghurt and an avocado toast this is not enough. We had breakfast twice and paid $85,- and even $130,-.
As a solution for our complaint the room is not what we expected - especially for a stay of 4 nights - we were offered an upgrade for a sub charge of $500,- per night. This is not a solution. Staff acts friendly but in the end they are not genuinely interested in customer satisfaction.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: Loved the hotel, great yoga classes and cold plunges, the pool deck was also very pleasant as well as the food drinks that are served on the deck. The hotel rooms are modern with excellent lighting...I went for business and then extended an extra week the hotel was very comfortable and staff was nice, specifically Dan Caputi... when i was looking to extend my trip he was extremely  helpful and he was also very kind when ever i needed anything.

title: Staff!!
text: We were a large group....I would say a 20 of us?! Everyone loved every minute of our stay: staff was extra helpful, bed was super comfy, food was delicious....the gym is massive and the rooftop bar has the best views!! Thank you! I will certainly be back.

title: A luxury gem in a non charming new part of NYC
text:
From the moment you enter from the ground floor doors, you feel the level is elevated service.  The bellman are all wonderful and start to know your daily routines.   They greet you by name and are representing the Equinox brand beautifully.  Check in was also amazing and thorough.   Housekeeping was phenomenal. The bedding and the bed were pure luxury.  We loved our room, we loved our view, we loved the amenities the room offered.  Being able to use the Gym is a huge plus.  The only reason I’m deducting a star (and it’s a silly reason but everyone should know)  is that we found the Breakfast menu to be beyond limiting. We were hoping for some more basic things and I was tempted to ask for a child’s menu.  There was a very limited selection.  Other than that the Hotel was incredible. I’m not a fan of Hudson Yards and I wish this hotel would open downtown.   
❤️👍❤️

title: High Quality Spa Experience
text: This facility is next level and the service is top quality! Jonah is super knowledgeable about the amenities as well as the services.  I told him I was recovering from a muscle injury and he recommended treatments.  Definitely recommend the cryotherapy and infrared sauna as a combo treatment.  I’ll make this part of my routine.

title: Amazing by all means!
text: Modern stylish design, convenient location next to cinema and pharmacy, friendly and professional personnel, great breakfast .Didn’t have chance to check the pool. Great stay! Next time need to check the lounge, it looked like a happening place

title: Wonderful evening
text: My friends and I recently went to NYC for a bachelor party (night out) and we wanted a really nice hotel with great views of the city. We stayed in the skyline deluxe suite and weren’t disappointed! Beautiful view from every angle. The staff couldn’t be anymore accommodating. We will return!

title: Begrenzte Nutzbarkeit
text:
Ein sehr schönes Hotel mit super Lage und schönen Zimmern, soweit so gut.
Man sollte sich aber im Klaren sein das es keinen Service darüber hinaus gibt Der Spa und Poolbereich ist für die Hotelgäste nur theoretisch erreichbar, ebenso Bar und Restaurant ,hier Tummeln sich Residierte und Gäste von außerhalb, die alle mit Reservierungen kommen und somit keine Möglichkeit der Nutzung für die Hotelgäste besteht. Allein der Abenteurerliche Zugang zum Pool ist schon sehr unterhaltsam. Daher wer das nicht will oder braucht ganz ok

title: Fresh and fruity hotel
text: If you re looking for a trendy hotel in the best spot in NY, Equinox  will meet your expectations for sure. Incredible fitness room, breathtaking view and comfortable room. Service is amazing. Housekeepers and maids are so polite and lovely. Amazing guy at the reception (with dreadlocks) and a very careful Nathan who is available any time to help.

title: Stunning Luxury
text:
My wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary by staying at the Equinox Hotel this past weekend.  

From the VP of Guest Experience, Nathan Loga, to the bartender at the lounge, Gilbert, the wonderful hotel staff went beyond the highest level of expectations to make us feel special and enjoy our celebration. The entire hotel team was superb and extremely pleasant!

The hotel management’s attention to specific details and the staff’s trained ability to provide a luxurious experience takes the Equinox Hotel to a level beyond any other in the world.  

Stunning luxury seems the specific description of this hotel.  The architectural design, extravagant amenities, and the quality of construction are all testaments to the hotel’s tremendous capacity to distinguish itself.  The sequence of experience from arrival at the hotel entrance, to the reception lobby, to the guest room, is simply breathtaking.  The bespoke design of the sky lobby and the guest room details redefine luxury.  

The location is outstanding, right in the middle of Hudson Yards where there are plenty of high-end restaurants (we tried Milos—Greece and Mar—Spain) and attractions (we visited the Edge and tried after-hours’ cocktails at Peakaboo).   

From Hudson Yards we leisurely walked the High Line which meanders through the Westside of the City and connects Hudson Yards with the Meatpacking District—where we were able to explore more restaurants and entertainment options.   

Thank you Team Equinox for a wonderful weekend!

title: Best Hotel in the City!
text: The Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards has become my go-to hotel in New York City. It is a smart and stylish hotel with incredible views in a great location. The rooms are designed for sleep: they are cool, dark, and quiet, with incredibly comfortable beds. Honestly, it is the best sleep environment I have ever been in and keeps me going back. The gym and spa may be the best in the city. But the gem of this hotel is the staff…. from management to the valets ….they are friendly, attentive, and focused on making your stay as comfortable as possible. This is truly one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had! I am already looking forward to my return.

title: Amazing experience
text: Amazing hospitality, comfort, and amenities. First class all the way. For the fitness minded crowd, this is the place. Look no further if you want an elegant experience with a world class gym & top notch customer service.

title: Above and beyond
text: From the moment you walk in the door, every interaction with the staff is friendly and warm. New York might have a reputation for rudeness, but you wont find that anywhere at Equinox hotel. Nathan and his team treat you like family, the rooms are always pristine. I literally refuse to have my company book me anywhere else when I travel to NYC. We’ll done!

title: A perfect experience and a wonderful stay
text: This hotel is simply the best and most comfortable place I have stayed in awhile!  The staff is superior, top notch and definitely aim to make your experience a memorable one.  Oh, the spa??  They have everything - it's like a luxury retreat.  I enjoyed a 90 minute massage and did not want to leave.  I will always stay here when I visit New York.  Thank you Equinox for a wonderful experience!

title: Fav spot in nyc
text:
Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards is a fantastic spot for a laid-back yet luxurious getaway. The rooms are super comfy and offer awesome city views. But what sets this place apart is its focus on wellness. Their gym is fully equipped for a killer workout, whether you’re into cardio or strength training. Afterward, you can relax in their fantastic sauna, the perfect way to rejuvenate.

Now, let’s not forget about the restaurant. It’s not your typical hotel dining experience. They serve up seriously delicious and healthy options that make you feel good about what you’re eating. Plus, the staff here is super friendly and attentive, going out of their way to make sure you have a great stay. Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards is a well-rounded wellness retreat in the heart of the city.

title: Awesome rooms and restaurant
text: Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards is a cool spot for a getaway. The rooms are comfy and have great city views. Their restaurant is awesome too, with tasty and healthy food options. The staff is friendly and takes good care of you. If you want a chill place to stay or dine, this is it!

title: Excellent experience
text: The Equinox is a perfect hotel for those traveling for business or wanting a break from busy life. Dan the front desk agent is incredibly attentive and kind. As well as Norman the bellman, and everyone else on the Equinox team. job well done. Will be returning in the future

title: Sleek but sterile
text: This hotel might be a fit for some, but for me it was missing the warmth and luxury of a five star hotel.  Here are the misses: you enter the hotel from a narrow entrance into a dark elevator bank (there isn't a lobby).  Check-in is on the 25th floor. After check in you take another smaller elevator up to your room.  Anytime you want to leave your room you are two elevator rides away.  The restaurant is nice, but it is one floor below the 25th, so again - not easy to slide in and have a drink like you would in a hotel with a lobby. The rooftop bar is a no go, as all the tables were reserved the whole time we were there, even though nobody was ever seated at the reserved tables (as a hotel guest, this was very annoying). After being told there were no tables for a drink there, we seated ourselves and carried our own drinks to the "reserved table." Very strange.  On the plus side, the room was sleek and had a great view, and the shower was amazing with very high-end products.  I noticed a lot of athletes there - the gym obviously is a big focus of this hotel. While I thought the staff was great and the room was nice, this hotel just had a cold and sterile feel.  If you value your workouts though and don't mind a minimalist esthetic, this might fit your style.

title: This is it
text:
This may be my favorite hotel now. We stayed in the deluxe skyline view and the room itself was not too spacious but had everything we needed. Loved the "start-upey" minibar they had in the room with supplements and collagen creamers and all sorts of fun things. The skyline view was fantastic and while it wasn't the Vessel view, I could still see the Vessel quite well. Also liked the rituals and meditation they had on the TV.

We stayed here mostly to try out the gym and it was excellent. Classes were fantastic and we joined about 6 classes in the 4 nights we were there. Does get extremely busy at times though. We joined the cycle beats class and it was the best workout I've ever had.

If I can nitpick, and at the price they're charging I definitely can, they advertise "Dark. Quiet. Cool." Though, during the daytime, if you close the blinds, there is still a smidge of light coming from outside. I think the fitment of the blinds still allows some light in. Furthermore, I believe they should add more options to the in-room dining as we liked the healthy food options but had a difficult time figuring out what to order by the 2nd day. But they tasted pretty good.

title: WONDERFUL STAY AT EQUINOX
text:
I always loved to come back stay at equinox. Feels like home. Everytime I have trip in newyork, always stay at equinox. They have complete from experience until wellnes or lifestyle. 

The one and only NATHAN is very helpful with all my experience for stay in equinox. Thank you for always be there for me Nathan. Ur the best one that equinox have.

title: Excellent option for business people that like to exercise
text:
Excellent hotel. 
New facilities and great environment.
Focus on a gym / healthy offer for guests.

Stayed 4 nights and had a great time.
The Electric Lemon restaurant and bar was great. Top food and great environment.

Congrats to the Equinox team. I hope you had more hotels.

title: Loved cryo at the spa!
text: I am a gym member and wanted to try cryotherapy. I have some injuries and felt brand new right after the therapy. I really loved it!  The cryo girl was very knowledgeable and nice. Already planning my next appt!

title: Spa at Equinox Hotel - staff make it shine
text:
My friend and I got massages and spent a few hours at the Equinox Spa in Hudson Yards. I knew about the hotel, gym, and pool, but didn't know there was such a great spa facility in the hotel as well. 

Its an incredibly well-run facility; from the moment you enter the spa area, you're warmly greeted and taken care of by friendly front desk spa staff. A quick check in, confirmation of services, and you're taken back to the nicely appointed locker rooms to change. The locker rooms were also super super clean - staff were constantly moving through to make sure the locker room stayed spotless.

My massage was with Kaysla - a fantastic therapist, who listened carefully to my requests and pointed out a few areas of tightness that she worked out with ease. The hour went fast, and I really wished I had booked a longer session.

After the massage we hung out in the relaxing lounge, which faces west with views of the Hudson.  I really liked the way the lounge was set up, with semi-private areas and privacy curtains. While we were hanging out in the lounge, the staff that checked us in came by regularly with offers of water/drinks and food, and they were very accommodating of our dietary requests. In addition, the staff were super helpful in setting up other services that we hadn't booked in advance, but were available same day.

I was very happy with our visit to the spa. As nice as the facilities are, the spa staff are really what made the place shine. Every single person we encountered was very professional, well trained, friendly, and helpful without being pushy in the least. I was surprised to learn later that the spa was very booked that day - the way that the staff managed the flow of clients made us feel like we were among a limited few who had been granted access. Shout out to Jonah, Corey, and Angel for really doing a great job!

title: Amazing experience at Equinox thanks to Nathan - GM
text: We had the most extraordinary time in New York and a large portion of it was due to the amazing customer service and dedication we received at Equinox Hotel NY. Specifically Nathan Loga, the GM, made the trip memorable at every step. He ensured that we were well taken care of and remained available to assist with anything our group needed. We will absolutely be back and are in hopes that Nathan will be around to make the next trip as amazing as the last.

title: CAMERE E POSIZIONE OTTIME, MA LA LOCATION IN FONDO NON RISULTA ESCLUSIVA …
text:
Come da titolo. Dopo varie visite ad alberghi top nelle zone di Mid Town e Central Park, questa volta opziono la visita in questo albergo nel nuovo cuore delle città … ovvero Hudson Yard district.
Si trova all’interno di un torre in ottima posizione ( a fianco del Vessel e senza costruzioni davanti verso l’Hudson River ) ottima anche la vista verso Lower Manhattan & Financial District.
L’albergo è posizionato tra i piani 25 e 38 ( sopra ci sono altre residence per altri 20 piani almeno ) mentre al piano 5° è sita la SPA mentre al 4° trovate la famosa palestra che attribuisce il nome all’albergo ed all’omonima catena.
In ogni piano troviamo circa 10 camere per un totale di 10 piani di albergo.
Ingresso ed accoglienza : premetto che come già segnalato da altri valenti recensori , l’ingresso è molto/troppo anonimo ( è come un ingresso di un qualsiasi condominio moderno ) ed è in comune con tutte le persone che si recano in palestra o al ristorante/bar al piano 24.
Ci sono solo 2 ascensori ( tra l’altro molto lenti ) per l’accesso alla reception al piano 25 quindi si crea una grande promiscuità (al limite della gazzarra in certi orari ) con le persone non residenti in albergo.
Anche gli ascensori per accedere alla camere sono solo 2 ed anch’essi sono molto leniti.
Accoglienza molto cordiale anche se la reception sembra anch’essa non essere adeguata al rating/prezzo pagato ( comunque buona esperienza ) 
Plus della location : 
•	Posizione e contesto 
•	Connessioni con metro purple a 2 minuti e vicinissimo a Penn Station
•	Camera favolosa come disposizione , design , stile , materiali , rivestimenti , letto , 
•	Bagno valido , molto valida la doccia con 2 soffioni e doccetta, 
•	TV e Wi-Fi prestazionali (quasi 100 mb in up & down per acceso interent ) 
•	Palestra mega 
Minus della location : 
•	Ingresso ed ascensori ( come già spiegato ) 
•	Pressione acqua inaccettabile 
•	Zona piscina , essendo in comune con la palestra , è una grande baraonda … risulta inutilizzabile ai comuni mortali ! 
•	Rapporto qualità/prezzo non proporzionato ai servizi resi 
Conclusioni : è un poco un grande condominio di lusso … con annessa portineria … a cui si aggiunge una super palestra :)  Chiaramente se non siete interessati a quest'ultima ... beh decade molto il discorso come sola hospitality.
Comunque sia ,vista la pozione , la vista e le camere direi che questo Equinox merita “almeno” una visita.

title: Fantastic Service.
text: Excellent stay. Fantastic concierge .  Thank you Nathan. The neighborhood is very convenient.  Great restaurants in proximity.  The bar and restaurant offers great ambience.  Will definitely visit again.

title: Best hotel I have ever stayed in
text: I’m counting the days to come back to NY and Equinox Hotel. What a spectacular room I had (and the most basic category). The view was amazing of the city and the vessel, the shower was so fancy and clean with a bench and 4 different options of a fancy brand of soap. I felt so special to stay there.  The service was so good, from the front desk to room service. Nespresso machine in the room with very thoughtful mini bar and workout equipment if wanted. The gym is the most amazing I have ever seen with 2 pools and jacuzzi. Really a dream come true! Counting the days to return…

title: Luxurious stay!
text: Wow! What an amazing hotel! We are a couple, came for 1 night and we didn’t want to leave. What a wonderful hotel and the service was spectacular. They think of every small detail. City view was amazing, velvet in the room, shower was incredible. The bed is the most comfortable and loved the separate comforters. We will not forget this night. Go spoil yourself!

title: Beautiful Setting Horrible Service
text: Behind a beautiful setting, fancy clothes and amazing views lies a terrible service, captained by a group of so called concierges of nowhere. The explanation is simple: Bad Service, the staff of Equinox do not care about people, they care about gym. Do not even think of committing my mistake. My wife and a friend stayed 11 nights in New York, paying more than US$ 900 a night and what they've got? Nothing at all. If the management team has a little notion of what running a 5-star hotel is, they should take note of two lessons: firstly: buy Will Guidara’s book - Unreasonable Hospitality (so they may start learning something) and secondly (most important) go to the Carlyle Hotel and learn the meaning of going beyond. They will be more than happy to name the people behind this terrible experience. (if the management team wants to know – which I doubt). Former Guest reservation last name: Gennari from august 18 to august 29.

title: Don’t bother staying here.
text: Really disappointed with my stay here. The servers were absolutely brilliant, but it felt like anyone above that station was just disinterested and less than helpful. Front desk was totally ineffective and took three days of me asking them for developments to even address the problem. I was quoted a fee by the concierge of $210 for a pick up from the airport, I have it in writing, they ended up charging nearly double that and then did not refund me the entire fee that I overpaid, even though they admitted fault. I queued for ages to get into Electric Lemon while loads of servers were standing around chatting at the back, and was ignored in favour of the men who were standing behind me… I found the atmosphere pretty toxic to be honest. For a place that promotes health and wellness, it all seems very surface deep.  Style over substance. No heart or soul. Everybody is really courteous and helpful until you actually get there. It feels as though once they’ve got your money, they don’t give a toss.  I would’ve given two stars-but the servers were so lovely.

title: Best in class team! Super high-end!
text: Hotel is amazing- they thought of everything!  The highlight of the stay was Andy D: he was my first contact upon arrival- helpful, quick, communicative, and anticipated my needs before I asked or thought about it! He also helped to make me feel welcome and important!! Excellent, competent Client-focused team members are rare to have-he is a GEM!

title: best NY experience for a real NYer
text:
just to start, im born and raised in ny and usually always disappointed with hotels in NY cause i get treated like a tourist. this was absolutely notlhe VIP of VIPs and made sure everything was taken care of personally herselfla
besides the entire experience being health forward it was fully catered to my  experience, from the bell staff bringing my bags up to the room service. i never usually leave reviews but this was worth it for sure..

title: Great stay at Equinox Hudson Yards NYC
text: I enjoyed an excellent 3 nights stay at Equinox Hudson Yards! From checkin at the front desk, to the great Gym facilities as well as the Spa experience (customized 60 mins) up to my dinner at Electric Lemon Lounge near the fireplace it was just wonderful. You feel taken care of by the entire team and the Spa is a hidden secret if you need a rest from busy New York! Also the neighbourhood shows some nice authentic NY restaurants in walking distance along the Highline.

title: Home away from home
text: Everything was great and the staff all around was friendly and professional. We visited the pool and the sauna in the spa, the Broken Coconut, and the Electric Lemon for drinks at night and breakfast in the AM. The spa area and pool were extremely clean and the rooms were beautiful and filled with anything you could imagine needing. Overall 11/10 experience.

title: NYC
text:
La posizione e’ per me eccellente, leggermente defilato quindi molto tranquillo, vicino a Penn Station e di fronte ad Hudson Yards. Ideale per chi ha già visitato NYC e non vuole necessariamente essere vicino a Times Sq., V ave, ecc.ecc.
Stile moderno, camere arredate con gusto minimalista e attenzione ai dettagli. Dai piani alti bel panorama su Hudson o sulla città. Colazione con vista su The Vessel…anche se attorno ci sono molti bar in alternativa.
Servizio molto cordiale e attento, a NYC non è da dare per scontato.

title: Très bel hotel mais prestations piscines décevantes
text:
L’hôtel est globalement très beau, les chambres joliment décorées et la vue dégagées (l’hôtel commence au 25ème étage). De ce point de vue là, l'expérience était vraiment top. Le restaurant pour le petit déjeuner et le déjeuner était super aussi: service extrêmement sympathique et nourriture bonne et healthy.
L'expérience reste néanmoins mitigée car l’hôtel semble "cohabiter" avec la salle de gym et le bar. Le soir du 4 juillet, nous avons souhaité prendre un verre vers 22h30. Personne n'était à l'accueil du bar, donc après 5min nous avons pris la liberté d'aller nous assoir sur un canapé. Pendant 15min nous n'avons pas vu un serveur, et après 20min un serveur est allé voir un couple s'étant assis près de nous en leur disant que c'était fermé et qu'il ne pouvait pas commander... mais ferait une exception pour eux, le tout en nous tournant le dos et nous ignorant somptueusement.
Nous avons essayé d'aller prendre un verre sur la terrasse que l'on voit sur les photos (et qui n'a plus la sculpture en maille de fer d'ailleurs), mais celle ci était toujours fermé pour prendre un verre (donc uniquement accessible pour prendre des photos).
Enfin, le plus problématique est le lien avec club de sport: l’hôtel laisse penser qu'il dispose d'une belle piscine et d'une belle terrasse. C'est effectivement le cas, mais le club est aussi accessible à des centaines de personnes. Résultat une piscine bondée et des matelas indisponibles. Le prix et le standing de l’hôtel mériterait que à minima il soit possible de réserver des places en priorité en tant que résident de l’hôtel.
L'accès est aussi peu pratique, il y a 2 ascenseurs qui desservent la salle de sport et l’hôtel (puis il y a un nouvel ascenseur dans l’hôtel). dont un était en panne... donc attente de 5min minimum à chaque déplacement.

title: Serenity
text: This hotel is top of the line amazing. Starting with the staff, they are all so friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms are beautiful, they are so elegantly designed and the details are all on point. We started at the pool with a cold plunge & then a margarita poolside. 10/10. Then we hit the spa and sauna which was very very clean. The spa staff was so extremely attentive and kind. It’s amazing how calm and peaceful this NYC hotel is. It’s a break from the hustle and bustle of the city into this extremely relaxing palace of a hotel. I can’t say enough about this place, I could go on for hours talking about it !!!!! HIGHLY RECCOMEND!!!!

title: We had a great time at the Equinox Hotel last weekend.
text:
The room was wonderful. One sleep setting on the iPad controls the temperature, lights, and black-out window shade. There is a Nespresso coffeee maker in the room with an assortment of coffees to choose from. My wife and I both felt the bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever slept in.

The restaurant was great. We really enjoyed drinking palomas on the open terrace as the sun set over the Hudson River. Spectacular. We also had smoothies at the Broken Coconut, next to the pool.

The fitness facilities, as you would expect, are fantastic. The equipment in the gym is state of the art and they have some of the best instructors anywhere to lead you through the various classes. I came home rejuvenated and inspired.

title: STAYCATION SENSATION
text:
Once again, Equinox Hotel and most notably it’s very well-trained and in-tune management team and staff, over delivers the high performance that New Yorkers demand. On several occasions, I stay, play and recover at this hotel, even though I live full time in New York. It’s the best STAYCATION destination in one of the busiest cities in the world. Immediately when you walk into the room it is calming and quiet, from the rich colour palette to the detailed design of the lighting. Layers begin to shed off immediately. One of the best features of the rooms is the sheer silence they offer. The epitome of quiet luxury. The COCOMAT bed with crisp white Egyptian Matouk sheets are in and of themselves exceptional; the blackout night time feature that orchestrates the cold sleeping temperature and virtual sound proofing; and incredible shower and room standard signature A.M. and P.M. product offerings stand out as highlights. For an additional splurge the room curated mini bar which goes well beyond a mini bar offering eye masks, tinctures, sports wear has you googling products to get more of these rare finds. 

The team is very aware of guests needs and moods, leaving you be with the right amount of space and interacting and engaging when necessary. Kudos to Nathan for creating an environment with such a strong sense of respite. They get every detail right — they even asked about my ETA to ensure my special request to be able to work privately from my room was ready when I walked into the door — so I didn’t miss a beat — or an email. 

This is a wonderfully designed hotel with seamlessly executed operations for any type of trip, I highly recommend it for a 3-day STAYCATION in New York so you can fully immerse yourself and escape out of the urban jungle and into the urban oasis. I can’t wait for my next sojourn at Equinox Hotel New York to explore the amenities further.

title: Amazing experience
text: The hotel was in mint condition. We were welcomed and felt like family from the second we arrived. Very friendly staff and an incredible view from the room. Amazing experience.  The spa was the best I’ve ever been too as well. I did the MXL i3 Dome treatment and it was life changing.

title: Must in NYC
text: Fascinating Hotel and stay. Amazing service and hosts. Location is great. Amenities were provided. The personnel is very polity.  Restaurant experience in Electric Lemon was also good. Will come again!

title: New New York at its best
text: We enjoyed a delightful evening at the Equinox Hotel, discovering both Electric Lemon the restaurant for dinner but also getting a sneak peek at the hotel thanks to the leadership present who invited to discover. The service was excellent for our group, personalized, elegant and warm. We got to discover the all range that the menu offers in a sharing approach suggested by the team for our group. The location is incredible and the view spectacular.

title: Best hotel in NYC.
text: This is by far my favorite hotel in New York City. I love the location right at the start of the high line and across the Vessel at Hudson Yards. Reception is on the 25th floor with all the rooms above which gives every room a great view and has a very Tokyo-like feel. The staff is super welcoming and professional. The rooms are amazing havens away from the bustling city. Everything is designed to soothe and comfort with a huge emphasis on fitness. Access to the Equinox gym is complimentary and every amenity is geared towards wellness, including two types of body wash - one for AM and one for PM, both by Grown Alchemist. The hotel is great for business travel and couples - every family I saw there looked thrilled to be there. Truly a gem in the city.

title: Arrival to Departure excellent - thank you
text:
I just got home from a week long stay at the Equinox in Chelsea. We stayed in a Premier King, which I can recommend as this room is very spacious and has (ours did) views of the Hudson river. This hotel makes a big deal about the soundproofing of their rooms, and the total blackout shades that help guests fall asleep and stay asleep. 
I will say this: two things I never knew I needed in New York and now I cannot imagine a stay without them! It makes a massive difference: this is the first stay away from home in decades where I actually felt "well". Dare I say it! But its true. My husband and I both slept like rocks, we ate like kings (we only ate at the in-house restaurant, Electric Lemon), and felt able to more quickly get over our jet lag than usual. 
The rooms are soothing decor-wise, and the sofa in our room was comfy enough to literally sit there and work all day. Wifi is pretty good. As said, beds  very comfortable. The only niggle is that I usually really enjoy a neck supportive pillow, which did not seem to be on offer at Equinox. On day 3 we did get a firm non-feather pillow but this is not the same. In fact, it was unfortunately too firm, so I ended up putting a bath towel over the sofa pillow and sleeping like this. 
Also, at this room level, there are no tubs in the bathing area - only a really good shower. I am a bath person so I did miss this but I found I still got a great cleaning experience, especially with all the fantastic Grown Alchemist products - heaven. 
But back to the FoOd... its so good. Its so so so good. Its all clean eating too, so you never feel like even though you just got grilled chicken and veg, that it was cooked in so much butter and oil that you just feel bloated anyway. Some standouts are: avocado toast (yes its had its day but when done correctly is great), the beauty bowl - fantastic - the fresh pressed juices are actually pressed freshly, very good - the halibut, the sea bream, the chicken (but its a large piece, dont get this if you arent really hungry), and the standout was the cauliflower flatbread. 
I also took a private pilates lesson with Annie and it was a very very good lesson. the studio is excellent and has all equipment in it. I took a private next to another person and we ended up having a really nice chat afterward. 
I did not use the spa or the open gym but they were both very busy so I imagine it can't be terrible. 
The people who are working for the guests' comfort are lovely - from first arrival to departure. I cannot fault anything - I hope they like working there as much as I liked staying there. 
In fact, there is really only one negative for me - and it may not be a negative point for everyone. I actually think I am alone on this one judging by my observations. It is way way way too cold in this hotel. I got sick from eating in the restaurant because the air blows directly down on diners. Every time I walked out of our room I had to have on a sweater. To go from that to sweltering New York heat cannot possibly be healthy. 
The reason I say I am alone is that every single other guest was wearing shorts or sleeveless tops etc., and did seem quite comfortable. I hardly saw anyone shivering, except me. So if you have a fast metabolism this is your place :)
All in all I am definitely coming back. This is a great hotel and I hope they do not change anything - except pillow question and 3 degrees higher on the airco. 
Can absolutely recommend!

title: Equinox stay
text:
I had the best stay at the Equinox Hotel. I couldn't believe the stunning view from my room and the wonderful sunrise is as well. Pre ordering breakfast makes it for such a convenient stay where you don't have to worry about anything. It was delicious and they even call you to let you know it is ready. It has a gym and spa so even perfect for staycations.

 It is so close to everything you need in the city as well! Would definitely recommend it to everyone coming for work or tourism!

title: The absolute best
text: This hotel is the absolute best!  The rooms are beautiful and spacious especially according to NY standards.  The bed and linens are extremely soft and luxurious.  The staff is top notch including the restaurant.  I will definitely stay here every chance I get.

title: Great experience
text: Me and my husband decided to elop instead of throwing a big wedding. Equinox Hotel was always a place I wanted to try out. So we decided to have staycation on our elopement weekend. The room is very spacious and very quiet, so it’s hard to believe you are in Manhattan. Window shades are such a must have. Overall experience was fantastic! We had lunch at the Electric Lemon and dinner at the Peak. A lot of great restaurant options in the area. We also had infrared sauna appointment at the spa and staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. The spa has a lot of interesting treatments and we definitely will come back!

title: 5-Star Until An Issue Comes Up
text:
While I usually stay at the Pendry, I decided to give the Equinox Hotel a try.

I booked a 3-night stay. The hotel is extremely nice, and the location is incredible, right in the middle of Hudson Yards. I was offered early check-in and a room upgrade which was absolutely fantastic.
 
On my last night there, I was looking for the remote control to turn the TV off on my way out of the room. I moved the comforter and noticed what was clearly a blood stain toward the foot of the bed. It is obviously gross and definitely not ok, but stuff happens — let’s just get it replaced and move on. I was on a call so I didn’t get to call downstairs, I just activated the “make up room” button so housekeeping would clean the room (I left the stain visible). I got back to the room around 1 am and saw the room made up but the stain was still there — again, no problem, I realize I didn’t call to explicitly request new sheets (though I thought they’d be replaced) but let’s get it fixed. 

I called downstairs and Christian apologized but said due to the time he could only deliver me sheets but nobody could put them on. My biggest question: what 5-star hotel asks me to replace my sheets that they left blood on rather than offer me a different room or frankly anything else as an apology? The gentlemen who brought them to the room was kind enough to put them on for me and took the dirty sheets. Christian gave me his email and told me to email him pictures and he’d have management get back to me the next day. Upon checkout, they offered me no explanation (though they did as if I was sure it wasn’t my blood) but said someone would get back to me that day. They did let me know that they don't replace sheets during your stay so I slept on that stain for 2 nights. It’s now been 2 days and I haven’t heard back though I’ve followed up via email — in fact, I forwarded the initial email to the manager's email on their website, but this email address gets bounced back. 

All of this to say, what truly differentiates a good hotel from a great one is how you treat your guests, and how you handle issues that arise.

I’m disappointed to even have to write this review because stuff happens, but the lack of follow-through, or even response, from management proves to me that while this may be a great hotel 90% of the time when things are going smoothly, it certainly can’t be categorized as a 5-star hotel when an issue arises. If you’re looking for a 5-star service experience, look elsewhere.

title: Restful with great food
text: We stay here frequently and always have a wonderful experience. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are cool and completely dark at night (many other hotels are in prewar buildings in NYC and the rooms get hot). The staff, from the warm and efficient reception to the attentive Electric Lemon servers and exceptionally courteous valet/bell staff, always make our stay delightful.  Room service also has great healthy, satisfying options and are served in beautiful metal bento boxes.

title: Everything and more
text:
From the moment I arrived, I was in awe of the attention to detail and the modern yet inviting ambiance. The impeccable service made my stay truly exceptional.

The room was a true escape and unlike any other hotel room I've stayed in. It was spacious, had great views, and was super intuitive with buttons like "Dark Quiet Cool" that set your room up for ideal sleeping conditions. I think it's the best I've slept in a long time. It was hard to resist using everything "RoomBar" - I did have one of the Via Carota Craft Cocktails, which was such a delightful surprise as well as the sleep mask (which I kept and still use nightly). 

Equinox Hudson Yards was unlike any other hotel gym experience. The group classes were amazing and it was so nice to feel motivated to work out while traveling. The scene was great too, I loved being ingrained in the local community. 

I couldn't resist taking advantage of the innovative spa treatments I've heard about everywhere. I did cryotherapy, the spa wave table, and Icoone and loved them all. 

The hotel's central location made getting around the city a breeze, even though I didn't want to leave the property in the first place. 

Best hotel in NYC! I am counting down the days until my return!

title: The best hotel in New York for business travel!
text: Equinox Hotel is a true oasis for the busy business traveler and has become the only hotel my colleagues and I will visit while in New York.  The entire team, from guest services, to reception, to concierge, to the bell desk is kind and hospitable, and always willing to go the extra mile to make our visits comfortable and first-class.  The bath & wellness amenities, access to the state-of-the-art gym, and different options for lighting mean that it's possible to return from a business trip feeling better than when we arrived.  The views are spectacular too!  I would highly recommend a visit to this property.

title: Pool crowded, need a reservation for drinks.
text: The Hotel facility was beautiful. And the valets were very helpful during our check-in and stay.  The pool was disappointing. They sell “club” memberships to the pool and clearly a lot of them, so don’t be fooled by photos of the peaceful pool on their website. It was more like Hugh Hefners pool at the Playboy Mansion. Overly crowded, bodies on every inch of the cement around the pool and no chairs to be had for all three days of our stay.  Additionally, the restaurant , Electric Lemon, is featured on their website but is independent of the hotel and they feel no obligation to accommodate the hotel guests, which was made very clear by the nasty hostess.  We purchased drinks and then were never able to get a seat. Every table in the lounge and outdoor patio was marked reserved,  you need a reservation even for drinks.  We watched this ridiculous parade of girls staging photos for Instagram all being accommodated while those of us paying $1000.00+ a night were out of luck.  Also, there was a very extensive mini bar in our room, but it left no refrigerator space for our dessert we brought back from the restaurant for later.  No flat sheet on the bed, just a duvet but for us it was too warm.

title: Above and beyond
text: I had been dying to stay at the hotel and had high expectations but it was beyond all I expected! By far the best hotel in nyc. Spa is amazing , rooms are big and comfortable, great detox treatment . All around great experience. Obviously the gym is espectacular.

title: No running water
text:
The property itself is nice. On the last day (7/30), all water was shut off with no warning. No running shower, sink, or toilet. I called guest services who said they were aware and would update me. Received no update. When the water finally did come back on, it ran with a tinge of yellow/black. At checkout, the front desk staff never even mentioned the water issue - no apologies, no asking how our stay was.

As a cherry on top, we were guaranteed a 4pm reservation, but our card key stopped working for our room and elevator at 1pm. 

You trust a 5 star property to get the details right. This wasn’t it. Imagine paying over $1,000 per night and having to wash your face in the morning with bottled water.

title: Not the best at all in the luxury category.
text:
I second comments about the outdoor pool.  It is ridiculous. Crowded is an understatement. The most ridiculous is that there is a “waiting list” for the pool chairs. Yup. Despite many being open, it’s not first come first served.  You will be called upon to leave the chair if you just assume it’s first come first served. For the nightly rate the EQX hotel goes for you have better options in NYC.  

Plus, when I arrived for a spa treatment, there was nobody on the ground floor entrance to direct me where to go. As a gym member (not at this location though) I knew where to go by reading online. Note that despite many EQX Clubs give you gym access if you book a spa treatment, the Hudson Yards/hotel does not extend the same grace.  You can buy a day pass for $100 though. Other locations in NYC charge different for a day pass too. 

All in all, I felt sorry for guests who pay to stay at the hotel but may not be able to enjoy the facilities with ease as a hotel guest in such category of hotel would expect. 

Do not recommend.

title: Fantastic weekend away
text:
I took a quick trip to New York and stayed at the Equinox Hotel. The staff was so helpful from Andy on the bell team, Hobie at the front desk who was able to get my pillows traded out for firmer ones and the concierge team was really helpful with making recommendations for some great restaurants and making reservations for me. I also really appreciated that even though I was early, I was able to check in and my room was ready for me.

I thought the room was really spacious for a New York hotel, and the shower was fantastic! It was also incredibly quiet and I got a fantastic nights sleep. I loved that there was a nesspresso in the room, if only I could drink my coffee black.

title: Not to be missed!
text:
After visiting a friend who was staying at the hotel, I couldn't wait to try it out for myself. It's safe to say that I was blown away by my experience. 

From the beautifully-designed and well-appointed guest room and the excellent choices of breakfast dishes at Electric Lemon, to the access to the splendid rooftop pool and super-friendly, professional staff, a stay at the Equinox Hotel really has it all. 

I cannot wait to visit again the next time I'm in the city!

title: For people who want it all...
text: I felt like a new person after staying at the Equinox. Extremely reinvigorating & comfortable, you're able to relax in luxury. The sleep system is a must. I would highly recommend trying the Electric Lemon, the option for in room dining all from the touch of an iPad was one of my favorite parts aside from all the amenities the hotel has to offer. Staff is top tier! Everywhere you go, you're treated personally. All in all, if I am traveling to New York I'm staying at the Equinox, there is no comparison. Again, big thank you to the staff & VP Nathan, we appreciate you & look forward to our next trip!

title: Ein Traumhotel!
text: Das Hotel, die Zimmer und die Aussicht sind wirklich ein Traum. Das Personal war kompetent, sehr freundlich und stets bemüht. Wir kommen jederzeit wieder und können das Hotel uneingeschränkt weiterempfehlen.

title: Fantastic Staycation at the Equinox Hotel
text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Equinox Hotel New York, for a brief staycation and I was absolutely blown away by the experience. The service was impeccable, the rooms were comfortable, and the amenities were top-notch.

We arrived at the hotel just in time for check-in, and we were greeted immediately by a friendly doorman who helped us with our luggage and brought it up to the lobby. The check in process was quick and easy, and I was immediately impressed by the luxurious lobby. The hotel is located in the heart of Hudson Yards, so it’s perfectly situated for exploring all that New York City has to offer. 

My room was spacious and well-appointed, with a comfortable bed (double duvets!), a large bathroom, and a beautiful view of both the city and the river. Many of the electronics in the room can be activated with the in-room iPad. The amenities were also top-notch, including a Nespresso machine, a minibar, and a variety of wellness items such as a complementary yoga mat and skin care. 

In the morning we ordered from the hotel's extensive in-room dining menu. The menu boasts a variety of options ranging from health conscious smoothies, eggs, pastries, and many vegan/vegetarian options. The food arrived promptly - coffee was warm and the food was delicious. 

After breakfast we  headed to the hotel's gym, which is one of the most impressive I've ever seen. The facility is massive, and it has everything you could possibly need to get a great workout. We were able to book a cycling class at the concierge desk. It was a great way to start the morning. I also took advantage of the hotel's spa, which offers a wide variety of treatments. I had a customized facial, and it was one of the best I've ever had.

We had dinner at the hotel's restaurant, Electric Lemon, and the food was absolutely delicious. The service was also excellent, and I felt like I was truly being pampered.

Overall, my stay at the Equinox Hotel New York was absolutely amazing. The service was impeccable, the rooms were comfortable, and the amenities were top-notch. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and unforgettable experience in New York City.

title: Our Second Visit!
text:
This was our second visit to the Equinox Hotel Hudson Yards and it continues to deliver and impress.  From the moment we drove up and were greeted within seconds at our vehicle, to the fast and easy checkout with the reception staff, our stay could not have been better.  We love the hotel's design, the extensive room amenities, Grown Alchemist toiletries, and especially the double duvets!  What is also super impressive is just how cool, dark, and quiet the rooms are at night which means an amazing sleep experience considering you're in the heart of NYC.  

Every detail seems to have been thought of and the entire hotel staff treat each guest like they're the only person staying at the hotel.  Room service comes super fast and the food always arrives at the temperature it's meant to be - no soggy fries here!

Of course the gym, pool, rooftop bar and dining, and spa are incredible - as you would expect from Equinox.  

This was definitely a 10/10 experience and we can't wait to come back soon!

title: Equinox Spa is Great
text: Thank you Melissa! She helped my boyfriend plan my spa day. From the minute you are greeted to the moment you leave, the customer service is excellent. The spa is clean and relaxing. I recommend getting a facial.

title: Equinox Hotel
text:
Amazing concept luxury  hotel with on site top notch gym, pool, spa, rooftop dining.  Immaculate corner suite with amazing views, terrific amenities and super comfortable firm mattress. Loved the soaps stocked in hotel bathrooms, robes, double duvets, blackout remote controlled shades, rain bath shower. 

Big shout out to Dan on 25th floor, who was there for our every request with warmth and sincerity. He is AMAZING.

Also shout out to the concierge team, Carlos and Tyrone who sent us to amazing food in town!

Michael greeted us in the lobby with such enthusiasm that we were practically dancing in the lobby.. so excited!! And Angel was able to hold our bags while we went to see a show on our last day.. as close to perfection at  a hotel as it gets! 

I willl be back!

title: Perfect couple getaway
text: We loved everything about staying here. Probably the softest pillows and comforter I’ve slept on, very luxurious and modern feel to the entire room. The staff were on point and made the experience that much better. My favorite part was having the full gym and all of its amenities for our use as well.

title: Definitely going back!
text: The staff was super friendly and very accommodating for business! I will definitely be going back to the Equinox Hotel New York. I highly recommend staying there whether it be for a night on a quick business trip or a getaway with friends or family!

title: A Must Stay in NYC
text: Terrific experience! Great hotel & location with an amazing and very accommodating staff! The staff really goes above and beyond to ensure you have the best stay possible and makes this a must stay for any trip out to NYC

title: New favorite hotel in NYC
text: We had another amazing stay at the Equinox hotel.   We booked 3 rooms for a special occasion, and the staff totally went out of their way to make us feel at home.  Aliana ensured our rooms were next to each other and sent up something special for my daughter's birthday.  Jared and Jason at the front desk were also super friendly and helpful, as were Mark, Andy, Michael, Joshua and Brian at the bell stand, and Nicola at the hostess stand and wait staff at Electric Lemon (which was excellent).  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the gym is amazing!  It is our new favorite hotel in NYC and we will be back soon.
