title: Love Equinox Hotel! Worth the splurge!!!
text: Perfect place for a getaway in the city 💕 Love this hotel, especially, the river view rooms! Kudos to the housekeeping team; they are good at what they do. Love the room amenities, too! The only hotel I will stay at whenever I am in NYC! Thank you for a memorable stay Equinox Hotel!

title: Heaven in Hudson Yards
text: Equinox always gets all of the details right. Electric Lemon is the only time I’ve enjoyed dining at a hotel. The gym is a work of art. The pool deck is a whole vibe.  I would stay here every night if I could.

title: Great Hotel, Terrible Senior Staff
text:
I've been a long-time patron of this hotel's amenities. The Electric Lemon restaurant is fantastic, the spa is a great place to visit (cryo-treatments, nutrient injections, IVs, thermal sauna, etc.), but recently had an incredibly negative experience with Nathan Loga, the hotel's VP of Guest Experience.

While waiting in the lobby on my laptop for some colleagues for an Electric Lemon afternoon bite, an employee approached and said I need to move locations as they're "concerned about damage to the couch" I was sitting on. I was frankly quite confused, as I was sitting normally, had normal clothes on, and always sit here while waiting in the lobby. I dug in a bit and the employee told me "nevermind" and left. He came back about 10 minutes later, apologized, and said that Nathan Loga, their VP of Guest Relations, asked that I leave. Bare in mind many people are sitting in the area, a couple of which mentioned they were also just waiting to eat downstairs.

The employee said he's not sure what the real reason is, and that he feels bad. Even offered me a free drink at the bar. I asked to speak to the mysterious man behind the curtain (Nathan Loga) who was evicting me from the lobby, but he "suddenly became tied up in a meeting and wouldn't be free for a couple of hours."

As a weekly patron of this hotel and a very quiet / clean person, the experience was disappointing and offensive. I won't be returning here for food, drinks, or spa treatments ever again, and I'm cancelling my Equinox gym membership to move elsewhere. Treatment like that of patrons is never acceptable and shouldn't be tolerated.

title: World class concierge
text: Second visit in six weeks. These guys are good. Carlos at concierge is World  Class. Rooms are fab, views exceptional. Gym has a good vibe. The place feels safe too. The entrance is low key, almost inconspicuous but once you get to the reception on 25th floor you really do feel like you’ve entered a different world. We got off a long flight from Vegas  which was delayed, fought through the chaos of getting an Uber at JFK on a Sunday night  and felt like we were in our happy place and relaxed as soon as we got to the Equinox.

title: Not LUXURY service at all
text: After living in Europe for the last twenty years and seeing real luxury this is hotel should not consider itself LUXURY. I went for the conference with associates and we had the worst experience. The staff does not fit the bill and has no connection skills. The room was only average at best and the beds were horrible. The double duvet thing tries to hard and lacks luxury all around. The desk staff  were that of a motel staff and one lady manger was of the class we expected named Mary I think but this place is nothing short of an overpriced place with no real posh style. The Lemons restaurant was very good but the service there too was that of a cheap diner.

title: Full on luxury and fitness experience
text:
I recently stayed at the Equinox Hotel, and was absolutely delighted in every way. 

The room was impeccably clean, and the shower experience itself was a revelation. Spacious, with luxurious fixtures and great water pressure, it offered a blissful experience after a strenuous workout, or a long day exploring the city.

I also appreciated the exceptional gym facilities. As a fitness enthusiast, finding a hotel that caters to my workout needs is always a priority, and Equinox exceeded my expectations in every way. I look forward to return again. 

It was evident that the housekeeping staff takes great pride in their work.

title: FULL ON WELLNESS RESORT TOUCH AND FEEL
text: Amazing Amazing Spot seriously Sagar is great and the staff is phenominal... got a suite - expensive but GREAT SERVICE... it feels like you're in a spa from the moment you walk in which is the important part. Electric Lemon breakfast lunch and dinner can't go wrong, workout anytime, drinks on the patio overlooking the water - highly recommend.

title: Great place to stay in NYC!
text:
Awesome hotel!
Clean and well staffed. Very quiet and comfortable room. Not large, but well-appointed with really nice bathroom.  Bed was very comfortable.
Good, safe location and professional and friendly staff.
Best part may be the free access to the amazing fitness facility, including a nice 25 yard lap pool

title: Spa Heaven with the best staff ever!!
text: I visited the Spa here twice, once on Friday and once on Sunday. I thought I had died and gone to Spa Heaven, honestly. The staff could not be more friendly and accommodating, and even helped me out when the Sunday Motorcycle Parade delayed my arrival time Sunday! They made adjustments for me so that I could get almost all of my infrared sauna time in before the next client arrived. Jose’ in the service/bathroom area was marvelous, as were Jonathan and Melissa at the front desk. I highly highly highly recommend visiting and trying out the infrared sauna treatment, as well as the cryotherapy treatment. Amenities, including dry sauna, showers, shampoos, conditioners, body washes, deodorants, and body creams are all complimentary and produced by the hotel’s own line — luxurious and invigorating on all fronts! The waiting room is soothing, beautifully decorated, and filled with vegan snacks, organic teas, and lemon-ice water with their own personal black water bottles. You cannot ask for a more luxurious and calming experience!!! Five stars!!! I will definitely go back when I’m in town!! 👍👍

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: The founder of our company stayed here for his business trip in NY and said it was the best hotel in the entire city!!! Luxurious, comfortable, and impeccable service. This will definitely be his go-to place when visiting.

title: Perfect NYC Hotel
text:
Stayed here for Mothers Day with family.Had such a lovely time. The room was very big for a NYC hotel and super clean. Location was just simply perfect- steps away from the High Line Vessel and Hudson Yards mall. The staff is super helpful and knowledgeable. Electric Lemon had amazing service and menu offerings. Appreciated the staff accommodating a large group on short notice. 
Will be staying here again.

title: Definitely Skip the Spa
text:
The spa experience at Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards was not nearly luxurious enough to warrant the price tag. I paid $350 all-in for a 60 minute massage. The experience was fine but I definitely will not return. There are far better spas out there--for example, I get a full 90-minute massage at the Edition Hotel in South Beach, Miami for less and the experience is far more enjoyable and opulent. 

The equinox spa staff is very nice aside from the manager who was wildly unpleasant. The "relaxation room" isn't very relaxing when you can hear the manager screaming at her staff on the other side of the door. 

Finally, it's a huge hassle getting to Hudson Yards (from anywhere in manhattan IMO). Not worth the trouble and the trip.

title: The perfect hotel for a Mother's Day weekend with my mother and sister!
text:
I stayed at the Equinox Hotel in a two bedroom corner suite with my mother and sister (none of us teens.) The room configuration was perfect for the 3 of us, we each had enough space and our own beds!!! So many other two bedroom suites are often equipped with only a king in each room so this hotel started our perfectly for our needs. 
Prior to my arrival, I called the hotel for some last minute requests, which they handled quickly without sending me off to different departments, I really appreciated the efficiency in the handled request. The room itself was beautiful and comfortable, my mother and sister loved it. The location in Hudson Yards was beyond  perfect. We walked the Highline to get every where we needed (Greenwich Village, Chelsea, Meatpacking District.) We walked to the theater district for our plays and musicals. And of course we just enjoyed staying in the Hudson Yards area and enjoyed the shops and restaurants. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, always smiling. Of course, if celebrity sightings are important to you, without naming any, you will certainly bump into one or two!!! Overall this hotel was amazing and help made our trip a success!! Oh and the gym.......is a must!!!!

title: A Real 5-Star Experience
text:
I would first start off by saying I was debating to stay at the Four Seasons, Plaza or The Dominick.  When traveling to New York having a large, clean, and comfortable room is extremely important.  The Equinox exceeded my expectations in each of these categories.  The room was very large and spacious which included floor to ceiling windows.  The bedding was extremely plush with thick down pillows.  The room is extremely well thought out and includes: night lightening under the bed, a control pad to dim lights, order housekeeping, and order room service.  The room was extremely clean and well maintained by housekeeping throughout our stay.  Turndown service was included and brought ice for night caps and extra water.

The service in the hotel was at the highest for a 5 Star Hotel.  The door attendants were extremely welcoming and always went out of their was to greet you.  The housekeeping staff was extremely polite and courteous.  The restaurant staff at Electric Lemon was professional and very knowledgably about their menu.

We spoke to Nathan Loga about our stay prior to visiting NYC.  He was extremely helpful as we are expecting a child in  June.  He went out of his way to provide 5 Star Service and make this trip memorable.

I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on the fence.  It is definitely worth the nightly rate as compared to its 5 Star Peers.  We found that we enjoyed Hudson Yards in general.  The Hudson Yards development is almost 5 years old with wonderful shops, hotels, and restaurants.   It genuinely felt safe in this area of NYC.

title: Excellent spa team
text: This review is about the spa. I didn't get a chance to stay at the hotel. The spa team was excellent. I had an issue in the locker room and the manager was able to help me right away. She happened to be walking in, I guess making her rounds, and saw that I was struggling. She stopped and asked if I needed help and jumped into action. This is a testament to the quality of people working there. The gentlemen at the front desk and the attendant who gave me a tour were also very nice, polite and professional. I will be back.

title: Not so good unfortunately
text: Not the best experience overall wouldn’t spend that kind of money for this . I read it was great but not me favorable American hotel. Didn’t connect to anything here it was a blank canvas of a void me felt:

title: Expensive hotel that requires a reservation for breakfast
text: The hotel rooms are really comfortable and have great touches with the wellness routines, great beds, and beautiful views. Unfortunately, I wouldn't recommend the hotel because of the restaurant/bar which are open to the public and always packed to the point where a reservation is required for breakfast. I've never stayed at a hotel that charges $1000+ per night and that can't even seat their own hotel guests for breakfast because they've taken too many outside reservations. The hotel was also unwilling to serve breakfast in the bar/lounge area, so the only option is room service. Apparently, the restaurant is outsourced to a third party–but it creates a pretty terrible experience for those of us shelling out to stay here.

title: The best of both luxury and wellness
text: the team and staff were incredible. I told them we were celebrating an annviersary and they went all out, prepping the room with thoughtful details and touches. This is luxury and wellness in one. I was very impressed with the water fill in the room, the tech and the spa was one of the best experiences we have had. If you go to NYC there is nothing I would recommend over this place.

title: AMAZING STAY
text:
The staff, services and amenities were outstanding. The room was incredible; extremely comfortable, clean, and I couldn’t have had a better sleep! The location is also fantastic, we were walking distance from everything we wanted to do. 

The cryotherapy was like nothing I have ever done before, and I would definitely do it again! 

Equinox Hotel will now be our go-to anytime we visit New York!

title: WORST front desk and beds IN NYC
text: We did a second girls trip here and will never return. Worst service at the desk this time last year was great and lovely staff but now it’s a joke and clueless staff. Some guy yelled the wrong name when we walked by and we had to wait four hours to get towels and ice sent up cause they forgot to send it twice. The beds are the most UNCOMFORTABLE ever and slept poorly last time we had a better room not they shoved us in ten worst room with two small beds. SKIP THIS WANNABE HOTEL

title: Rock hard bed and thin bedding
text: Our room had so many extra bells and whistles but the most important thing - the BED - felt cheap!  ROCK HARD mattress with thin pillows and comforter. We asked for a mattress topper but it didn’t help much at all. Because all their bedding is so thin, if you toss it, it fills up with air but as soon as you lie down, it deflates and you’re on rock hard mattress again. Our in-room phone and iPad didn’t work, so calling room service was awkward, we had to google the hotel main number to ask for mattress topper. Would never stay here again!

title: Treat yourself and stay here!
text: The best service ever! All of the staff members were so professional, friendly and so welcoming!  The room was big and luxurious. The hotel had the wonderful scent that I can’t stop thinking about :)

title: The Spa by Equinox Hotel
text: To be clear this is a review about the SPA by Equinox.  I hope everyone takes a moment to go to the SPA.  This place is amazing.  I absolutely loved it.  I arranged a small group visit as a token of gratitude from one of the partners we support.  Jonah was wonderful providing me all the information I needed to inform everyone of our choices and what we could look forward to.  Angela greeted me so kindly and went out of her way to make sure I was comfortable.  And Raynell - Oh my gosh, Raynell gave me my first facial ever and made it the most wonderful experience.  I felt like I was glowing.  The ambience, cleanliness and overall atmosphere of the Spa was fantastic.  The whole team was so pleased with their services.  Thank you Jonah, Angela and Raynell for an amazing experience.

title: Quite special but has some drawbacks
text: This hotel is high quality but lacks the full-service requirements that you normally expect. Check-in is on the 25th floor and we stayed on the 33rd floor with a nice view of the water and rail yard. Very nice room with a lot of easy-to-work tech. A little over the top on health add-ons in the room . Bedding unusual. The gym was full and felt overwhelmed with an unwelcoming feeling. Shopping opposite

title: Great Customer Service.
text: Two years ago we spent New Year’s Eve at the penthouse. I did a private room that over looked the Hudson River. I loved it. I am a member of the gym since COVID or before where it first opened. Nobody knew about it. Now what I love the most is: the Equinox SPA there is a lovely gentleman, last name Muller and the front desk lady Melissa I believe her name is. Their customer service skills are amazing. I always go back just for them. They make me feel at home. Upstairs at the restaurant. Alan is very lovely. I could upload an entire album but I will leave these few pictures ❤️

title: Worth the splurge
text:
Great experience in Hudson Yards. 
The hotel is newer. We enjoyed the restaurant, outdoor bar and adjoining health club. It’s pricey but rooms are very quiet and comfortable. Staff is excellent. Hope to return. Try for a River view although city view is nice too. Easy access to the Highline.

title: Spa is incredible, best massage ever
text: This review is for the spa which is incredible, world class and worth the whole trip alone. Don’t get me wrong everything’s great here, the outdoor pool with the view of the shed and the vessel and the Hudson is amazing — and it’s quite nice to have a hot tub cold plunge switcheroo  situation right there— but I got a massage from Youthen that was transcendent. These people are artists, really — next level stuff. So if you are traveling and don’t have the best back this is the place to stay. Or just come for the spa tbh, if you live here. It’s worth it.

title: BEST SPA EVER!
text:
I want to start by saying this is not my first time coming to the Spa at The Equinox but I wanted to leave a review for the fantastic customer service they provide. 
From the moment I walked in, I felt like I was in a tranquil and peaceful oasis. The ambiance was perfect for relaxation and the staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating.
The spa facilities, the product choices, and the warm bed, when you are getting a facial, were top-notch. 
But the real highlight of my experience is my FAVORITE ESTHETICIAN - ALINA. I've been seeing her for a couple of years, and now that I live part-time in Paris, I still travel back to New York just to get a facial with her. I'm a huge fan of the products she uses ( Biologique Recherche) and have been using the line since 2018, and although I've tried the BR Ambassade in Paris, she's my #1 choice!
She is first a sweetheart, super skilled, and extremely knowledgeable about different products and formulations, what works and what does not, and always curious to stay up to date with technology and new products that appear. 
Overall ( from a facial geek) I would highly recommend the Spa to anyone who is looking for a relaxing but luxurious experience.

title: Ask for Andy!
text:
I love this hotel. It’s located in Hudson Yards which is a newly developed area in Manhattan. The hotel is brand new and has one of the coolest restaurants, which has an indoor and outdoor area. The rooms are a good size which is unusual for NYC hotels. 

The staff here is amazing. Everyone who works here is so well mannered and make you feel right at home. Andy in particular really made our stay special. He was helpful from the time we got to the front door of the hotel until the time we checked out. We will never forget his kindness. He went above and beyond what his job title was and we really appreciated him. Thank you Andy!!! 

Highly recommend this hotel

title: The best staycation in NYC
text: We absolutely loved our stay at Equinox. It was a great staycation with a beautiful view, rooftop pool & close proximity to all the restaurants and shopping at Hudson Yards. Shout out to the best doorman/valet/everything you could ask for - Andy - who made our stay even more enjoyable. The service at this hotel is top notch. Highly recommend!

title: Amazing~
text: FABULOUS hotel. Top notch service with amazing gadgets and sensors in the hotel room to make you feel well cared for. I tried their cryotherapy and spa which was wonderful. Their gym is amazing. Food? Ehh - being in nyc, you're spoiled since there are so many better places for taste and ambiance. Gorgeous views from the rooftop for drinks. Highly recommend!

title: Serious and kind professionals
text: I recently hosted an event at the Equinox hotel, and it could not have gone better! Jenny and Sarah were a dream to work with and handled all of our changes for our reasonably large group so well. They were incredibly accommodating and ON TOP OF THINGS! Everyone on their team was exceptional in their roles. Daniel the front office manager runs a well oiled machine! Dan and Richard were so helpful. Michael the bellman also went above and beyond to ensure our group had a wonderful experience. If you have a group to host the equinox hotel should be at the top of your list!

title: Weekend Oasis in NYC
text: The Equinox  Hotel at Hudson Yards was fantastic.  From the moment we stepped in the staff was attentive to our needs and it seemed as though they were personally waiting for us to arrive.  The room was beautiful with terrific views and a very comfortable bed.  The room, shower, shades, temperature, everything was thoughtfully done and easy to operate. Electric Lemon Bar/Restaurant was very cozy with a great laid back vibe.  The ability to utilize a world class gym with it was a tremendous plus with a pool, steam room, spa all available to us.  Well done Equinox.  Also take advantage of the wonderful shopping experience available at Hudson Yards.

title: Best Stay!
text:
We had an amazing stay at the Equinox Hotel! The location, the rooms, the staff, and the view were just the BEST! 
I was not sure what to expect from the rooms, but the attention to detail was second to none! Everything from the moment you walk in was beautifully crafted and thought out. I have never slept so well in a hotel! The bed felt like it was made for me :)
The staff was so nice and very helpful -- I would recommend to everyone!!

title: Best Hotel
text: Equinox Hotel is by far one of the main reasons I love New York & Hudson Yards. It’s actually one of my favorite hotels in the nation. I love how convenient it’s located to everything you need, SoulCycle, the best Equinox gym, the mall and the prettiest sunsets.  As a frequent guest at this hotel, I can confidently say that my stays have been consistently excellent. With over 100 nights spent at this property and my main residence the summers , I have always been impressed by the exceptional service provided by Andy, the doorman. He consistently goes above and beyond to make me feel welcome, greeting me with a friendly demeanor, offering assistance with my bags, and providing helpful recommendations. His professionalism and attentiveness have made my stays truly enjoyable. Additionally, the hotel itself is clean, comfortable, and welcoming, with friendly and efficient staff at the front desk and room service attendants. I love the housekeeper too, they take their time to organize my shoes. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a memorable and top-notch experience.

title: Unmatched private, & clean
text: I spend a lot of time traveling the world. A hotel can make or break your travel experience. Equinox Hotel has cracked the code regarding service, space, privacy, communication, and mental health resources. I’ve stayed a handful of times now each stay has been almost two weeks. Not once has the hotel made me feel uncomfortable. The check-in process is seamless. They always remember my name. I enjoy the entrance to the hotel. It gives you the impression of privacy, and the lift only allows you to the 24th floor, which is the reception. The offerings in the room are incredible and thoughtful. There’s also a refillable filtered water tap, a beautiful gesture to save on our blueprint. I love the spacing in the wardrobes, lots of compartments to put away your clothes, and cases, floor-to-ceiling mirrors, which I believe are essential facing a window or lit very well. Utterly obsessed with how room service is orchestrated with very sensible delivery. The packaging is meaningful and intentional. Keeps the food warm or hot. The dry cleaning service is speedy and packaged beautifully. Enjoy the showers. Spacing in the bathrooms is also decent. The list goes on and on and on.I must mention the location as I think it’s perfect if you’re not from New York and want to be in the heart of New York but don’t like a lot of noise. You have easy access to everything but feel like you’re not in all the Mayhem. The gym access is phenomenal. It’s open from 530, although I wish it were five AM. I have just enough time to get a decent workout before I start my day. The hotel and GYM are immaculate, and the interior is modern, chic, and practical can not wait for my next trip. I hope this encourages you to explore the beauty of Equinox hotel.

title: Great Destination
text: The hotel is modern, clean, stylish and has everything you need both in the hotel and nearby at Hudson Yards. Also the gym and pool are terrific. I didn’t get to use outdoor pool as it was a little cold outside but it looks great too. Staff and service are wonderful.

title: Must go to the spa!
text:
1000% amazing top to bottom the most relaxing experience I have been too. No notes. 

I did cryotherapy and infrared sauna. 

All of the therapists and receptionists are incredible please please go! You won’t regret it.

title: Superb
text:
Excellent hotel with breathtaking views, impeccable service & amazing facilities: gym, pool, rooftop…
The rooms are very well equipped and design is always on point. The staff is very helpful & friendly.

title: The best. Period. The best
text: How many times have I heard that a hotel is the best. A lot …I suppose. But the Equinox is literally, the Best! What a perfect location! The service is perfect. Valet, front desk, housekeeping, bar, fitness center, everyone was over the top amazing. Our room was the largest nicest room ever in NYC. Loved the bar for a late night drink. Great view, fun crowd and delightful service. Fitness center is a bit over the top and open to public members, but still awesome.

title: Excellence Under Pressure
text: While our planned visit was not entirely ideal (my husband took ill with a strange virus that resulted in a severe case of vertigo which ultimately required EMS services) the staff, particularly Jason Aquino and his colleague Omar were brilliant in assisting us through this extremely challenging event. Furthermore, the entire security team as well as front desk and concierge services were informed of our situation and sought simple ways to ease our challenges (offering a bottle of water, inquiring after my husband’s condition, or helping to cancel dinner reservations) all of which allowed me to better attend to my husband’s needs.

title: Great start but lots to improve on this concept
text:
After staying here, I feel like I need to outlay the cons more than pros. There are no shortage of Pro's in this review section. You're paying possible $1K a night for the room so you deserve to know. 

EQUINOX HOTEL IS JUST SOME ROOMS ABOVE AN EQUINOX "PUBLIC" GYM
As other reviewers have complained, the Equinox Hotel is a hotel with a Equinox Gym that is OPEN to the general public of Equinox members. Although hotel people get their own private elevators, you're still with the general public and the gym gets busy. Many people in the review section thought that the Equinox Hotel had an exclusive gym and spa that was uniquely made for hotel guests. This was not the case. Unlike a lot of luxury hotels where the gym and pool go all the way to midnight, you're subject to the Equinox Gym hours. From Fridays to Saturdays, the gym/pool/cold plunge/hot tubs close as early as 9:30pm to 9:00pm. This was inconvenient but going back to my main point, you would expect Equinox Hotel to create a special workout experience that normal Equinox members would not get to experience. You're paying $1K+ for a night here.

EQUINOX SAUNA IS LOW QUALITY, COLD PLUNGE NOT COLD ENOUGH
The saunas are those makeshift ones you can get from the hardware store or Costco. It takes forever to heat it up and it's not infrared. The cold plunge is also not cold enough, it's like 5-7 degree water. I go to a legit Scandinavian one and those cold plunges are 0-1 degrees celsius and has ice floating in it. It cures the injuries up good. 

FRONT DESK IS TOO MINIMALISTIC
It's a door with a guy on the side with an iPad. That's the lobby.

IT'S A HOTEL THAT MAKES YOU TAKE 2 ELEVATORS TO GET TO YOUR ROOM
I personally don't like it. You take it from Ground (guy with iPad) to 25th floor which has the reception (above the restaurant which is on floor 24). Then you take elevators up to your room. 

Now there are a lot of Pro's. Rooms have filtered water station (no more asking for water bottles), black out auto shades, iPad controlled lights (dimmable) and shades, healthy menu (smoothies, acai bowls, bone broth etc), Equinox gym is always decent especially their classes, steam room in change room is great, great service from the staff, valet is awesome, location is prime (hudson yards is the new place to be, a lot of money went into it), a legit luxury mall across the courtyard (the shops - brand new), "the edge" around the corner, fast highway road beside the hotel to take you North or South. Ultimate the area is much more modern, clean and tranquil vs you staying in a hotel in the core.

title: Great views and rooms - overall experience lacking
text:
The Good- Similar to a previous review, the rooms and view were great. Very clean, well designed, great amenities. Housekeeping staff was excellent. Blackout blinds  + double duvet = great nights sleep. Great location. We came in at Penn Station . Went to events at MSG. Hopped on the High Line  - all very walkable .

The Bad- The fitness center  and pools ( which we were looking forward to using )were very busy. My husband and I scoped it out before we went out and found ample towels and robes by outdoor pool. When we came back down , all the robes were gone and there were two towels. My husband went to the gym from desk to see where we could get more and he was told “it’s not my problem” by the employee. Since we couldn’t use the outdoor saunas( one was full and the other was occupied by a meditation class), we went to the indoor pool. I wanted to swim laps and waited patiently for a lane to open. I swam five or six laps and the lifeguard came and told me I needed to get out because I didn’t have a cap on - another swimmer who wanted my lane complained. I don’t think I wouldn’t have been so upset  1) the lifeguard would have said something to me before I started swimming2) if the lady leaving behind  me hadn’t said she has never seen someone “kicked out” for not wearing a swim cap - THEY ARE JUST GIVEN ONE!! A staff member saw us in the Elevator after the gym fiasco , we told him the story- he said he get someone to call us …never heard from anyone. 

Other annoyances- the concierge told us the St Patrick’s Day parade goes down 5th Ave- it doesn’t. Made us walk several blocks out of our way.

They got rust stains on one of my bags in storage- I pointed it out at check out and when we asked them to store it after we checked out- they just looked at it. No sorry … nothing. Definitely need to work on a few things.

title: Not what we expected….
text:
First of all the positives.

The rooms are gorgeous, extremely well designed and spacious. The bathrooms are great with amazing showers and the products from Grown Alchemist smell delicious. The lighting in the rooms is also well designed and thoughtful. Perfect for taking a mirror selfie before a night out. Also loved the yoga equipment in room. 

Room service was also fantastic. Great quality food delivered on time by friendly staff. 

The staff were on the whole extremely helpful and friendly. 

Now the negatives. 

The design of the hotel.

You enter at street level into a dark room with two elevators at the end. The reception for the hotel is on the 25th floor. You are greeted sometimes by the door staff and sometimes they just seemed to be hanging out chatting near the entrance. It didn’t feel like we were entering a luxury hotel. 

Then the elevators from street level to reception would also stop at the gym on level 4 and spa on level 5 and also the restaurant on 24 so it felt like it took forever to get to reception. Then you would have to use another lift shaft to get to the rooms. Meaning that you would have to parade through reception every time you wanted to visit the gym or the spa. Also there are no umbrellas on street level so if you realise it’s raining and need an umbrella you must make an infuriating trip all the way back up to reception to get an umbrella and then back down again. 

Reception was a small mezzanine above the Electric Lemon restaurant. In most luxury hotels you are greeted with a gorgeous signature scent. In this hotel we were greeted by the smell of fish and grease from the restaurant. A really strange concept. 

On check in we were upgraded according to our American Express platinum card but this was only a view upgrade and not a bigger room. This hotel only has rooms from floor 25 up to floor 40 or something like that so tbh all rooms seem to have a pretty decent view anyway. If you want a bigger room I suggest you choose one at time of booking rather than relying on an upgrade as we were told that there were fewer premium sized rooms so the hotel has trouble fulfilling upgrades. The hotel should be, at check in, much more transparent with this info and the check in experience would be much less disgruntling. 

We booked this hotel in large part due to the pools and wellness facilities. We didn’t, at the time of booking, realise that these pools actually are run and belong to the equinox fitness club. This is a beautiful and well appointed fitness club but also the busiest I have ever seen. Don’t expect to be able to relax around the pools as on the many times we tried it was like an Olympic swimming meet going on.  We then tried to visit the outdoor pool only to find that the robes and slippers that are supposed to be placed there for guests to use were not there. We asked a member of staff and they looked perplexed and sent us off to our hotel room to get our own robes and slippers from the room. Another two infuriating lift journeys in my swimming trunks. I later was told by a senior member of staff at the hotel that there should be robes by the pool. There was a lack of communication between the hotel and fitness centre. There in I think lies the problem. We felt like intruders and not comfortable in this busiest of spaces. We are used to pool areas like the one at Park Hyatt which is used by hotel guest only, and is rarely busy and the perfect place to relax after a long day walking the streets of the city. Also the Equinox fitness centre would close at 11pm so no late night work outs which is something we would normally enjoy in other hotels. I understand some people might enjoy access to a busy fitness club but we were expecting something less hectic. 

Room service ends at 11pm. Extremely inconvenient. Especially when you get back from a show and fancy a late night snack or dessert. 

The reason I am being so detailed in my review is because this hotel was at a price point similar to the Park Hyatt, Baccarat and Four Seasons downtown and I am afraid it is a long way off in terms of service and facilities and customer experience. There, in my opinion, is nothing exclusive or special having access to an extremely busy Equinox fitness club. You can find these fitness clubs on nearly every corner in New York. Many people I’m sure would enjoy it but important to know what you are in for.

title: I’ll be back!
text: Great experience.  Was in town to visit office in hudson yards.  Equinox hotel location couldn’t be better.  Room felt new and was perfectly clean.  Staff was attentive and friendly.  Will be staying here going forward.  Big thank you to the team for their hospitality.

title: Relaxe/gym/sleep/discover/work —> repeat
text: Had an amazing stay at the Equinox Hotel! The location is great as well as the service and room concept. The combination of gym/fitness, sleeping concept and interior design is outstanding and unique. It’s my favourite property for both business travel and private travel travel. Super located in NYC! Best in room bar I’ve ever had. Beverages and other gym/spa amenities. Was already my second stay.

title: Stellar spa experience!
text: I am usually not the sort to leave reviews, but the spa team, including Melissa and Johnah, made a lasting impression and deserve a nod of recognition. The facilities, not to mention, the dry sauna and rain fall shower, were exceptional. I am looking forward to the next visit. Best to all.

title: Great stay at Equinox
text: Great stay at Equinox! Our room was spacious, delicate, and beautiful with a gorgeous view.  All staff was welcoming. helpful and nice. And the gym! Loved it  - I would stay there only for the gym. Highly recommended! But stay away from in-room eating/drinking if you do not want to pay above what you can pay at establishments in the nearby area:)

title: Decent but nothing to write home about.
text:
I often stay in 5 star hotels either for work or pleasure so used to a certain level of service. I would say with Equinox it isn’t a bad stay the gym is nice and people are generally pleasant but I wouldn’t say it’s a full 5 star service. Just more of a nice hotel to stay in. We were in town for my girlfriends birthday and nothing was done to make her feel special. I stayed at the Ritz this January and I was gifted a free bottle of Champagne and dessert in my room plus a free limo ride to our restaurant that evening. That’s 5 star service - looking at the detail in order to get customers to continue to stay with your hotel in the long term. Upon checking out I left my business MasterCard to be charged for the room and although they assured me they’d use it. They decided to still charge my American Express which has incurred £150 worth of fees because of the non-sterling transaction costs. Something I explained I didn’t want to happen so left my MasterCard that didn’t have any fees per transaction. They have to take a holding payment whenever you leave a card to make sure you have money on that card, which they did and held a payment and then still chose not to use it and go against my wishes. Just goes to show about the service average non-attentive. No real care in the consumer. The gym is cool and the city is incredible but the hotel is meh. 

 Nothing was unique about this experience and we are looking forward to staying at the Pendry Manhattan West which is 2 minutes away from the Equinox Hotel next time (take a look!)

title: Excellent hotel in NYC
text: Best hotel to stay in NYC as you are not that far from downtown or uptown, the Westside highway is very convenient. They gym is spectacular. The bedrooms are very comfortable. I highly recommend the Equinox hotel.

title: Luxury stay in the heart of NYC
text:
Equinox hotel, which was recommended by a family member, exceeded expectations across the board. From the moment we drove up the private street in front of the hotel, we were greeted by Andy, who helped secure our luggage and valet our car. Traveling from London with a child is not an easy feat, but the unloading process, and effortless guidance to our room definitely helped. We were taken up to the 25th floor lobby to check in and were told about hotel amenities and services. We felt like total VIPs. For a small family of 3 traveling to NYC for the first time, our room view was perfect. We had New York and all its glory right outside of our complete black out curtains. The room was large and had a fully stocked minibar that had healthy snacks, candies, specialty health products and yoga equipment!! 

The facilities in the hotel are great for adults like Using the heated pool in the middle of an nyc winter! Then you hop into the barrel sauna to continue your spa journey! 

We ate using the hotel room service which drew us back for almost every meal. From healthy smoothies and lattes to sweet and milky pancakes on the weekend. It was truly a top notch stay. 

The staff at this hotel truly are amazing and willing to help in any way. We would totally come back here with the rest of the family, and even recommend to friends and colleagues!

title: One night stay in NYC
text: Excellent hotel stay overall. Room was clean and quiet. Bed was comfortable. Very good car valet service from Andy. Drop off and pick up were so easy and very efficient. Breakfast and dinner tasted delicious. Time well spent there.

title: Best Sports Club Ever!!!
text:
This review is dedicated to the Sports Club at this Equinox location 🤍

Writing to express gratitude and appreciation to all members of the staff, and specifically to amazing yoga instructors - Jessica and Robert - who make yoga classes so much fun!

Now that I’ve been doing yoga consistently for over a year my back pain and migraines are gone!

Jessica has such a beautiful way of combining mindfulness, poetry and beautiful music into her class!
And Robert manages to teach in a very cool and relaxed way!
I always look forward to their classes and prefer them to brunch every weekend :)

It would be amazing to see more of both of them in our club 🤍

Also, I tried Basic Swimming class yesterday for the first time and it was great! Tim did a great job, was very king and supportive.
Would be amazing to have more Basic (Beginner) swimming classes on the schedule.

Thank you for everything you do!

title: Simple elegance and sleek design
text:
We were absolutely in love with the design of the rooms! no unnecessary embellishments, everything is there for a purpose which is relaxation. Very comfortable bed and the view from the shower is breathtaking!
We only stayed for one night, but used the gym facilities which are excellent as you can imagine from an Equinox gym. Breakfast at the restaurant was delicious, highly recommend the eggs benedict.
We had a minor issue with the tv remote but someone came by immediately after we called guest services about it.

title: Best Ever
text: Hands down the most thoughtful hotel stay I’ve ever had. I just got back from a 2x the price hotel stay in Florida and this hotel was 10x the experience. The rooms are huge for NYC standards and the views are amazing. I’m obsessed with the bathroom products and the room service food was so good and I LOVE the way that they deliver it in the totes. It’s all so cool. Everything was insanely easy to order on the in room ipad. Usually the in room tech is bogus but this one was so super easy. Working out at the gym downstairs was a huge perk for us. 10/10 would stay again.

title: Best wellness retreat in NYC
text: One of my favorite hotels in NYC. So sleek and modern. The beds, comforters and pillows are elite. I literally had the best sleep of my life! Love how you can make the room pitch black and the perfect sleeping temperature. Wellness at its finest.

title: Solo Trip for a Night
text:
I had a fantastic one night stay at this hotel. Staff was present and welcoming at the front door coming from the "driveway".  As you enter the reception area on the 25th floor another staff member was there set me up and tell me about all the wonderful amentities the hotel has to offer. The room had a full bar and amazing Rain Shower. The whole room was controlled by an ipad on the night stand which was really cool! It controlled everything from the lights, the shades, etc.. 
The Gym on the 4th floor is state of the art and had a wonderful open concept with views over the Hudson which made for a dream lit sunset workout. Dinner at the Electric Lemon on the 24th floor gave views over the Hudson and also included views of the Hudson Yards "Vessel". My Filet was cooked to perfection and the wait staff were excellent. Afterwards I pre ordered Breakfast for the next morning which was delivered perfectly on time. 
Overall I'd give this Hotel a 5 out of 5 and a must stay if you are coming to visit NYC. 
Close to Midtown and Subway Lines as well !

title: Favorite life style hotel
text: Fantastic experience, great room with stunning view , hotel facilities are the best you can find for healthy life style , massive gym , cold an hot plunge , sauna , cryotherapy 🤷🏻‍♂️ , very good location!  perfect for walk with beautiful buildings all around .

title: Ideal getaway!
text:
The weekend getaway was beyond perfect. We planned to explore nyc, but couldn’t leave the luxury of the hotel. From the incredible sleep (just hit a button on the iPad and the entire room enters sleep mode), room service (get the shake for the health and the chocolate chip cookie to live a little), spa (infrared sauna, followed by the relaxation lounge and massage) and Equinox Club (easily one of the nicest I’ve ever been to) - it’s the best of NYC.

Will be back soon!

title: Perfect Hudson Yards stay
text:
Love this place! The location is excellent and I love Hudson Yards. The service is exceptional and the rooms are beautiful and clean. We ate and drank at Electric Lemon, located in the hotel. It had really yummy and inventive food. Also got to see some famous basketball players that were staying there, so that’s a plus.

The gym is huge and amazing as well.

I booked it with my Amex Platinum Card so I got 4pm checkout, free breakfast and a $100 resort credit.

title: Top Notch experience
text: We booked this for a special occasion and every detail was anticipated with the options, food, lighting, comfort and service. The location is ideal, 10 minute walk to Penn Station, and plenty of spa and fitness to choose from all day and night. I felt like a celebrity during my stay! Thank you all for providing 10⭐️ service!

title: Vey nice
text: My wife and I stayed for a night on a quick business/pleasure trip to NYC. This Hudson Yards hotel is in a great location near midtown, right next to very high end shopping and restaurants. Room was beautiful with view of downtown and the Hudson as well as “The Vessel”. Room was spotless, elegant and sophisticated. My wife raved about the gym. The bed is firm and they use an Eastern European tradition of 2 separate comforters on a King - we loved it but better to know in advance.  Great hotel - you won’t be disappointed

title: The best spa experience ever
text: Great experience from scheduling till check out. Everyone extremely friendly and on point. I had best massage ever with Jorge. I almost fell asleep and it something my body was asking for so long. Amazing energy and beautiful facility.

title: Business Trip
text: Met friends at the restaurant and they loved it. Best hotel in nyc. Impeccable service and beautiful rooms with a lot of space. Fabulous gym! Highly recommend it! Great shopping within minutes was a surprise treat for me.

title: AMAZING STAY
text:
Had the best time at this hotel.
From the comfort of the room to the quality of the finish, it's worth the stay.
The room was very big (Junior Suite) and Location is amazing, close to the subway, stores, restaurant.

A MUST Destination!

title: My Overnight Agent - Triston
text:
I recently booked a weekend getaway at the Equinox Hotel - Hudson Yards and called in to confirm my reservation.  I was blessed to speak with the overnight agent (Triston) who was a WEALTH OF INFORMATION after confirming my reservation.  He gave me Resturant options, Broadway play/musical choices and he even advised on areas of the city to visit to gain the best experiences over the weekend. Much appreciated Triston!!! The Equinox has definitely gained my patronage!!!! 

Ingrid C.

title: Naomi and Brian | Hudson Yard | NYC
text: Naomi and Brian make it happen. The staff is like family to me, they anticipate every need no matter how difficult the day.  They truly make every stay priceless, and I am grateful for them. In addition, the property has an Equinox gym and tons of good locations nearby including a new Milos.

title: Phenomenal!
text: I loved my stay here! Went for a girls trip with my daughter.  Beautifully appointed spacious room! Wonderful amenities and gifts!  Wonderful robes and slippers provided.  The view of the river was spectacular!! The staff was warm, welcoming, and gracious from checking in to checking out.  The food at the Electric Lemon was wonderful and the bartender was great. I will happily return again.  Highly recommend!

title: Happy
text:
All staff is professional, friendly. Exelen location, clean, safety the room are spectacular the pool incredible outdoor and inside, we are happy with EQUINOX near to all.
Congratulations to all people, happy New Year 
To all, God bless you

title: The bed and blinds !!
text: Did staycation with friends . The room was big for all four of us . Amy favorite part was the bed and blackout blinds. The bed was so comfy !!! And the blackout blinds made us sleep so peacefully . Dangerous though because we could have slept in all day

title: Gorgeous View
text: Had a river view.   Did not want to leave the room that is how beautiful the view is. Everything was wonderful from the check in staff to the valet.  I loved the location as well we usually stay on the east side, so it was nice to explore the west side restaurants and the great new mall.

title: A Fitness Holiday.
text:
The Equinox Hotel, Hudson Yards, is a fusion of the art of hospitality and fitness. From the moment I arrived, I was immersed in a world of elevated fitness programming.

I was delighted with my King Deluxe room. It employed sleep technology to ensure I got the best sleep I could get. An in-room media library provided a repository of exercise rituals to jumpstart awaking and sleeping. Floor to ceiling windows portrayed the Vessel (Hudson Yards) sculpture as well as spectacular Manhattan views. The bathroom was exquisite with a sauna-sized in-room shower and seat as well as a three shower system.

The Electric Lemon, a clean-eating restaurant serves local farmer and seasonally focused fare. My favorite selection was the Rainbow Trout, and equally delicious,  the simple carrot cake for my sweet tooth. From the Lounge, I enjoyed the 'Return to the Beach' cocktail......it made me want to return to the beach.

The 60,000 sq. ft. Equinox fitness club (the Bentley of gym brands) is designed to embrace the world's most advanced fitness experience. I took part in their signature programming categories including yoga, SoulCycle spinning classes, an exclusive program involving a vertical climbing routine on the Vessel and access to a 25 yard indoor salt water lap pool.

The Spa by Equinox is a recovery-driven facility with a raft of treatment options. I'm usually  a massage type person but I couldn't resist the Cryotherapy and Infrared Sauna......that jumpstarted my overall health & fitness.

If you are a fitness buff and want to let go of your stressors........then try the............
Equinox Hotel.........A Fitness Holiday.

title: #1 place to stay in NYC!!
text: The Equinox Hotel is always our #1 place to stay when we're in NYC. Not only is the service the best but the food, the design and the ambiance are incredible. Daniel always comes through with the top restaurant suggestions in the city, which makes the whole experience even better each time. Will be back soon :)

title: EXCELLENT CHOICE IF YOU ARE INDIFERENT ABOUT LOCATI0N
text:
Beautiful rooms and very spacius (In terms of NY alternatives, this room is giant). Great Gym. The staff is very nice and efficient

The location is not the most convinient but definetly not a deal breaker

title: Wonderful Hotel experience.
text:
I enjoyed this hotel a lot.  The hotel is new and bright and clean.  
The bellman TJ was amazing.  He gave us a great tour of our room.  The check in was easy.  The front desk people we friendly and fun to talk to.  I dropped my credit card and received an immediate text that they had it at reception.  Love the honesty.  I usually hate maid service and they did a good job.  The bed was comfortable.  The bar is nice.  Very busy.  I recommend making a reservation for a table.
