title: Always exceptional
text: I’ve stayed at the Equinox many times and as always, the entire staff was amazing. The front desk team always remembers past guests and greet you with a warm smile and hello. The bartenders at Electric Lemon are top notch. And full access to the attached Equinox gym, pool and spa is a real benefit.

title: Mike Patron- maitre d'hotel, is the star of Equinox Hotel
text:
Mike is the perfect welcome Maitre d of the hotel. Impeccable memory, friendly demeanor and energy, and extremely helpful. I hope he gets a raise for the holiday season and that you give him a big holiday bonus! 

I'll be back again and will recommend this hotel to many friends who are visiting in the new year because of this experience!

Also, the hotel itself is fabulous! Everyone was very accommodating and I love the room format. The shower is especially sultry and design is impeccable with the cool light effects to see or not to see from the bedroom.

title: Superb
text: Excellent location as well as service. The rooms and views are stunning and staff very agreable and available. The equipment is super modern and everything is under control. Gym is phenomenal and in the same building! With a pool

title: Excellent
text:
Everything was great, checking in/ checking out was extremely easy and user friendly. Front Desk staff were friendly and knowable of the area and for someone that was there only one night it made my day extremely easy ( as I had not plan anything). Room was spotless, loved the shower and the amidites in the room. One of my favorite features is the ability to control the lighting in the room and all areas of the room. As someone who enjoys sleeping in complete darkness, having that ability outside of my home always makes me extremely happy. Loved the three way mirror and lighting.
 It's a perfect balance of luxury, fitness and relaxation.

title: Beautiful night in HY
text: It was an absolute breathtaking view with all the Christmas lights in Hudson Yards and the Vessel. Makes a beautiful ambiance for a perfect couples night or work night. The room was very spacious and the mirrors with different lighting was perfect for make up! Definitely recommend it!

title: Amazing Stay
text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful - from the Hudson River views, the shower with three different options, the wonderful shampoo's, etc. and the double duvets. We also really enjoyed our time in the lounge with Marcus. The staff were all very attentive and pleasant. Can't wait to stay there again.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text:
Excellent services beautiful location, true 5 stars experience! The prestige room was highly comfortable, beautiful view to the pool and Hudson River ,delicious food at breakfast and dinner. The hotel has lots of personnel and we were very well taken care of. Spa experience was also great.

Nathan and Danny who adorable, caring, , attentive and recommended only the best options. I will definitely recommend Equinox hotels.

title: 5 stars isn't enough
text:
It's hard to complain when you stay at the Equinox hotel–they've really thought of everything. It's a convenient location in Hudson Yards, just a minute walk to the train station and Citi bikes, all right across the street from the hotel. The entire building from the lobby down to the gym locker rooms has a luxurious design and insane attention to detail. Stayed here with my girlfriend and it was so nice to be able to go the gym, have a healthy breakfast and great drinks later at night at Electric Lemon–all in the same building. The room had a big spacious bed, fast Wi-Fi, a nice big screen TV, and the best blackout curtains that we could open and close while chilling in bed. We tried to take advantage of all they had to offer like the outdoor heated pool, the sauna barrels, the gym, and cryotherapy. There was still so much we couldn't get to like the hot and cold plunge and the IV drip, that we plan on trying when we come back again!

Above all, the thing that stood out the most was the great service, truly felt like a king during my stay here. Every single staff member was so attentive and helpful. I'd especially recommend the Equinox Hotel to anyone who's interested in their overall wellness or health/fitness, because the list of restorative treatments they have goes on and on. It's suffice it to say that I left feeling well rested and refreshed.

title: A Luxe & Relaxing Getaway
text:
My boyfriend & I live 30 min away and decided to treat ourselves to a short (and very much needed) stay-cation at the Equinox Hotel. Let me tell you, we had the best time and I seriously couldn't recommend it more. 

As soon as we stepped into the hotel, we felt taken care of. The staff is all so kind and helpful and they made checking in & out SO quick and seamless. The room felt so premium. When we opened our door, the curtains automatically opened to reveal the NYC view...felt like a scene straight out of a movie! To top it all off, a staff member came up to give us a bottle of Veuve Clicquot and popped it open for us. 

Really loved all the recovery focused amenities, like a foam roller, foot massage roller, coconut collagen creamer (loved this so much we now buy these for us at home!) They even had 2 different shower gels, one for the morning & one for the night that had more calming scents. And a little booklet on the nightstand with a ton of tips on how to establish a morning & night routine, had to take pics of it! 

We got to enjoy the outdoor pool even though it's cold since the pool is nice & heated. Then immediately ran to the sauna barrels, and had a gorgeous view of the Vessel while we warmed up. And if you ever come here, the spa is a MUST. We drank tea on cozy chairs while we waited to try out cryotherapy. I was terrified at first, but the staff was so great at guiding us through everything. The gym was clean & organized and with trainers around making sure we found everything we needed. 

We went in feeling absolutely drained and tired, and we left feeling beyond relaxed. This might be our new tradition every year!

title: World class stay. Wellness facilities on a level of its own.
text: I stayed at the Equinox Hotel in November 2022  for 4 nights whilst in NYC to run the NYC Marathon. This was one of the best hotel experiences of my life. Rooms: Are big, great coffee machine, comfortable beds, beautiful well equipped bathrooms. Service: Incredible from every person in the organisation. From the concierge, bell hop, room service. Friendly, helpful, nothing too hard or out of the question. For someone that loves health and fitness like me I have not seen anything like it on the planet. The rooftop pool, the spa, sauna, world class gym, everything is on a level of its own

title: AS GOOD AS IT GETS!
text: This was the 2nd time my wife and I stayed at the Equinox Hotel in NYC. The property is beautifully designed, exquisitely maintained, and located perfectly in Hudson Yards near the Vessel, High Line, Hudson River, etc. We live locally in NYC (in the heart of midtown) and really enjoy coming here to relax, unwind, and enjoy a perfect night of rest. Additionally, it's so so easy to maintain our active and healthy lifestyle with access to the Equinox fitness facilties in the building, and room service options. We did not miss a step. I must also mention the staff. We are used to traveling and staying at 5 star hotels, but this staff is really a step above. The staff is so attentive, friendly, helpful, and prompt. Every time we called Guest Services, someone was at our door in 5 minutes to help (bringing more water, refilling our Nespresso capsules, etc). I highly recommend staying at the Equinox Hotel. We are already planning our next stay here. This hotel truly is AS GOOD AS IT GETS!!

title: Thank you, Again!
text: This was my second time staying at the Equinox Hotel. I must say Equinox never disappoints. I always leave feeling regenerated and well rested. The room-service breakfast and superfood lattes are my favorite! Not to mention the AM and PM body-wash. Thank you EQX Team :-)

title: Amazing moments!
text: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and had an incredible stay. Rooms are spacious and probably the best in Manhattan, all brand new. We liked the healthy food and trendy atmosphere. James, the Manager, with his team were not only super friendly but also so engaged to help. Really great guest experience! Happy to return hopefully soon.

title: Sets a new standard of luxury
text:
Being a luxury travel journalist, staying in some of the world's best hotels is my job, however, Equinox undeniably raises that bar to heights that have hardly been scraped by other hotels worldwide. This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. 

Equinox not only ticks all the boxes of a five-star stay – think, the plushest king-sized bed, sweeping views of NYC skyline, stunning amenities from Grown Alchemist, and a lavish option of spa treatments – but every inch of the hotel has been thought through from the glass shower, which can be set from transparent (providing your most scenic shower yet as your overlook the city) to the more private, frosted mode and the drawer within the room, which is equipped with magnesium cream (perfect for the athletes that stayed for their Athletes for Life x Equinox Hotels marathon package - my partner being one of them), CBD oil, a performance sleep mask and wellness patches. There is also a foam roller and complementary A.M and P.M rituals that guests are encouraged to do before hitting the 'Dark. Quiet. Cool' setting on the tablet, which sets the room up for the optimal night's sleep. 

Both the in-room dining options and in-house dining at Electric Lemon were exceptional, with the menu boasting modern American cuisine, showcasing seasonal produce. The cocktails will also have you hooked! 

As part of his marathon package, my partner lapped up the treatments on offer, including the IV Drip, infrared sauna, hot and cold plunge pool and the cryo-chamber. 

If you love wellness, the finer things in life and want to experience the best and fittest hotel in the world, this is the place for you.

title: New York City marathon stay - Best hotel in town!
text:
Traveling to NYC and staying in this property was the perfect way to prepare for the marathon and enjoy the newly developed area around Hudson Yards. 

The staff at the hotel are beyond accomodating and the features around the entire hotel incredible. Having access to the state of the art gym and rejuvenation amenities was a highlight to prepare for the race and to recover, too! 

Little highlight from the room was the incredible details, but definitely recommend accessing the ‘Dark. Quiet. Cool.’ Function on the the rooms iPad for a great night’s rest!

title: World class…it doesn’t get any better than this!
text:
Such an amazing venue. The facilities are as good as it gets. The staff are so friendly and helpful. There are so many activities/ treatments available to you in house. The equinox hotel will always be my preferred choice to stay every time I visit NY.
This is the best hotel I have stayed in worldwide.

title: Kindest, most helpful staff
text: Beyond an exceptional experience here while I recuperated from the flu. The staff was incredibly helpful to me over the past week as I recovered, isolated in my room. Big shoutout to Dan C at the front desk for checking in on me and supplying me with a fridge, microwave, humidifier, teas etc to ease my stay. Even the chicken soup was wonderfully healing (if you’re going to be sick in a wellness hotel, this is the place to get better). I really appreciated it and we will definitely stay at this hotel whenever we return to NY.

title: Most Exceptional Hotel In New York
text: I have stayed almost everywhere in New York and this hotel is above (pun intended) everywhere else.  The rooms feature breathtaking views with a beautifully sleek aesthetic.  The staff is knowledgable, detail-oriented and accommodating for requests - big and small.  I felt refreshed, energized and pampered for my entire stay.  This hotel truly raises the bar.  (Which reminds me, the bar is amazing too!)

title: Best service & Best night’s sleep!
text: I stayed at Equinox Hotel for my NYC Marathon and the service, care , and standards they provided were simply the best! I’ve ever had! From Nathan’s hospitality, to the excellent care at the front desk, to the Spa making sure I was ready to perform the following day, I couldn’t have asked for better service! Even the way the rooms are designed, I have never had a better night’s sleep! Highly recommend!!!

title: Amazing weekend stay!
text: Staying at the Equinox Hotel was fantastic! From the high end views, to the personalized service and the in room bar, the hospitality is second to none. I will be sure to stay here again in the future. Nathan, the Hotel Director does an amazing job and I cannot thank him enough. Best Luxury Hotel I've been to in a while.

title: Equinox Hotel stay was amazing
text: This was my first stay at the hotel and from check in to check out I was blown away.  The staff is well trained and very friendly.  The lobby, and lounge areas are absolutely amazing.  The rooms are the nicest most welcoming that I have every experience.  I had the best sleep ever.  Woke up to use the club located below the hotel and included in the stay… it was such a great space, motivating and overall great experience.  Highly recommend the hotel when in NYC.

title: Amazing NYC experience!
text: They take 5 star luxury to a whole other level. Modern design & technology. Superior service. Amenities centered around health & fitness. Convenient location. And the science behind sleeping in the bedrooms is unlike anything you've ever seen. I didn't want to leave my room - the blackout shades made it very dark, room controlled temperatures and it was very quiet, which is rare to find in NYC! I can't wait to be back. Thank you for a perfect stay!

title: Multiple stays
text: Equinox is one of the top-notch hotels in NYC. You can’t go wrong with staying at this hotel. Rooms are really nice with some of the most amazing views of NYC. You also have to check out the spa which is 👌🏾

title: Bomb AF
text: Equinox Hotel quickly and easily became one of my favorite places to stay. Working out is crucial for me especially when I travel, so it nice to be in a comfortable place. The staff treated us so nice that we had to come back again and it was even better. Nathan and Carlos took care of everything from a smooth 2AM checkin, to diet accommodations. You definitely won't be disappointed stating here! Besides that, the location, products, aesthetics, and food are superb!

title: Incredible service from Nathan Loga!!!
text: Nathan Loga made our experience truly excellent. He was always checking in on us and made sure we had everything we needed and were comfortable. Cannot recommend staying at the equinox hotel enough because of him!!!

title: Head of Sports Division
text:
Hands down my favorite hotel to stay at in the country. I travel 15-20+ days out of the month, and no hotel comes close to the Equinox. From the staff, amenities and everything in between, there isn't a better establishment.
Will be the only hotel I stay at when I'm in the New York City area. My only wish is that there was an Equinox hotel in city!

title: Highest Level of Service Possible
text:
The hotel is located in the center of Hudson Yards.
Adjacent to High Line Park and a short walk to the mall and the Shed.
The hotel has a great restaurant(Electric Lemon), great spa(Cryotherapy is a must), and of course the Equinox gym.
But above all, the staff were super friendly, professional, and accommodated everything that we requested. 
Nathan is the star of them all and he truly demonstrates style, elegance, and professionalism.
Huge thanks to Nathan, and look forward to staying at Equinox Hotel in the near future.

title: Great Product. Great Experience.
text: For someone who travels a lot and cares about wellness, Equinox checks all the boxes.  Comfortable mattress, quiet HVAC, great lighting, and an amazing shower experience. Food menu was also well thought through with lots of healthy options. This is my go-to hotel in NYC. I wish there were more Equinox hotels in other cities.

title: A bit gimmicky.  Good location.
text: For the price, an average experience.  I found it a bit too gimmicky in trying to be cool.  Give me straight creamer for my coffee...instead there is some coconut collage powder.  Give me an iron and an ironing board so that I can touch up my shirt between meetings....instead thee is only a steamer.  Too much focus on laying out a bunch of food/cosmetic items where wasn't clear what was complimentary and what was extra (and the extras can really add up with kids!).  Overall a very nice hotel, and front desk service was very nice (though took too long), but for $900 a night I found it more gimmicky than smooth.

title: very nice hotel
text: Convenient to Javits convention center also useful to stay here to explore that side of the city as lots to do in area . A/c worked, black out blinds that work, nice shower/shower head. 2 duvets, quiet room (other than hearing door across hall slam), nice views (hotel starts on 25th floor). Staff was friendly. Room well appointed. River view was nice to see what goes on.

title: Equinox hotel
text:
The service was beyond amazing! Loved all the healthy and vegan food selections the hotel offered. The spa was something else, all the treatments where very well thought of and caters to everyones specific needs. They also have a nutri drip which was great for our jetlag . 
The room decor was ultra chic and modern for this new york based hotel, all the hotel amenities where from my favorite brand grown alchemist, it was great seeing products you actually use at the hotel. 
The bed and night settings actually help you fall asleep. 
Everything was ultra luxury in the hotel. 

The concierge booked all of our spa treatments and restaurant reservations before hand which was perfect. 

The gym facilities is one of the best i have seen ever. 

Would recommend the hotel to everyone !

title: Equinox isn’t a “hotel”- it’s EQUINOX
text:
To call this place a hotel is unfair- because if this is a hotel then other hotels should cease to exist. I stayed here in the days leading up to running the NYC Marathon, and there isn’t a better environment to prep. 

Check in is on the 25th floor, which I believe, helps give Equinox its own atmosphere as it sits away from outside energy. 

The color palette and materials used in the rooms give it a feeling of tranquility. Even the lighting takes its time to come on, giving your eyes time to adjust. My room was equipped with foam rollers, resistant bands, and a power mat. Which was great leading up to the race.

My favorite features were the ability to control every aspect of your room from the iPad and the floor lights that sense movement as you stumble to the bathroom in the middle of the night.

The customer service was phenomenal. For example, My wife had some leftovers she needed heated. So they rolled in a microwave for her. 

Equinox has made it hard for me to go to any other “hotel”. I highly recommend this hotel 10 out of 10 times.

title: Amazing stay at Equinox Hotel New York!
text: I was traveling for business to NYC and had an amazing stay at Equinox Hotel New York.  From arrival to departure, the experience was flawless.  From the moment I arrived into my room, I felt relaxed and ready to recharge after a long day of meetings.  Having access to the gym is a game changer and the hotel was able to clean by gym clothes within 2 hours.....absolutely amazing service!!  The bed is super comfortable, the bath products are top notch, the mini-bar offering is unlike anything else I have ever experienced.  The front desk staff was very helpful on departure and the front drive staff were really nice with assisting with transit.  I highly recommend this hotel and its a must for all travelers needing a little relaxation and a slice of heaven in the City that never sleeps!

title: Absolutely amazing hotel
text: This hotel was the absolute best hotel. The location, the service, the room, the views, everything was amazing! I will never stay anywhere but here when I come back to the city. The room is gorgeous. The bed was so comfortable. I can't say enough about our stay being fabulous. Thank you equinox staff for treating us so kindly and making our stay perfect!

title: Great hotel! Great staff!
text:
We’ve been wanting to stay there for some time now and from arrival to departure our experience was nothing short of amazing, from the valet to the front best managers, we knew we had picked the right place. The staff was always hospitable, I always had a smile no matter how large or small the request might of been. Our room was perfect overlooking the vessel. Clean, plenty of room and the bed was amazing. I’m would buy the mattress, sheets and pillows if could. I couldn't believe how quiet it was too. 
We also brought our service dog with us and the staff loved having him there. They greeted him every single time and it was a very convenient neighborhood to walk him especially because he like to people watch next to the vessel :) 

I could add much positive reviews on the hotel but we will definitely be staying here again and I hope management reads this review because they’ve done great job! 

Thank you again for a wonderful stay!

title: Perfect Stay in NYC!
text: The staff was top notch, attending to all of our needs.  Made us feel so welcome!  We are a minority family and I sensed zero prejudice.  The hotel was clean, the fitness center is impeccable and the restaurant options in the area are great too.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Fantastic stay in NYC
text: This hotel is amazing!  Absolutely loved everything.  The hotel staff were all amazing and professional.  Our room was fantastic.  The beds were super comfortable.  It is very hard to find a hotel like this in United States where you feel like you get your money's worth.  I would highly recommend splurging on this hotel.  Location for us was great because we were fine with staying in the area.

title: Mother Nature Provides the View, But "Posh and Awe" Provided by Equinor
text: Unmatched excllence at the Equinox hotel in NY City and keeping my bragging rights status being surrounded by the rich and famous.  If your travel budget allows, spring for a stay at this amazingly modern and super lux hotel on NY's west side next to Hudson Yards.  The restaurant and bar is a happening scene with a lot of great restaurants close by.  The spa is gorgeous and the fitness, over the top.  Loved my room.

title: Best sleep I've ever had, top notch concierge
text: From arrival to departure my experience was nothing short of flawless; seamless check-in, spa-like room, spectacular concierge, and  unbelievable amenities. The staff made themselves available for even the smallest of requests and would go above and beyond when needed - will definitely be staying here again soon!

title: Das Hotel ist absolut top bezüglich Trend, Fashion  und Health. Die In-Szene der Stadt trifft sich im  Electric Lemon!!!
text: Bestens bedient und verwöhnt. Das Personal ausgesprochen zuvorkommend. Besonders gut die Massage, Könner ihres Fachs! Die Terrasse ein asset! Sicht über den Hudson, super Kunst Skulpturen, großartige Sitzgelegenheiten zwischen der Skyline.

title: Top Notch Service
text:
What a wonderful stay at Equinox Hotel. We were upgraded to a corner suite with gorgeous views of Hudson River and New Jersey. The location can't be beat right next to Hudson Yards, shopping and restaurants.  The doormen when you walk in are friendly and personable. Room has very comfortable bed and bedding, which made for a very deep sleep. We were on 27th floor and the sound from the streets was minimal. All the rooms have tablets, very modern. Bathrooms were spacious and well appointed.  The toilet was in a separate room.

Spa was the best experience , Jorge the masseuse took all the tension from my back. He was very knowledgeable and made the whole experience relaxing. Took a stroll to indoor pool, but it is more like a lap pool not for relaxing. But they might have been working out in pool , so maybe it's intermittent work out and relaxing. 

Would totally come back again .

If you want to save a few dollars Park in lot around the block. Prepaid for 50 as opposed to valet which is 80-90 a night.

title: Crazy age restrictions
text: We flew to nyc all the way from europe, to the Equinox Hotel to enjoy the city itself and the hotels advertised amenities. However, it was upon our arrival that we were informed that guests below 16 are forbidden to use the spa and gym facilities (this was ofc also written  inconspicuously on the booking confirmation sent my mail). This meant that as much as half of us would not have been able to use the gym and spa. Fitness and sports is a big part of all of our lives and we were very dissatisfied with these regulations and considered switching  hotels. Albeit, having visited 20+ hotels in nyc, Equinox is still a very good hotel with outstanding rooms and the best food.

title: Can’t go to gym
text: The hotel was very nice however the gym can only be used if your 16+ and must show id and the spa and pool at 18+, the restaurant would occasionally forget specifications and can be quite crowded at lunch  and dinner, nonetheless the rooms were very comfortable and pleasant

title: Relaxing and Perfect Staycation
text: Had such a memorable first staycation at The Equinox Hotel. From the super friendly check in desk (both Lyle & Marleny were warm and welcoming), to the incredible health and wellness amenities in the room, to the delicious breakfast at Electric Lemon - my stay at the hotel was just perfection!

title: Beep beep beep
text:
I would imagine that any hotel with a 5 star standard has solid sound insulation since we go there for a good night's rest. 35floors above the street, from early morning to late night, you hear the typical beeps of reversing trucks. As if the developers did not know that NYC is noisy, they ignored sound insolation. Pathetic! 

Never coming back!

title: Decepção em NYC
text: O Hotel foi uma decepção desde o check-in. Não nos foi apresentado as instalações, nem serviços ofertados, não nos foi falado sobre horário e valores do café da manhã. Não nos avisaram quando o quarto ficou pronto após as 15h. Após o checkout deixamos nossas malas sobre responsabilidade do atendente e as mesmas foram perdidas, nos causando muito estresse pois nossos passaportes estavam na mala de bordo. O ponto alto é o quarto e o house keeping. Não indico para ninguém por ser um hotel classificado e precificado como 5 estrelas e que não entrega o serviço.

title: The Best Hands Down
text: The best hotel in any city in North America. Incredibly unique and wonderful experience with the best wellness amenities at your disposal that you imagine. The check in experience is smooth, the hotel's GM is always moving through the hotel and the rooms are spacious, quiet, comfortable and equipped with the best sleep system of any property I've stayed at. While it is a luxury price point as well the same dollar spent at other hotels of this caliber don't offer anywhere near the amenities and opportunities for rest, recovery and wellness. I also appreciate that they are located a very short walk from the Blade heliport making my transfer from the airport to the hotel the quickest and most direct of any other property in Manhattan. I will never stay at another hotel in NYC. This is by far the best.

title: Increíble vista
text: Increíble vista. La piscina en la terraza es muy buena. No permite niños así que es súper tranquila. La atención fue muy buena, la decoración e implementación de los cuartos también muy buena. Nos tuvieron que cambiar de habitación pero todo ok.

title: perfection for the workout bro, but not a top level stay
text:
I’ve written a lot of reviews about hotel gyms because for me that is a necessary amenity and a distinguishing feature.  Here, nothing to do but applaud, as this hotel is attached to a massive Equinox gym, of course. Everything you need is there, from cardio to weights to swimming; it is heaven for the fitness enthusiast.  It is my main reason to return. However, I think they price themselves like a luxury property but do not hit the level.  

The hotel’s brand is about health and well-being and they mostly hit the mark. The in-room yoga mat and related equipment, well-being tutorials on an iPad, the wide array of healthy snacks and other products for sale in the room - beyond a minibar.  However, food offerings were not as elevated or healthy as you might expect from a fitness oriented property – the breakfast options were basic and limited, like what you would get at any hotel these days (breakfast sandwich, omelette, pancakes . . . ). I would have loved to see protein smoothies, for example. 

I did enjoy the choice of a morning invigorating shower gel and an evening calming version in the bathroom, but the water pressure was annoyingly low. Towels / bath sheets not generous in size – they feel like gym towels, a little small and scratchy.  

A real irritation was a design flaw of the building: there are only two elevators on the ground floor, which meant delays and crowds trying to get up to reception every time I had to go in and out.  (see photo)

Service was really average; most staff were not well trained and were unengaged; front door staff never offered to help with luggage or give guidance.  Housekeeping was minimal. Waitstaff were unpolished.  

Overall, perfection for the workout bro, but needs to step up to be considered a luxury property.

title: When working out is top of your agenda!
text:
The hotel staff, the room and amenities were all spot on. As for the gym, it was much more than one would expect from a hotel. In fact. It would be better to compare that with purely focused gyms to do it justice.

The way the hotel took health and wellbeing and saw it through every single detail was fantastic.

The location might be in newer a neighborhood, but you are definitely very close to where you would want to be; whether on a work or a leisure trip.

Well done and I will definitely stay there again.

title: Equinox Hotel Great Experience
text: Our stay at Equinox Hotel made our NYC visit very relaxing! Traveling with a new baby is a bit challenging, and the hotel was more than comfortable to spend most of the day. It was game changing to have a full sized gym in our hotel. The views from the gym and our room were spectacular. The service was excellent, our stay started and ended with great service from Andy the second we walked into the door until our departure. Andy was very personable and always with a pleasant attitude. The restaurant on property, Electric Lemon was consistently good. The location was convenient. Overall great stay. 10/10 would recommend.

title: Great Hotel! Rejuvenating Stay!
text: I normally stay in Midtown but I wanted to try something different. I booked with Fine Hotel and Resorts and the hotel provided all the great amenities it offers including a very good room upgrade. The accommodations were excellent and the staff was great. The Hotel itself is more like a resort which is unusual in New York City. I had just lost my father, who I was very close to, a few weeks before and I arrived somewhat depressed. I left in a better place. Thank you for a great stay.

title: Great stay!
text: The people who work here make you feel welcomed from the moment you walked it. Everyone was very attentive and people at the front desk were very knowledgeable. Every request was met. Our rooms were very clean, and had a beautiful view. Thank you

title: HUDSON YARDS
text:
Hotel top!
Novo, quartos grandes ,vista linda, e com um bar super animado e concorrido
Uma NY diferente, parece que vc está em Miami, devido a localização e aos prédios vizinhos , que são todos novos e modernos
Recomendo a experiência!

title: Great room, but terrible food and service
text:
We stayed at the Equinox Hotel for US Open since the hotel is next to the Subway line 7 final stop, so that we can get to Billy Jean King Tennis Centre without transfer. Here’re our experience with staying at the hotel:

Highlights:
1. The room itself is impressive, absolutely love it. 
2. The room service is really fast and responsive.

Complaints:
1. We can barely use the hotel amenities, especially the outdoor pool. Since all the hotel amenities also available to all equinox club members so it’s pretty chaotic and crowded. We went down to the pool in a Saturday afternoon, it was 6 hours wait time and you can only use the bed for 90 mins to lie down/chill which is unheard of. Besides, there’re people everywhere laying on the floor, it looked like refugee camp, not gonna lie. It’s pretty absurd, hotel guest pay almost $1000 a night, can’t even use/enjoy the amenities, never had such experience with other luxury hotels.
2. The food quality from the hotel room service and the restaurant are terrible. We ordered room service one morning for breakfast. The omelet looked super sad and texture was very rubbery, worst omelet ever. Electric Lemon, the food is GROSS, the salad we ordered had some spoiled pieces, absolutely disgusting. 
3. The service is horrible. The staff works at the gym, pool and restaurant all seemed very entitled. I don’t understand why do they think they’re better than everyone. No one was friendly and helpful, in this aspect, Equinox Hotel is far away from being a real luxury hotel brand.

title: Best staycation ever!!
text:
Last min birthday surprise for my wife’s bday!! From the moment we arrive we were impressed by the service. Bellman, doorman, concierge and management. Everyone seemed to know us like they knew us for years. 
The rooms are amazing with great city views and high tech but simple. Clean is an understatement..you feel like you were the first to ever stay in these rooms. 
The experience the equinox hotel offers is unique. You could stay on property and have everything you need or walk outside to all the city has to offer!
Hudson yards is remarkable!!

title: Excellent
text:
Stayed for two days - we actually shortened our pre-booked stay in another NYC hotel to move over to the Equinox, And we were not disappointed. 
It’s a great now area down at Hudson Yards, busy and modern architecture. Staff was very friendly, the offer access to the great gym inhouse (unfortunately not for kids to the pool). 
Will definitely return.

title: Outstanding in all areas!
text:
Equinox hotel is my favourite hotel in NYC, hands down! I travel a great deal (200 nights a year) and usually stay at better hotels in London, Miami and NYC. Equinox is outstanding in all areas, rooms are perfectly appointed w/ technology, bathroom showers to pillow/bed comfort choices. Service and food are also outstanding. Electric Lemon has a menu that is nearly perfect with outstanding culinary quality. The service is as well great, Daniel Gomez the Front Manager has his team on point.  And they have gone above and beyond even to arrange that I was looked after to make it to my flight in time by a transport to the airport by Blade helicopter (not expensive). 

I’ve now stayed about 5X over the past 4 months in Equinox and it continues to deliver each time. The Hudson Yards area also is so much fun to be in NYC - safe, fun and always something going on.  The Equinox pool, gym and spa is Great too.

title: US Open Stay
text: The property is extremely luxurious one of the best stays I’ve ever had the service is top notch and I would highly recommend to anybody I will definitely be coming back and staying at this property!!

title: World class hotel
text: The hotel was beyond impress. Daniel G helped make my trip over the top. From impossible reservations to acquire to simply every detail accounted for, everything was amazing! And I loved the close proximity to the helicopter service, Blade.

title: what a hotel!
text:
Best hotel I’ve ever been to.
Love the club and spa the view is amazing. I will only stay stay equinox when I visit NY. The experience was second to none, I can’t see myself staying anywhere else. Very impressed.

title: Exceptionnel
text: Superbe hôtel dans un quartier très bien situé à New York. Cet hôtel est un petit bijou artistique, la déco est top. les chambres sont spacieuses et superbes, la vue est magique! Le personnel de la réception et de la conciergerie sont au top. Le bar en terrasse est un endroit privilégié, la piscine est unique et l’ambiance atypique. Nous avons adoré notre séjour et reviendrons avec grand plaisir. La station de métro est à deux minutes à pied ce qui rajoute un bonus à cet hôtel. La proximité de la High Line aussi

title: Splurge and Stay Here!
text:
My husband and I booked a three night stay to celebrate our 60th bdays and 33rd wedding anniversary at Equinox because we wanted to make it special. And it certainly was. 

Initially, I was a bit apprehensive because it seems to be tailored to the younger crowd, not the ahem older demographics. Instagram is packed with sexy shots of influencers doing their thing. I almost cancelled but then decided to take a change. And so happy I did.

In Hudson Yards, it is an ideal location for accessing the High Line and Hudson River Path, and  Chelsea and the Village. 

The staff here is gracious, welcoming, and go out of their way to ensure your stay is perfect. Our room, a junior suite was fantastic. Large, high tech, with views of the Hudson and City, it exceeded our expectations. I always have a hard time sleeping in hotels-not here-the mattress was firm but comfortable, the pillows perfectly plump, and the duvet light and airy. It was like  drifting off on a cloud. I told my husband that we needed to upgrade our ancient mattress with one of these gems. I have got a thing for toiletries and loved their offerings. 

We had lunch at Electric Lemon as soon as we checked in and the food (burger and polenta fries) were delicious- and so were the two glasses of wine we both sipped on while contemplating our trip to see Serena play at the US Open. 

We breakfasted there as well and had terrific meals. The coffee was hot and bold. The Eggs Benedict was cooked to perfection. All their items are healthy but you still felt you were splurging. 

Sadly, I was unable to book a service at the spa-it was a last minute thought after walking 20 miles the day before and needing a bit of TLC, so I would recommend booking ahead or seeing the concierge. I had intended to visit the gym and (Soul Cycle) but decided at the last minute to forgo  it and left my gear at home. The first time I have ever done that. And the last. Lesson learned, when in doubt, toss it in. 

Though the crowd was young, there were plenty of age ranges, and when my eyes met another group of older people, I smiled. There were families and couples enjoying their stay. 

My husband and I both agreed we could not have chosen a better place to stay.

title: Modern luxury hotel though not perfect
text:
Stayed here for 6 nights and received a warm welcome at the lobby by the concierge.  When I arrived up at reception at 5.30pm my room was not yet ready and I was instantly offered a credit to my account, which was appreciated.  The hotel and room itself are very smart and modern, with an incredible view of downtown NYC from the 36th floor.  The room was very comfortable, fantastic bed and pillows, great bathroom although the shower pressure was a little low.

Unfortunately, I did suffer two nights with a noisy neighbour who's loud talking and singing at 3am could very clearly be heard (and loudly) through the walls.  The room was certainly not soundproof.  On both occasions I had to call reception, who even at that time of night answered quickly and all went quiet a few minutes later.  After the second occasion I did ask to move rooms, and this was done without fuss and I was moved to an improved and much quieter room.  A newly built hotel in this price range should really have soundproofed rooms though.

Housekeeping were excellent, leaving additional amenities when asked for and then remembering to refresh them a couple of days later without asking.  The one time I had to call for an item via the in-room ipad, it was literally delivered within a few minutes.

The gym doesn't really need any comment - it's way, way above standard hotel gyms.

I had breakfast three days in the restaurant.  Food quality is very good, service was a little rough around the edges at times (staff stood in a group talking or all of them  somewhere out the back of the restaurant).  A number of items available on room service weren't available on the restaurant menu which was disappointing.

Overall though a very enjoyable stay, its just a shame that the noise impacted two nights otherwise it would have been a 5-star review.

title: Destination Hotel in NYC
text: On our first stay at the Equinox Hotel in NYC, we didn’t really know what to expect other than a first-rate gym. This hotel exceeded our expectations then and has continued to exceed them. The rooms are peaceful and quiet with lots of thoughtful touches including darkening shades that actually work, a comfortable bed, a yoga mat, and a foam roller. Our dog gets the royal treatment with his own bed and bowls. The in-room dining food is excellent (avocado toast!) and anything we need is brought to the room within minutes. We enjoy the indoor and outdoor pools and the rooftop terrace restaurant. We’ve also discovered some great restaurants close to the hotel, like Ci Siamo, Katsuya, and Milos, and the hotel is steps from the High Line. Having said all that, it’s the people who consistently make this a 5-star experience for us:  Andy and Dovon at the entrance who couldn’t be more welcoming and helpful; the Concierge and Reception who always handle all our requests with a smile; and the amazing massage therapist Jorge at the Equinox Spa. We travel a lot, and it’s rare to find a hotel with these amenities that is firing on all cylinders.

title: This hotel is AMAZING, perfect staycation for two
text:
I have nothing but positive things to say about my experience staying at Equinox hotel in Hudson Yards, NYC.

First off, I want to also mention I am a long time Equinox member, but this was my first time actually staying at the property in NYC. I decided to take a little staycation here for a few nights and it was the perfect way to break out of my normal day to day and experience high luxury living at a STUNNING hotel property. One of the most aesthetically pleasing hotels in the city.

Check-in was seamless, arrived early so I got a coffee in the Starbucks downstairs - there's also a juice press, and a ton of restaurants and things to do in that area. Great location.

The room was beautiful. We faced the water, such a nice view. My favorite things about the room in particular:

-The shower and the shampoo/conditioner smells INCREDIBLE. like a real spa.
-The snack bar was 10/10
-Bed was super comfortable and spacious for two
-They brought a really cute dog bed for our dog, and he was super happy
-Digital in room dining

The pool was by far the best part of the stay too. We enjoyed the spa (did cryotherapy, it was great!) and then headed to the pool. Perfect for the summer, tanned, worked, and had some lunch by the pool...overlooking the best views of the city. 

I definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC, or wanting a little staycation.

title: A physical / mental health-minded oasis
text:
In the midst of what is a bustling and energetic city, Equinox Hotel NY is a tranquil escape for those who need a health-focused stay. It's one of the few hotels that's convinced me to break major hotel brand loyalty. 

Aside from its well-known fitness facilities, Equinox Hotel offers great dining (both in-room and restaurant) along with a unique spa (equipped with a wave table that allows your body to get the equivalent of a few hours of sleep in a fraction of the time - and it seems to actually work). 

The location is ideal for those looking to explore New York's vibrant and rapidly-expanding Hudson Yards.

GM Nathan and his team have curated a unique hotel stay worth experiencing.

title: Romantic Staycation
text: This was an incredible location for a little staycation close to home.  The Equinox hotel is an incredible experience in every regard - from the moment you arrive to Hudson Yards you are cared for an attended to as if you were the only guest on site.  The staff throughout the hotel, in every department, were gracious, caring, and remarkably attentive.  The design elements in the public spaces are rivaled only by the guestroom, and the guestroom experience.  Absolutely cannot wait to return to this oasis in the city.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Beautiful hotel with excellent amenities. The real gem here is the team that staffs the hotel. Each team member would greet me and say hello when walking by. The front desk was able to answer all of my questions. Everyone was friendly and pleasant.

title: What an incredible stay!
text:
My husband and I had an incredible stay at the Equinox Hotel in the Hudson Yards. We booked this for our 10th anniversary. My husband never really cared to visit NYC, but this hotel and the area totally changed his mind on NYC. 

From the moment you arrive, the staff make you feel like you are literally the most important person to them. They greet you, they help you navigate around the area of the Hudson Yards and everything is literally at your fingertips in moments because they care that much. The Bellmen at the door were so kind, always greeting you by name always happy to help you and out a smile on your face. The registration desk on the 25th floor, they were incredibly prompt and check in was the most prompt and smooth as ever. Dan, the employee at the registration desk was a such a kind soul. He knew us by name and was always checking in to ensure we had it all. This hotel is the real deal, totally worth everything. 

The hotel room was impeccable and the detail was extremely extensive and well thought out. The sleep we had was all because of the ambiance of the room and all the incredible features. There is no noise at all despite having a 60 000 sq ft fitness area. Everything is at your fingertips and anything else is going to be available I can assure you. 

I’m so happy we stayed at the Equinox. I didn’t want to leave. I can’t say enough about this hotel experience. If you’re looking for luxury, look no other place. Don’t book the others (Four Seasons, Trump) this hotel is extraordinary! The area also is accessible for everything, shops restaurants, beautiful High line. It’s got it all. To make it even better, the view of the Hudson River or city, it’s up to you. 

Thank you thank you Equinox! If anyone has questions do not hesitate to ask me about this phenomenal luxurious hotel.

title: The premier place to stay in NYC
text: I've had the opportunity to stay at Equinox Hotel several times now, and I have yet to be disappointed. From the staff, to the rooms, and especially the amenities everything was 1st class and exceptional.

title: Excelente Hotel, experiência acima do esperado
text:
O Hotel está em uma localização moderna, ao lado do Highlline, Wessel, Shopping e Hudson River. A academia do 4º andar é super completa, piscina outdoor e índoor impecáveis com vistas para todos os lados.
O Rooftop possui um bar e restaurante com um terraço bonito, tomei um Dirnk Old Fashion muito bom, além de entradas e um Filet muito saboroso.
O Apartamento com vistas fabulosas é o que tem de mais moderno em tecnologia com um Tablet para controlar todas as funções do quarto. Dimmer para iluminação de todo o quarto além de luz noturna que se acende ao
Pisar no chão saindo da cama. Amenities ótimos, bath soaps com aromas diferenciados para acalmar ou revigorar. Com certeza voltarei.

title: A professional team, clean, functional and beautiful design
text:
From the very start, first impression of the Equinox Hotel is impressive. The design, style, uniforms, ambiance of the lobby and even the amenities of the room are perfectly put together... Down to even the dog bed amenities are on point! 
Having worked in the industry, I can say that the room was immaculately clean. We enjoyed room service, that can be ordered via an iPad provided. The order came in a very clever stack of boxes that was easy to use. Do check our the outdoor pool and the gym/spa!! 
Thank you for the wonderful experience!

title: Best rooms in NYC if you want a modern place
text:
After spending years going from hotel to hotel in New York City, the Equinox has become my favourite option. It might not appeal to those looking for a place with "character", but unless the need for exposed bricks and old school decor is a must, the Equinox is simply impeccable.

Rooms are just the best in town at the moment. Super quiet (thanks to the quality of the build), great finishes, functional, bright, comfortable. Very little carpeting (thus improving cleanliness). Silent air conditioning. Great lighting. Blackout blinds. Wonderful showers.

Service has always been consistently impeccable (in a city where consistency of service nowadays is rare to find). Room service food options are refreshingly awesome (think fruit bowls, smoothies, a great variety of fruit, alongside the heavier options for those who still eat eggs benedict in 2022...).

I can't quite figure out the clientele, but I am happy to report that in multiple stays I've never had noise issues (this brings back memories of loud crowds partying in the corridors of Casa Cipriani or the now defunct Nomad...).

An added plus is the proximity to the Blade heliport (an easy 10 minute walk or 3 minute uber ride), which means super easy connections to JFK.

For a regular business traveller, the Equinox is a dream.

title: First class stay
text: We stayed at the Equinox Hotel for our 60th wedding anniversary. The attention to details in the front desk and concierge was exceptionally good. We were not thrilled with the salad at the Electronic Lemon. It was a bunch of vegetables, but not like a typical salad. When there was a TV issue, the hotel provided a very fair adjustment to our bill.

title: Performance Maximizing Luxury
text: NY has an energy of possibility like no other place.  Possibilities to create, to learn, to dine, to play - to live fully.  I love how each neighborhood offers its own distinct set of possibilities.  My new favorite over the past couple of years has become Hudson Yards, largely because of the Equinox Hotel.  As a long-time fan of the Equinox franchise, I've come to appreciate the beauty, consistency and quality of the Equinox experience.  The personal training/fitness teams deliver unmatched excellence.  All that combined with an "everyone knows your name" local bar ethos.  The Equinox Hotel carries that same alchemy into a transient residential experience.  The Equinox Hotel is a NY neighborhood experience unto itself.  The gym is one of the best in the fleet - the views inspire top of the curve workouts.  The rooms are more like apartments and the sleeping systems - the bed, the black out shades , and the extra sound proofing allow me to rise rested and ready.  The bar at Electric Lemon never disappoints.  As a titanium for life ambassador level member of Marriott's Bonvoy program, Equinox HY is really the only hotel in the world I'm willing to regularly stay at and to forgo the significant frequent quest benefits and perks I receive at St. Regis and Ritz-Carlton properties; Equinox is worth it!!  I stay at Equinox twice a month or so and now consider it more of a home experience than a hotel experience.

title: Incredible Hotel in my favorite location
text:
I love everything about NYC and all it has to offer. The moment I land I can feel the cities energy….I love it! 

I usually change up my hotel every time we go to the city since there are so many great spots but I think I found my forever hotel. From the moment we checked in super early in the am and they were able to get us a room by 10:30 am and wow was it modern and beautiful. Everyone that works at the Equinox hotel is so kind, helpful and made out stay extra special. 

I’m a huge fan of the Hudson Yards and The Edge right next to the hotel and the high line is right at the hotel which will take you to my favorite spot The Chelsea market. The area is super safe, so many great restaurants and shops all around and the new buildings are incredible to look at. 

5 out of 5 and I’m picky!!!! 

Stop looking and just book! 

The bar is a hip spot but we didn’t hear noise up in our room, which is great. The restaurant was really good and had a lot of options. The gym is my namaste and the pool is flirty and fun. 

Check out Milos at the Hudson Yard and go to the Edge for the best view!

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text: Stayed here several times. Always leave here wanting to come back. It feels like I’m staying in my own apartment in NYC. Every inch of the room has been well thought out and geared towards comfort, recovery, and luxury. Easiest the best night sleep I’ve ever gotten in any hotel. Can’t wait to come back.

title: Beautiful but noisy room
text:
Positives:

Rooms- extremely comfortable bed, large shower with 3 spray heads, the best lighting and full length mirror, friendly and excellent housekeeping, loved Hudson River view , one touch lighting and drapery control, delicious room service  breakfast pastry basket and loved the bento box presentation rather than bulky hotel cart   

Negatives:  iPad dirty with fingerprints and broken and not fixed our entire 3 day stay so had to call each morning to order breakfast, bellman did not offer to help us with our 2 bags when we arrived, window was very dirty which spoiled the beautiful view, room was very noisy- could hear doors slamming constantly, Friday night we were kept up until 4am by loud blaring music- we could not figure out where it was coming from! Upon checking in - only 1 robe and 1 pair of slippers in room, more towels need to be provided, no prices in room for minibar,
Uber drivers struggle with hotel location.

Bottom line- rooms really modern and wonderful at this hotel, but it doesn’t come close to providing 5 star service. Upgrade was not offered through Amex FHR program, no welcome amenity and nothing in writing provided about benefits.  That is a first for me at a FHR property.  Room was too noisy!! Really difficult to get a good night’s sleep.

Also the location is a big negative for me. Not close to anything - 20 minutes to SoHo and 20 minutes to 5th Avenue.  

If you are coming for the Equinox gym and spa experience, I think you will be happy. But if coming for a 5 Star luxury hotel experience- you may be disappointed.

title: The most exquisite 5 stars
text:
The health club amenities alone differentiate this hotel from every other 5 star hotel in the world. The only remotely close experience is the Ritz Carlton Hong Kong but it is a very distant second. 

This hotel has a sublime in room experience and I recommend everyone booking a water view suite in order to relax in the evening and watch incredible sunsets over the Hudson. 

The mattress is unlike anything I have ever slept on and the unique dual duvet was unexpected but incredible. This rates as the best nights sleep in a hotel of my life. 

The spa was also incredible with a great massage. Book now and enjoy the best hotel Manhattan has to offer.

title: What a stay!
text: From the moment of greeting at the front desk, it was a luxury NYC stay to a T! The room was well appointed and thoughtful and the design was something out of AD. While not a suite, the room was massive for NYC standards. It was designed in a way that felt like a relaxation room and studio apt wrapped in one. The city view room was just that. Sweeping views to say the least! The private bar was well stocked and curated to Equinox type guests: healthy snacks, typical PB accoutrements and some wellness options too. I slept better than I have in YEARS and had a hard time believing the clock when I woke. All around, I can’t say enough about the attentive care and thought that goes into each stay. Thank you for a wonderful NYC visit!

title: Absolutely incredible!
text:
This hotel is less than three miles from my home but makes me feel I'm a million miles away.  There are not enough good things to say.  This is our third time there and it just keeps getting better. 
It is chic, sexy, clean, fun, friendly, helpful and just the place to be! 
Make sure you see Mike at Broken Coconut and ask for Oscar in mgmt.  Two very wonderful people.
Whatever review I could create would not do it justice.  Thanks for another fantastic experience.

title: High performance facility
text: Very classy and sophisticated hotel. I stayed here whilst in the middle of training for a marathon. The athletic facilities and attention to detail of the in room elements when it comes to performance and recovery is the best I have ever seen at a hotel. If you are looking to stay on top of your fitness levels whilst travelling then this is definitely the place to stay.

title: What a gem!!!!
text: I have stayed at the Equinox Hotel multiple times now, what a gem! Modern sophisticated luxury! Staff is absolutely phenomenal from check in, to housekeeping and in room dining, polite, engaged, friendly, anticipatory, exactly what you expect from a 5 star hotel. Rooms are designed for ultimate relaxation and best sleep EVER. Room service offers an extensive menu to please all tastes and pallets, they even have a vegan menu - blue corn tacos and acai bowl were a hit. Electric Lemon offers similar health conscious menu, friendly staff and beautiful décor(dont miss an opportunity to try their cocktails on the terrace)

title: Couples Staycation
text:
We booked this as a staycation to escape the city hustle and the outcome was exactly what we hoped for. The check-in was seamless and quick, we felt welcomed immediately and the ambiance took you to a place of luxury. The staff was helpful, remembered our names and guided us to suggestions that suited our taste. Our room was spacious, pristine and relaxing - I could have stayed there all day, lounging in their lightweight robe and plush slippers taking in the view of the Hudson. We seamlessly ordered breakfast to our room right from the rooms Ipad. The menu was built for both savory and sweet palates, offering a well fueled start to your day. I wish I could recreate their super latte and berry açaí bowl. 

The restaurant was stunning, with a modern and comfortable vibe. I especially appreciated how health forward the menu was, curated with nutritious options that did not sacrifice taste. I highly recommend the mezcal cleanse, summer garden salad and Duck. 

The spa was very health forward and offered several packages to suit your needs. We booked right on the spot and got a spa treatment within 30-minutes. It was heaven, and the relaxation room was the perfect space to recharge with infused water, a view and comfy seating.

title: Smart, Sophisticated, and Sexy... Great Luxury Experience
text: From the moment we arrived at the hotel and greeted by staff, in their chic casual white sweatsuits and reception staff in white suits, the overall vibe is smart and sexy.  The interior design is sophisticated and luxurious, consistent throughout the lobby, reception, restaurant, amenity spaces, and room.  Hotel staff met every request, and delivered a five star experience over the course of our stay.  The ability to effortlessly access the Equinox fitness club, pool, and spa were the highlight of the experience.  Just as meticulously crafted with high design, no other hotel can measure up to the health and wellness centric amenity offering.  With all the new shops and restaurants of Hudson Yards at your fingertips, this was a complete package for a weekend escape.  We left this getaway weekend rejuvenated and refreshed.

title: The best stay for the modern and discerning traveler
text:
There is little doubt that this is at the pinnacle of luxury hotels in both manhattan and maybe the world. The mattress and sleep system is unlike any of the horrible cushy mattresses with springs... instead you are on a platform with the most unique and incredible mattress which I just learned the hotel will actually sell or facilitate. Either way it will be replacing all mattresses at my summer home.

Additionally I am a daily sauna and ice bath practitioner and am able to replicate this routine in the spa with cryo and infrared or conventional sauna (something I am unable to do at almost every other hotel I stay at across the globe). 

The staff is well educated, friendly and accommodating. I have stayed several times but not enough to be recognized yet they remember me at the front door. 

Nothing better for me

title: Great Service and Spacious Rooms
text: The rooms were spacious, had  We were immediately greeted by Andy De La Cruz who went above and beyond for us during our stay for the weekend. He was very welcoming and professional. We look forward to seeing him again and staying at the Equinox soon!

title: Great experience
text: The room selection exceeded expectations. The view was as promised. Clear view of the Hudson River across from the mall with a faint view of the Statue of Liberty in the distance. Customer service matched! All of the hotel staff was very friendly not to mention, on a very busy weekend I didn’t hear any of my hotel neighbors at all!

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: Best hotel from the staff, to the decor, to the rooms and the location.  Gym is amazing. We took the classes in the gym and they were terrific. The concierge services were extremely helpful. No need to stay anywhere else. It has it all.

title: Incredible experience! Great Service.
text: We had a wonderful trip staying at the equinox. Not only was the staff professional, but the service was impeccable and was able to deliver items to the room in a timely manner, no matter how busy and short staffed they might of been. I look forward to my next visit.

title: Absolutely Amazing!
text: Stayed at the Equinox Hotel and had an unbelievable experience!  This luxury 5 star property truly embodies all the beautiful touches and guest experiences that one would expect. All staff were attentive, friendly, and welcoming! From the well appointed spacious and clean guest rooms, to the amazing amenities!  We experienced the fitness club, the spa, the pool and dined at electric lemon which was delicious! If you are looking for a true 5 star hotel in NYC look no further than equinox Hotel. An amazing and memorable experience and I look forward to returning soon!!

title: Elevated and energizing!
text: Beautiful hotel with breathtaking views.  Guestrooms were modern, spacious and immaculately clean.  Utilized the pool, fitness club & spa services.  All were exceptional!  Enjoyed cocktails on the roof deck and had a wonderful dinner at Electric Lemon.  Would highly recommend this special place in the heart of Hudson Yards.  One of the best luxury travel experiences I have ever had!

title: Wow!!!
text: Wow! La palestra, la piscina, le camere, la pulizia, la posizione...tutto perfetto! Le camere sono spaziose, dotate di ogni confort, la vista è impagabile...C'è poco da dire:un albergo bellissimo dove vorrei tornare! E per gli amanti del fitness è il top!

title: Absolutely exceptional experience for me and 30 guests!
text: Exceptional hotel with exceptional service. I hosted an event for 30 guests and everyone had a phenomenal experience. If you have a group event contact Jenny and Sarah; no detail was left unturned.  My guests loved the hotel, pool, terrace, Electric Lemon, and the location.  The concierge service is first class and will help with all of your needs. The AM/PM yoga in the room was a great way to get the morning started and end the evening; pair that with the AM (citrus) body cleanser and the PM (lavender) body cleanser and you will be sure to start and end your day perfectly.  Don't forget to use the bedside tablet to control the temperature and lighting in the room. The entire staff goes above and beyond!!  I am looking forward to our next event/stay!

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC
text: I spend 50-60 nights a year in Manhattan.   For context I spend 150-175 days a year in hotels.  NYC is the only city in the world I don’t have a ‘go to’ hotel.  My usual default luxury options don’t have good NYC options. And as a result I move around.  About a year ago I decide to try Equinox.  What a wonderful and pleasant surprise!  I have now stayed 7 or 8 times and each visit continues to impress me.  Attentive staff, pre-arrival room set-up is always perfect.  Perhaps the most comfortable hotel bed in NYC.  Anything that is not perfect is made perfect.  I finally have a great NYC hotel!

title: Our stay was beyond wonderful. The rooms, spa and restaurants were all absolutely wonderful. Would Abel recommend…
text: Our stay was absolutely amazing. If you are looking for a world class hotel for your NY stay look no further. The spa, especially the infrared sauna and cryotherapy were superb. The restaurant and bar offer amazing dishes and cocktails. The gym and overall amenities were, as expected, beyond clean and well maintained (put your Covid fears to rest). Our room had a full view of the Hudson and it was so beautiful to wake up to that view. The staff was incredibly accommodating and friendly. Won’t stay anywhere else while in NY. Highly recommend…

title: EXCELLENT stay!!!!
text: I usually stay in uptown for business meetings but decided to give it a try and stay at the Equinox Hotel for the first time and the decision paid off beyond expectations. The stay was better and more welcoming than all other 5 star hotels I had stayed in previously. Exceptional service, premium comfort and great food at their restaurant and lounge.  Not a single negative experience and all aspects of my stay taken care of. My new to go hotel in NY!

title: Incredible stay at Equinox Hotel NYC
text:
I usually don’t write reviews, but this one I feel really good about writing. We have had the best experience here! The  entire staff is incredible, and extra gratitude to the manager Nathan and to the welcome  bell staff who is so incredibly nice, kind and helpful. We feel so welcomed and taken care of by everyone. The vibe is amazing, luxurious, relaxed, classy and fun, with modern sleek designs and the food is healthy and delicious.  I just love it! 

Me and my husband have had the privilege to travel a lot throughout our years together and have stayed at many hotels, and now having stayed here… I am certain that Equinox hotel NYC is one of the best hotels in the world based on my own experience. 
Thank you all 🙏🏻💛

title: Incredible Stay!
text:
We came to stay 10 for days and we loved it so much it became 3 weeks. The rooms are so sleek and stylish. The food is top notch and so healthy. The staff is so kind and helpful. They welcome you like it is home. Say hi to TJ! He’s almost 7 feet tall and the nicest most personable teddy bear you’d ever want to meet. 

Spa might be my favorite in NYC amenities at the hotel are beyond what I expected. Cryotherapy, wave bed, great masseuses and an infrared sauna are unique features that kept me coming back. 

Electric Lemon restaurant on the fourth floor has an incredible vibe and the sunsets from the terrace are as beautiful as anywhere in the city. 

Hudson yards is new and cool. Everything feels modern, almost futuristic. Shopping across the parkway and the high line allows for nature in your front yard. 

Without a doubt my favorite hotel in NY and I’ll be back and recommending my friends stay at Equinox as well. 

And lastly Nathan, the manager is one of a kind, his personality thoroughness and attention to detail are unmatched. 

MB

title: Thank you!

title: Rare unique stay in NYC
text: Really cool and unique hotel in the city! The pool had a one-of-kind view of The Vessel on one side and the river on the other. It also had a cooler, more relaxed vibe than other rooftop pools in the city that turn into loud, dirty parties. The restaurant has a very unique terrace and tranquil vibe with ~chill~ music. The spa offered many health-centric add ons like vitamin drips and cryotherapy. My husband and I opted for a cyro session, followed by 30 minutes in the infrared sauna (both of which we were allowed to do together which was nice) and then cbd massages. We left feeling amazing and refreshed. The rooms were really what drove us to choose this hotel though. They’re designed for the ultimate sleep experience: perfect sleep temp, black out curtains & quiet mode, and 2 separate duvets on the bed to not disturb your partner. It’s an ideal room if you’re not great sleepers like us. The room also comes equipped with complimentary yoga mat and resistant bands if you’d like to get in a workout in your room- although you won’t need to since the stay comes with access to the health club membership perks like unlimited fitness classes. Although we wanted to relax, we just had to take advantage of the access and do a Pilates class in the morning. Overall it was a great experience and a cool place to stay in New York. If you’re a fitness/health junkie-this place is for you.

title: Fantastic!
text: I’m not one to write reviews but would be a huge disservice for anyone missing out on the experience at the Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards. Equinox hotel has it all and is absolutely stunning, in a great location. With that being said, I live one block away, which is in Hudson yards and still chose this hotel for a staycation. It has everything you need from decor, spa (which we spent most of our day) pool, outdoor & indoor with views of the Vessel, NYC skyline and the hudson river. The staff, food, atmosphere were top notch but the rooms were the best! Their rooms are stunning and might be one of the best night sleeps i’ve had in years. My wife and I will be making this a yearly ritual at the Equinox hotel as our staycation and recommend this hotel for anyone visiting NYC.

title: Stunning hotel & location but don’t plan on getting a sunbed!
text:
We arrived in a boiling and sunny NYC after a long flight from London. It’s our first time in NYC and we were so excited to land here and make use of the facilities. We had deliberately booked this hotel as we knew the weather would be good and we had hopes of spending some days lounging around the outdoor pool, one of the largest in NYC, as we slept off the jet lag and partying.

The hotel is gobsmackingly beautiful and we had a fabulous view from the 30th floor, taking in Hudson Yards, river and Freedom Tower glistening in the distance.

Within an hour of checking in we headed down to the pool and then discovered the biggest setback - the pool is shared by hotel guests, gym users and others and is incredibly over-subscribed. You have to put your name/number on the waiting list if you arrive after around noon onwards for a bed with a stated wait time of around two hours at around midday so were squashed on a towel on the terrace with others who were presumably waiting like us. We never got a call all day as the ‘waiting list’ was clearly hundreds deep!

We headed down early a couple of days later to a cold and breezy empty terrace waiting for the sun to come around. Literally freezing cold, we lay there for an hour in the knowledge that when the sun came around, we’d have prime space in the sun. Not so - within minutes of the sun coming around, everyone seemed to turn up and then the pool manager came over and told us that we had already had our beds for over 90 minutes and we had to leave them in ten minutes.

There’s the rub - beds can only be kept for 90 minutes, presumably to allow as many of the gym users to use them as possible.

So basically forget lazy days, lunches and drinks around the pool here - they manage an oversubscribed pool deck incredibly tightly and the whole experience just became stressful as you never quite knew when you might be asked to vacate. We moved from the hotel after three nights to another property and there was not a lot else to enjoy - even the outdoor ‘Lemon’ terrace was closed for a private event, so we never really got to enjoy the £1k/night property as we had hoped.

If you’re here for a holiday, book somewhere else as this hotel seemed to cater far more for the users of the vast gym (Equinox is famous for this).

Nonetheless, it’s a stunning property - just don’t expect to relax here in ‘holiday mode’. The lift situation is also bewildering - you have to get the first lift to the communal areas (reception, bar, terrace), then walk around the floor for the second lift to the rooms - we never quite worked things out.

title: It's the team that make this place extra special!
text: It all started with the amazing Brian, who assisted me when another hotel wanted to charge me extra for their mistake.  I rang from Australia at 5am NYC time and Brian was not only awake but just delightful and full of energy to assist me in finding the right room combination for our family stay.  And it wasn't just Brian, the whole team at the Equinox are delightful, engaging and polite.  But it doesn't stop there, the rooms are lovely, the beds quite possibly the best I've ever slept on and the access to the Equinox Club was a real bonus. It's not in Soho or on 5th Avenue, but it is central to so many things that made it the perfect place to stay for all that New York has to offer. I will definitely be back.

title: VIP Stay in Hudson Yards with Best Fitness Club
text:
Equinox Hotel is not your typical hotel. It's catered to people who prioritize wellness with a touch of luxury. From the check-in process, you are greeted by those in white suits and they will make you feel at home. Shoutout to Brian who was so welcoming! When I checked in, my room wasn't ready so they offered a complimentary drink at the bar in Electric Lemon downstairs. When the room was ready, they had already sent my luggage up and told me in person. What a service!

When I walked into my Junior Suite room with a king bed, I had the view of Hudson River and top of the Vessel. The room comes with nespresso, healthy snacks in mini bar, workout gears like yoga mat and blocks, high end steamer, dyson hair dryer and top of the line Grown Alchemist products. title: An amazing place to stay in Hudson Yards
text:
My wife and I stayed three days at the Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards, an it was a great experience! 

The hotel is obviously quite new, and it was amazing. The people at the front desk made us feel home right away. We got a room upgrade, and got what I believe is called a Skyline Room. The room was very elegant and spacious. The bed was great, and so was the bed linen. It felt new and crispy. We had enough room to stash away our luggage, and that always makes it feel less of a travel and more of home.

We tried out the their SPA. Both of us had the infra red sauna, and my wife tried a drip treatment. She was a little jet lagged, but it all went away after the drip treatment. I went for a swim in the outdoor, but heated lap pool. The pool was long enough to actually get some exercise out of it.

We ate at the restaurant, Electric Lemon, and the food was great. 

The location of the hotel is perfect to check out the new Hudson Yards. We walked the High Line which is located right by the hotel, and which is a great thing to do in NYC. It took us right down to Chelsea Market.

The hotel staff looked out for our luggage the day we checked out, so that we could enjoy more of what the area has to offer.

All in all a great experience which is recomended.

title: Best hotel experience of my life
text: Beautiful suite, amazing service and I really appreciated the wet bar. Dead quiet. This is the only place to stay in New York. Walk out the door and take a great walk on the High Line. Also the gym and sauna!

title: Awesome night away!
text: We stayed here for a quick getaway and it was amazing! The hotel is super cool - the rooms are lovely, the food is excellent and the service is top notch. title: What an incredible sleek hotel!

title: Luxury and kindness at its finest!

title: Classy and Elegant - Top Service and Healthy!
text: We stayed two nights at the Equinox hotel. For someone (myself) who is very picky when it comes to hotels, I fell in LOVE. Four days later and I still can't stop talking about the room service. title: Stay of a lifetime
text: From start to finish, our weekend stay at the Equinox Hotel was impeccable. Immediately greeted upon arrival, front desk walked us to the elevator upon check-in,  and 2 bottles of water waiting for us in the room. Our view was overlooking the Hudson River, and sunsets were stunning. We are used to staying at luxury hotels, but the Equinox experience was just different. The shower alone was worth the price of admission (water pressure, AM and PM body wash, the scents). My wife and I didn't want to leave the room and bathrobes! At night there is a button on the iPad to make the room cool, dark, and quiet....so cool, and an amazing night's rest. Also, any time we called the front desk, they were at our door in minutes. Having a full Equinox just downstairs was incredible and convenient. We were able to maintain our lifestyle away from home (me weight-training, my wife yoga classes). The restaurant was fantastic, and many healthy options. The hotel location is right next to the High-line, which made it super easy to explore and head down to different parts of NYC. Additionally, the Peak is right next door and a can't miss (360 degree views). The concierge set us up with an incredible table for cocktails before our meal at Electric Lemon. Overall, 10/10. We haven't stopped talking about it since, and my wife wants to move in. We cannot wait to go back for round 2

title: Equinox…elevated!
text:
As an Equinox club member for over ten years,  I am accustomed to their branding and style.  My expectations were high when I was able to finally book a stay at their first Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards.  From the moment you walk in, your senses immediately identify the Equinox brand.  The staff at the hotel entrance to the check-in staff are all impeccably dressed and provide the same kind of impeccable service.  Amazing!

The rooms are modern and minimalistic, without the minimalistic feel.  I frequently compared it as a modern Four Seasons.  Everything has been thought through…everything, to the morning body wash and the evening body wash.  All the amenities in the room are above par and represents the brand well.

The only negative that I would mention, would be the pillows.  Once you lie your head on the pillow, within minutes it becomes paper thin and a nuisance—a selection of pillows would be a great complement to their already great amenities.

Also, had to stop by the Spa on the way out to take home two bottles of the shampoo.  :-)

Cannot wait to come back…real soon!
