title: Simply Amazing!!! Highly recommend!!!
text:
Our stay at the Equinox Hotel last weekend exceeded our already very lofty expectations! The hotel design itself was beautifully done and very much fits our aesthetic in that is perfectly blends luxury with modern chic. Every staff member we came across were all so friendly and helpful. 

We fully took advantage of everything the hotel has to offer. Hotel guests can use the Equinox Fitness Club downstairs that blew me away, by far the best Equinox in the city. They have a full lineup of workout classes that are free to join, ample space to do your own workout, great extras like the barrel saunas, steam rooms, eucalyptus towels, etc.

We tried cryotherapy for the first time at the Spa. Would highly recommend this very unique experience. The facilities are very nice and the resting area, that is stocked with snacks, tea, and infused water, was a great place to relax after.

We grabbed drinks at the bar of Electric Lemon - great drinks and vibes. It was a great place to both start and end the night.

Overall, our experience here was phenomenal! There is so much to do in the hotel and a short walk away in the Hudson Yards mall; however, the rooms were so comfortable and well appointed that we could have spent the whole time relaxing there as well! We loved our experience so much and can't wait to be back in the spring/summer!

title: Most incredible Luxury Hotel In New York
text: Wow is the best word to describe my stay at the Equinox. From the minute we pulled up till we left, nothing but top notch customer service and complete elegance. The room was incredible and the view was to die for. The food and hospitality was bar none the best in the city. I cant wait to come back. Nathan and his team were the best in the business!

title: The Perfect Hotel
text:
I was in New York for a business trip and stayed at the Equinox for 5 days and had a phenomenal experience. I'm basically nonstop traveling for work and have stayed everywhere you could imagine. This hotel is definitely one of my favorites. It felt like everything from the layout of  the rooms to the amenities was perfectly thought out and everything felt very nice, elevated, and most importantly clean. I was able to work and rest quietly in my suite.

10/10 location at Hudson Yards. Lovely views and in an area that's convenient but not too touristy throughout the day.

The staff was also super helpful from beginning to end. They helped my assistant get to my room when I wasn't able to go down and get her. I lost a chain while in New York and they were very communicative and helpful in looking for it after my stay.

title: Innovative Luxury Hotel Experience with Top Class Service
text:
The hotel is everything you could want from your New York experience. I have become a regular at the hotel and refuse to stay anywhere else during my travels to New York. 

Staff and management seemingly go out of there way for all guests to delivery service excellence. They are always accommodating, welcoming, professional and personable, overall providing top notch service.

If you're looking for a top class experience at a one of a kind hotel in the heart of Manhattan, this would be my choice over and over again. The rooms are beautifully designed with moody vibes, modern furniture and fixtures. There is nothing quite like the room experience in the hotel, you will likely have the best sleep of your life after putting the room into "Sleep Mode".

Regarding the amenities, the club/hotel has really gone above and beyond. The outdoor pool in the summer time is a hot hangout spot and in the winter they've installed one of a kind outdoor saunas. 

I would recommend the Equinox Hotel to family, friends, colleagues and strangers  looking for the ultimate luxury experience while in New York.

title: Most incredible hotel!
text: Stayed here for a week and had the most incredible stay I could have asked for. The rooms were sound proof and blackout making for the best nights sleep I’ve had in a long time. The staff was on top of every detail and a pleasure to work with. The amenities were outstanding; the gym, spa, pool, and of course the bar, electric lemon. The location was perfect with it being situated in Hudson yards. I will without a doubt be back!

title: Amazing Hotel!
text:
Stayed here for a week recently and had an amazing time. The rooms are sound proof and are blackout leaving you with the most incredible sleep you can have. The rooms were also immaculate and service was outstanding top to bottom. Both spa and gym are incomparable and the vibe at the restaurant can’t be matched. The staff was on top of every detail. I will, without a doubt, be back time and again. 

Derrick

title: Happy at the Equinox Hotel Hudson Yards. Try it.
text:
Returning to Ny  for combination family thanksgiving and business I after years elsewhere decided to experience the Equinox and Hudson yards. The first class hotel service led by Nathan Loga will no doubt bring me back asap. I found a home away from home. In every regard including spa gym food and wonderful staff I felt blessed. Also the lights of Hudson  the Yards at holiday season are
 just beautiful as is the magical views everywhere.  Six star recommendation. Thank you for all. See again soon. Mark C.

title: Luxury & Innovation at it finest! READ THIS REVIEW FULL BREAKDOWN!
text:
I will never stay at another hotel in NYC ever again! It will always be Equinox Hotel when I come into the city moving forward. This was my 2nd time staying at the Equinox Hotel and I truly cannot say enough positive things about this establishment. From the rooms, to the lounges & bars, gym & spa, and service and concierges, everything is top notch. I am typically someone who stays in a Four Season or St. Regis, and I would rate Equinox Hotel above those and any other hotel I have ever stayed in. 

The Rooms - The design of the rooms is spectacular. They are spacious and very well designed. The dark and moody vibes really set the tone for NYC. The decor is beautiful, the lighting is wonderful and has very modern technology for the lights, shades, drapes, AC system, and privacy. You can control everything from the iPad or the wall panel. The rooms are very clean, almost as if you are the first person to stay in that room. The bathroom is gorgeous and spacious and has great lighting and views of the city with floor to ceiling glass. The beds are SO COMFORTABLE, as are the pillows and down comforter. The bar is fully stocked with liquor, snacks, glasses, ice, fridge. The room is also stocked with a yoga mat, yoga block, and workout equipment. Plenty of closet space everywhere!

The Service/Concierges  - Impeccable service! We booked this trip extremely last minute. The manager's name is Nathan, and him and his team are like no other. There were several restaurants we wanted to dine at but they were full booked on Resy and Open Table and we were not able to get a reservation. We sent our list of favorite restaurants to concierges and they were able to book us 2 dinner reservations at exclusive restaurant at a few after hours drink spots. The doormen and valet are extremely welcoming and polite. The hospitality is incredible and everyone is willing to make your stay more enjoyable.

Spa/Gym - Equinox is known for their upscale LA style gyms. They have a beautiful clean gym with everything you can imagine. The spa is gorgeous and provides a full list of any service you could need. Even Cryo which we did the first time we stayed and it was fantastic.

Dining - Electric Lemon is the perfect bar and lounge. It's dark atmosphere and beautiful bar make it perfect for a first date, or a date with you significant other. Comfortable seating with great service. The drinks are all very tasty and made well also! When it's not too cold, you can have drinks at the outdoor lounge near the pool. Perfect view of the NYC skyline and the Vessel. 

Location & Convenience - Equinox's location is perfect, right in Hudson Yards. It's easy to get an Uber to Taxi. Right next to the hotel in short walking distance there is a Starbucks connected, The Vessel which is a perfect Instagram moment, and one of the most gorgeous malls with every store you can think off. There are food trucks right down the street and a quick walk to the Highline an many other restaurants. 

Bottom Line - Look no further if you are looking for the perfect NYC getaway!

title: Beautiful Hotel & Fantastic Location
text: This hotel is designed for luxury! The spaces are gorgeous, the staff is very friendly and helpful and the rooms are stunning & welcoming and oh so comfortable. Every detail is considered for a lovely and relaxing stay. We had breakfast at the restaurant and it was delicious. The service was great and the avocado toast was a hit with our group. You have walking access to many destinations and it's perfect for a stroll on the Highline to the Whitney.  Absolutely recommend!

title: In one word, this hotel is energetic!...
text: In one word, this hotel is energetic!...The location is new and full of energy - great for business travel due to its convenient location and accessible hotel amenities and day to day needs nearby; also great for leisure travel with amenities within the hotel and a self sufficient ecosystem around the hotel. The staff is enthusiastic. And at the risk of repetition. the amenities are unparalleled!

title: Top Notch Hotel- Best hotel I have ever stayed in
text:
As a frequent international and domestic traveler, I can with 100% accuracy and honesty say that this Equinox Hotel in NY, is by far the best hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. The staff is kind, friendly and clearly has a passion for their roles in creating the best experience for all their guests. The hotel is easy to find with a great location. The rooms are immaculate, the food is delicious and their amenities are world class. We travel to New York often for business and no matter where my meetings are in the city, the Equinox Hotel is where I will stay each and every time. Thank you Nathan, and the rest of the staff for the best hotel experience I have ever had. I look forward to staying with you for many years to come! Keep up the hard work.

title: New York is back!
text:
It was a great experience for me and my guests. Beautiful hotel, amazing service, great food at electric lemon.

Concierge was able to accommodate all of our reservation and theater needs. Great to see New York to come back to live and equinox is definitely here to make you feel normal again 😎

title: N/A
text:
Best hotle and staff in town 

Equinox provides that classic New York City luxury atmosphere from the bellmen to the concierge that many have come to expect from hotels such as the Plaza seen in home alone to the modern era. It has fresh new modern and contemporary suit fitted with technology as well as healthy options (by the way the equinox gym is attached and you have full access with your room) like there protein shake in the refrigerator. 

It’s centrally located to all the major attractions as well as most major offices for business needs. I have stayed with them 3 times now and each time I go I feel like it’s home away from home.

title: Staycation
text:
My partner and I decided to do a 2-day staycation in the city from the suburbs because we both had busy days/meetings at the office and didn't want to commute back and forth late at night on the LIRR. We booked the Equinox Hotel due to its proximity to our offices.

We only made the reservation the day prior but were provided with a few room options to select from. We ended us choosing the Deluxe River View Room.

My partner stopped at the hotel earlier in the day to drop his bag off prior to our check-in so that he didn't have to bring it to his office and the hotel had no problem with this.

Upon check-in, we were both asked to provide our proof of vaccination (which made us both feel safer) and were given a run-down of the hotel amenities and offerings before heading up to our room.
The room was quite spacious and well designed in typical Equinox fashion. We were both happy with the blackout shade feature since we are sensitive sleepers.

For the two nights we ate at Electric Lemon after long days at the office. We found the food, drinks, and service to be top notch with our favorites being the Beef Tartare, Dry Aged Duck, and Pumpkin Cheesecake.

We did a combination of both room service and Electric Lemon for breakfast. We especially liked being able to order room service on the in-room iPad and select the time we liked to have it delivered. The avocado toast was our breakfast favorite.

I recently had a shoulder injury so decided to give Cryotherapy a try at the Spa. Booking was easy and prior to booking was given a rundown of the benefits of Cryo and how it would help my injury. This is one of the sleekest Spa's I have ever seen, I was checked-in and brought to the locker room to change into my robe then into the chamber. The 3 minutes went by faster than I expected and I will say that my shoulder pain has eased up since the treatment.

We departed the hotel on our last day with a seamless check out and wishing we still had one more night to relax in the city.

title: The Anniversary Weekend
text:
We lived in Manhattan until November 2019, and were 10 year members of Equinox until we departed the city, it was an obvious choice for us to select the Equinox Hotel for our anniversary weekend this past weekend, it was the absolute right choice.
I called Equinox reservations rather than book online, call me traditional, from the moment the phone was answered the experience began and did not end until after we drove away from the hotel late Sunday morning.
The people who work with this hotel are as sophisticated and accommodating as you come to expect from Equinox brand, they anticipate and accommodate with a sense of style that one would hope for from these skilled professionals.
When we arrived the experience was seamless, there was interaction and it wasn’t pretentious, it was clean, smooth.  The check in process was the same, engaging, personal and not excessive.
The guest room is a tribute to interior design, comfortable and dramatic, especially when the shades roll up and the city is revealed, the views, even for seasoned New Yorkers are memorable.
The room has every possible amenity and it is available unobtrusively and within ease of reach.  The iPad request center is the answer to request fulfillment in an efficient manner, the employees who fulfill requests are present, efficient and unobtrusive, it is how experiential service should be delivered in the 21st century.
Linens on the bed and in the bath are exceptionally high quality with a beautiful finish, amenities are plentiful and presented in bulk, not those wasteful mini-bottles.  The shower stall is spacious, with three different spray heads, and the window into the guest room from the shower emits light when the switch is activated.
The lounge had a great vibe on a Friday evening, our drinks were well crafted, the service was efficient and discrete.
Saturday brunch was delicious, well prepared and served.  Saturday evening in the restaurant, which had a good buzz we relaxed and enjoyed our meal and service.
Sunday breakfast was room service, ordered on line, delivered at the agreed time.  The server was skilled and set breakfast in the room from an insulated delivery pack which he carried into the room.  Coffee was hot and robust, the sunny side up eggs were liquid when cut in, the way they should have been.
Check out was as efficient as every other experience we encountered during the weekend and we are back at this hotel on December 16th, just the way its supposed to be.

title: Beautiful hotel with amazing views for our anniversary
text: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a view of both the river and the shops/the vessel. Everyone we encountered was very welcoming and accommodating. I received a massage and a facial at the spa - exactly what I needed! Gina and Kelly were amazing. We had drinks and dinner at Electric Lemon which was delicious. We can’t wait to stay again!!

title: Amazing stay!
text: Equinox Hotel Hudson Yards is the best luxury hotel in NYC. From the moment you arrive, you feel pampered. The staff is amazing and anticipates every need before you ask. Access to the Equinox fitness club elevates the experience beyond any hotel anywhere in the world. The hotel provides laundry service for your gym clothes which is the cherry on top. The bed is so comfy, the bath products will leave you wanting to purchase at the end of stay and the blackout motorized roller shades are truly amazing. To top it all off, the room service experience is unlike any other  property I have stayed. The room service menu offers something for all…something light and healthy to something hearty and comforting, they have it all. title: Beautiful Equinox
text: beautifully done rooms. service was top notch. nice location. Guest experience was incredible. anything i needed help with, they did. made sure there was a solution for everything. Nathan Loga, VP guest services was amazing.

title: Most innovative and luxurious hotel in New York and the US
text:
I rarely leave reviews but my experience at Equinox was such a unique and exquisite experience that I feel compelled to qualify it. I have stayed at the One Hotel, The Standard, The William Vale, The Four Seasons and others roundly regarded as the top hotels in NYC. None of these compare to Equinox which provides the most innovative and elevated experience of any of these. The bed is incredible with a mattress I am trying to purchase for my home. 

The rooms combined with the adjoining spa, fitness centers and two pools make this the best facility for a discerning and active traveler. 

If you’re a person of discerning taste this is the hotel for you. All of this comes with a price tags of course but it is well worth it if you take advantage of the amenities, views and facilities.

title: Lindo hotel, pero podría ser mejor
text:
Luego de revisar reviews de varios hoteles en varios sitios de hoteles, elegí hospedarme en Equinox.

Voy a empezar por los puntos a favor. La habitación del hotel es realmente grande, siendo la categoría más baja donde me alojé, y cuenta con una hermosa vista. La ubicación también es perfecta y muy limpia en comparación a otras zonas, si bien no queda muy cerca de Central Park, Nueva York es una ciudad para caminarla entera, de manera que no sería problema. Otro punto a favor son las personas encargadas de la limpieza, una de ellas no recuerdo su nombre, tuve una hermosa conversación el día de mi cumpleaños. Y por último, las instalaciones del hotel como la pileta y el gimnasio son increíbles.

Ahora menciono lo negativo. Días antes de viajar, avise que uno de los motivos por los que me alojaría en este hotel (que no es nada barato) era para celebrar mi cumpleaños, me dijeron que lo iban a tener en cuenta, sin embargo llegado el día no recibí ninguna “sorpresa” y ni un saludo, y me refiero a algo tan simple como una nota al menos. Tuve la suerte de alojarme en otros hoteles, de la misma categoría, donde cada noche al regresar a la habitación me esperaban con una nota y algún snack agradeciéndome por la estadía. Son simples detalles que un hotel, donde una persona quizás se esfuerce mucho para poder alojarse en ese hotel, que al menos el hotel debería tener más contacto y atención para con sus huéspedes y hacerlos sentir algo especial.
Otro punto negativo es la limitada carta de room service, donde para el almuerzo o cena solo contaban con cuatro o cinco platos (turkey sándwich, un salmón, un filete, ensalada cesar , una hamburguesa y pollo). Me he hospedado seis días y tuve que repetir el menú.
Por último, volviendo a la atención, no me sentí muy conforme cuando realice el check out. El día anterior había solicitado si me podían extender el check out gratuitamente y me dijeron que solo podían hasta la 1pm, cuando la mayoría de los hoteles por lo menos, dejan hasta a la 3pm a modo de cortesía, y mi vuelo salía a la 11pm.

En conclusión, es un hotel muy lindo, pero personalmente quisiera sentir al personal del hotel un poco más cercano y pendiente de los huéspedes y extender un poco más el menú de room service, y así ya sería un hotel perfecto a mi parecer.

title: Disappointing - Not What I'd Expect From Equinox/a Hotel in this Class
text:
Let me start off by saying I REALLY wanted to like this hotel. I've been an Equinox member for about 7 years and was excited to finally stay at this hotel.

Had the opportunity to visit in late October, taking advantage of their 3 nights for price of 2 offer. I booked through my credit card which gave me free breakfast for 2, late check out and a $100 credit to use at the hotel. 

Let's start with the good - the rooms/view are great. Small yes, at 400 square feet for the entry level rooms, but the furniture/layout makes it feel larger than it actually is. The views are amazing as well. Bathroom/shower is super nice with Grown Alchemist products. The room also has a yoga mat and various other gym/wellness products (most need to be purchased at an additional cost). 

The Equinox Hudson Yards gym that guests have access to is amazing as well, though busy/crowded most of the day. I do wish they gave hotel guests access after regular business hours. Hotel staff for the most part are very friendly as well. 

Now the not so great - these are issues that I'd expect from a 3-4 star hotel, but definitely not a 5 star hotel that charges around $1000 a night. 

Biggest issue that I had was that 2 days in a row after housekeeping had cleaned my room, both the comforters were SOAKING wet near the top. Not damp, but literally soaked. The first day it happened, I assumed it was an anomaly and it was just a one off. I did let guest services know and someone did come in and apologize, told me he would let his manager know and that it would not happen again. 

Well, next day the same exact thing happened again. This time I asked to speak with the manager who came to my room and examined the comforter and agreed it was soaked and not something that should happen. He apologized and assured me it wouldn't happen again (never did get to see if it happened again as I checked out the next day). The hotel manager did call me as well to apologize and gave me half off of one night, which was a nice gesture, but didn't change my mind from feeling that something like this should not be happening in a 5-star hotel. 

Other minor issues - the first day I ordered in room breakfast, I ordered some coffee. No mug or spoon was sent and I had to use the ones already in my room. 

Another issue - on my checkout day, I was assured a late checkout at 4 PM due to my credit card benefits. The night before I confirmed this in person with the front desk and he told me I was all set to check out at 4PM the following day since they did have late checkouts available. Well, the next day around 2PM I try to get back to my room from the lobby and my key would not work in the elevator (you have to swipe to get the elevator to work and to your room level). I went to the front desk, the concierge looked up my account and told me that they had me scheduled to check out at 2PM and that's why my key was not working. After telling him I had confirmed the night prior that I was set for the 4PM checkout, he did apologize and reactivated my key. 

There were water/coaster stains on the table in my room, and some dried up stains/wear on the couch/sitting area in my room. 

Again, I don't feel things like the above should happen at a hotel of this class. 

Finally, in terms of food - it was solid, nothing special, and way overpriced. Had breakfast not been included in my stay I would not be eating at the hotel. Price for avocado toast, 2 eggs, coffee, and a smoothie was close to $100 after tip+fees. Even for NYC that is crazy expensive pricing. 

Overall, I felt that the hotel was nice but still very rough around the edges and not the quality you'd expect from a hotel in it's class and the price you pay. Unfortunately I do not think I will be back, which is a shame because I do like Equinox as a brand/gym, but don't feel their hotel is up to par. I would likely stick with the Four Seasons if visiting Manhattan again.

title: Great Experience
text: Just a great experience. Overall vibe is a smart balance between energizing and relaxing. Everything is new, gym of course is excellent, and the staff is a pleasure. Limited but delicious menu at restaurant and for room service, with smooth integration of Amex benefits. Agree w/previous reviewer who said the premier room views are worth the splurge.

title: Aswesome Hotel and Great Staff
text: I stay via Amex booking and this was a great hotel, very clean, Staff was awesome and friendly and extremely helpful. Worth the price. Down side they don't offer Military or Government Discounts or Pricing. But, overall great views, rooms are beautiful and clean. Services and Staff friendly and helpful. Restaurant Electric Lemon was awesome and the staff there to was great the Room Top Terrance there was spectacular. Close to alot of stuff. Gym and Spa was great too

title: A hotel with great concept although it feels like something is missing.
text:
I visit NYC almost every year and this time this hotel caught my attention. The hotel is charging rates similar to Four Seasons and the Edition yet it provided smaller rooms whilst maintaining raving reviews, so I was curious. After my three night stay, I understood why.

The level of service is amongst the best in the USA. The staff were super friendly and took care of my deliveries which happened to arrive even before my check-in date. You can see there’s a high level of care in every step of the service from assisting you with the luggage on the ground floor all the way to the breakfast service.

The room whilst it could be argued that it’s a bit on the smaller size for similarly rated hotels, it was ample. I couldn’t think of how extra space could enhance the experience any further. It was simple, yet high quality and high tech. The minibar items were probably one of the most exciting bit of my stay. I’m not going to spoil you why but if you’re into fitness and/or wellness you will be in love. There’s also a drawer with items dedicated for in-room stretching.

Not much needed to be said about the fitness facilities. It’s top-notch. The outdoor lap pool has one of the best view in the city overlooking the Vessel. My only comment with respect to the gym/pool/spa is that it feels relatively disconnected from the rest of the hotel as far as the experience is concerned. The gym here is part of the Equinox club… or to be more specific, the stay at the hotel grants you full access to the Equinox club. 

It could be a little confusing for guests (like me) who had never been a member at an Equinox gym and I felt if there was a step that could get you acquainted with the club in a more organized way it could be a lot more helpful.

The lobby is also a little awkward. It doesn’t make you feel “comfortable” or “welcome” as it feels more like I’ve arrived in an office building. Definitely an area where they can improve for sure.

Location wise, it couldn’t get any better. Within a walking distance you have a Wholefoods market, a Walgreen, Blue Bottle Coffee, and a lot of food stands after hours at night. The Highline is only 2 mins walk away. For those on foot, there’s a metro station next door which directly takes you to the grand central station.

I would definitely come back for my next stay in NYC.

title: New King in NYC
text: So I must confess this from the start, The Edition Hotel has long been my go to hotel in NYC. Equinox may have just ruined that narrative. The hotel basically does all the things I need to have in hotel very well. The shower was great; The room while small was perfectly set-up as well as modern and beautiful; The hotel bar was a very nice place to have a drink; of course the gym ( I am a Equinox member and this location is one of there best gym's ) is amazing and by the way being across from the Hudson Yards Shops does not suck either. All around great property.

title: Best of the bunch, but room for improvement
text:
I had lived in New York for 15 years and now visit often for business so I'm well acquainted with all the 5* hotels in the city and the comings and goings.  I would say that New York luxury hotels are a particularly weak crop compared to the other major world cities.  Not sure if it's just lack of labor, or just old facilities, or lack of tourists, but it is what it is.

The equinox is the newest of the bunch and I definitely value modern fixtures and fresh looks.  The rooms do not disappoint, automatic shades opening up as you first enter the room was a beautiful touch.  The accents in the bathroom and around the bedroom were clearly well decorated as well.

For a new hotel, I must say I was impressed with a handful of the staff who seemed to be seasoned veterans.  Norman and Andy in bell were so nice and on the ball, and helped keep good care of my new car for which I used their great parking service.  I must say the equinox is great if you have your own car since they have their own private drive and garage, an advantage over every other NYC hotel.  Allie was also very sweet at the front desk, and gave me good advice on my cell phone before I arrived on how to best approach the hotel and she was nice upon check out as well.  There was an issue with the AC in the room and an engineer was sent within minutes and fixed the problem also within minutes.

So a lot of positives for sure,  but there is still some room for improvement.  For one, it's great being an equinox hotel that there is a flagship equinox gym at your disposal but I can't help but think they could section off a more private area of the gym for hotel guests only, and if someone needs more machines or whatever, they can go to the public access one.  The public nature of it just doesn't really befit a 5* hotel and hardly allows one to decompress while working out.  

Second, there are a couple green staff around the building still.  I won't mention names but there was a lady with some serious attitude issues upon check out and a younger gentleman who needed rescuing from an older vet when I asked about the best way to get my car out upon checkout.  Also, for the first time in my experience at a hotel over 1k/night, I was recommended to bring my own luggage down from the room even after I asked them to get for me and bring to my car.   

I really debated between 4 and 5* for this review but 4 felt too low, but admittedly a perfect rating also feels too high, and would say it's more like a 4.5.  That said, I will definitely return as there is nothing that can really compare with the whole package that Equinox offers in the city.

Also, must say that the location is top notch, easy to get downtown, but also close enough to midtown and uptown.  And close enough to the west side highway to make a clean get away from the city all together.  Very convenient.

title: An amazing stay at the Equinox Hotel
text: As a longtime Equinox member, I was thrilled to hear that the brand was opening a lifestyle hotel in New York. I had high expectations when booking and was not disappointed upon arrival. The lobby makes you feel as if this is a small, boutique hotel with top-notch service. The separate elevators up to the guest floors gave me peace of mind with those just visiting Electric Lemon. And the room speaks for itself: gorgeous materials and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Thanks for a fantastic stay!

title: Highly Recommended
text:
I stayed at the Equinox hotel the first weekend in August and had a beautiful suite.  The room was super spacious and had all the amenities one could need.  The hotel staff went above and beyond to fulfill every request we had.  We left the hotel that weekend extremely happy with everything.  The food is delicious and healthy.  The hotel grounds are spotless and the views are beautiful.  

I had a little bit of a mishap with a purchase I made at the spa during my spa treatment, which resulted with a few weeks of miscommunication and frustration.  But once Jeff R, the General Manager of the hotel, found out what was going on, he went above and beyond to rectify the situation.  He reached out personally to me to apologize and took care of me immediately.  

Jeff, THANK YOU.  I received my package and you truly did not have to do that.  I appreciate your gesture and your level of customer service has not gone unnoticed.  The next time I return to NYC, I assure you that I will be staying at the Equinox hotel again; not only because of how great my initial stay was, but largely in part to your care and attention to the situation at hand.  I appreciate you.

title: Great hotel for the health minded
text:
We loved our stay - the room was awesome - very modern with a feel of natural resources. We had a river view and it can be quite mesmerizing to watch all the activity on the Hudson.   The evening meditations and morning rituals which are part of the hotel's channel were very well done; the room includes a mat and yoga blocks to use.  I loved the scented bath products, super comfy bed and the overall room design.  We took the leap and used the in room Ipad to sleep in cool mode (66 degrees I think) and I have to say, I did sleep pretty well so now I'll turn down the air at home.

We ate twice at Electric Lemon and also Broken Coconut - the food was excellent.  We utilized the gym and took classes and  got a chance to enjoy some of the outdoor space which can be a rarity at a NY hotel.  We did not use the pool which was busy all day.  All in all, we got the most out of our stay.  Everyone we came in contact with was courteous and wanting to give their best service. 

The location was great - right by Hudson Yards so good for some shopping or just a walk around the space.

title: Sept 2021
text: We loved the hotel and the service was immaculate. The housekeeping personnel were outstanding with great attention to detail and cleanliness. We highly recommend this hotel. Its in a great part of the city without the crowds and Nosie but close enough in.

title: Is this NYC’s Best Hotel?  I don’t think so!
text:
To stay here, you will likely pay an amount that equals or exceeds what it would cost to stay at any 5 star hotel in NYC.  But this was not a 5 star experience.  What it has going for it is that it is trendy. And you get access to a regular (not anything special) Equinox gym. The room itself was pretty small, and a lot of the advertised “amenities” are worthless (e.g., the opportunity to buy expensive crap from the minibar).  

We paid for a package that was to include a complimentary room upgrade.  At check in, they didn’t have any upgrades available.  When I noted we were disappointed not to get an upgrade, rather than offering any sort of other perk or even just acting like he gave a sh**, the person checking us in told us about the fine print that said the upgrade was “subject to availability.”  That pretty much told us everything we needed to know about this hotel - corporate, uncaring, cold.  And that matched our experience staying there.

title: Wonderful stay in NYC!
text:
Recently stayed at the Equinox in Hudson Yards and loved it.
It great for out of town visitors as well as locals on a "staycation" as they have a great pool deck with awesome views and chill music, good drinks really felt like we were on vacation. The rooms have everything one needs plus great views and they are quiet which is a plus in the city that never sleeps. The staff was great to interact with all very hip and nice. We dined at Electric Lemon which was good but we sat inside due to heat outside and had a look at the outside which was lovely and very photogenic. The gym was beautiful and free to hotel guests. The new Hudson Yards area is a nice addition to the city, lots of photo ops and the high line has been extended and you can enter it right there. Also the Shops at Hudson Yards are new which are high end stores and nice eateries -- check out "Little Spain".
Lot's of fun to be had and the the Equinox Hotel is the perfect place to stay in the heart of it all.

title: Unique concept hotel and great location to boot!
text:
Love this hotel.  We have stayed at various places during our NYC visits including Mandarin, Plaza, Four Seasons, but decided to try this out as the appeal of a "fitness & health" inspired hotel plus wanted to be in the Hudson Yard area.  
You do have to take an elevator to 25th floor for checkin and switch to different set to access rooms, but really wasn't a big deal.  Hotel is located right across from Hudson Yards which boasts numerous retailers and dining (both casual and sit down).  The vessel is also right outside.

Electric Lemon, the hotel's restaurant is a central spot for pictures and when we dined there, it seemed to be full of "influencer" types all vying for a picture in front of the massive head structure.  

Staying at this hotel give you access to Equinox gym (which is accessible from the hotel elevator banks).  If you're not familiar with Equinox, it is one of NYC's chicest and largest gyms.  You can also take any of their many fitness classes by reserving a spot thru the concierge, which we did.

We also utilized the spa and took advantage of a last minute cancellation.  Otherwise, spa is only open limited hours so highly recommend making a reservation in advance.  My teen son and I also tried the "cryotherapy" which was cool but for most part, it's probably a gimmick and for the hefty $60+ for 3 minutes inside a freezer, it's a one and done experience for us.

The rooms are very sleek and as we had our teen son with us, we opted for a suite and requested a rollway bed (which is available for $100 per day).  Even with rollaway our suite was more than roomy and still had a separate sitting area with a sectional couch.  

Breakfast is available by room service only (or perhaps this is b/c of covid).  But pretty efficient in that you can use the tablet in room to preorder and set the time of delivery.  The food at this hotel, be it room service or Electric Lemon are all towards a healthy concept.

Metro line is steps away, but location is such that if you don't mind walking its an easy walk to Times Square or Chelsea.  

Tip - if you're looking to check out "the edge" located in hudson yards, if you have a wells fargo account, go to their website for a significant discount for tickets.

title: Great staff
text: We are at the hotel as I write this review. The hotel entrance it not well marked a little confusing to find.  The staff of the hotel entrance and front desk are very friendly and go out of there way to be very pleasant. The room we are staying in is a deluxe vessel view separate bedroom suite.  We are very picky when it comes to rooms especially at $1500 a night. It's nice but doesn't blow us away. Kind of odd  layout. Closets that make no sense . No iron but a steamer which we used a lamp to hold our garments . The room decor actually feels outdated already but it also has modern features in light and shade controls. A lot of equinox products to purchase. The biggest problem is the bed it's very hard and uncomfortable.  Did not get a $1500 a night sleep. Did not use the gym  facility or pool but they look fantastic.  So  my ending comment if your a  Four seasons client you won't feel your at a 5 star hotel as raved about in previous reviews.

title: A bit overrated on Trip Advisor but very good; some pain points here, especially on weekends
text:
I don't think this property rates 5.0 and I think there are a good number of fluff reviews here for this property, especially since there are so many other properties out there that are excellent that get lower TripAdvisor scores. I would rate it Very Good but not Excellent. I stayed here one night in a top level suite overlooking the Shard. 

The suite was nice (certainly liked the cherry-chocolate cupcake on arrival) and decorated well, but there were definitely some things it could have used, such as a bar of soap, a plastic bottle of water to take to the gym or outside, and I woke up with nightmares from the thick duvets they use instead of sheets and blankets.
To use all the space in the bedroom for floor to ceiling windows, there is zero place anywhere in the bedroom to put any of one's belongings out of sight. So the closet is really in the living room. There is a closet opposite the bathroom but there are no shelves there. They could easily fix this by putting some shelves in that closet or to the side of the bedroom TV which is dead space and could use a door and some shelves. Even at the bedside there is no place to put anything in a drawer.

I knew enough to book dinner at the Electric Lemon restaurant but I didn't think I'd need to make a breakfast reservation. At check-in I was told they would try to get me a table. Of course they did but a hotel guest, especially with breakfast included in the Amex FHR rate, doesn't want to know that the restaurant is fully committed for breakfast and will try to get me a table for one person. They need to arrange priority for hotel guests with their restaurant. I also felt the restaurant needed a non-meat protein item for breakfast such as smoked salmon.

The biggest problem here are the elevators. There are only 2 elevators for a hotel with 15 flights and over 200 rooms. Then there are 2 elevators that go from the street level to the lobby level but they pass the gym and spa, and almost always stop on those floors. It's very annoying, especially on the weekends or in the mornings at checkout time when the place becomes a zoo. Any place rated as Excellent would have a better elevator situation.

If you're a hotel guest, you have no priority at the pool to get a lounge. It's crowded there on weekends and I found it very non-relaxing to be there, although it's a great social scene for watching beautiful people if that's your thing. You obviously don't come here to swim in the somewhat smallish outdoor pool (the water was a bit cold too) because it's full of people standing around with their drinks in hand. The indoor pool is fine but you need to know to bring a swim cap or you'll get booted back to the hotel to get one from the concierge. The only quiet place here you can read a book is in your room. Even outside at the pool level on the sides away from the pool you have techno music babbling nonstop. 

The health club is very large but in certain ways small; just one Smith machine for the whole place and no stretching machine. The spa had no wet sauna; a one hour massage came to over $300 with tax and tip. I thought that was pretty darn expensive and the spa itself is nothing except a small waiting room with some water in it (and a dry sauna in the locker room). The saving grace was that you are paying for a top level masseur and mine was worth the extra $100 for the session (Reuven).
Dinner at the restaurant was pretty good; you have to like the mix of hot and cold food and it comes off as spa food. Not really my thing, but what irked me was that both at breakfast and dinner the server didn't know anything about the food. The restaurant doesn't have their wait-staff try anything so they have no idea what food is actually on the plate and how it might taste. That's a really stupid thing for a restaurant to do, and it made it harder for me to figure out what to order and stuff came out that was not what the waiter described. Also they don't offer anything you can eat while you're waiting for your dinner to be prepared. At a fine hotel restaurant, you expect it to be a bit better than that, especially for what they are charging.

You are across the street from the Hudson Yards shopping mall and a convenient subway station but walk one block from here at night and you're in No-Man's Land. 
Maybe as a 55 year old person I'm not the target market here, but I certainly don't think I'd want to come here with wife and kids and I wouldn't come back (and that's something I rarely feel and say about a 5-star level hotel). In sum, the property is upscale and shishi but not particularly good value for money, a zoo on the weekends and a bit overrated. If this is the flagship for the brand and they are building more hotels, they should take this feedback and put it to good use on their next properties.

title: No detail too small for excellence at the Equinox Hotel
text: This hotel stay was amazing. Having traveled extensively and stayed in many fine hotels, this attention to detail here, which includes a healthy lifestyle brand, was phenomenal. They already thought of everything so you don't have to. Exercise equipment in your room or use the amazing gym. The spa treatments are fantastic. I recommend the cryotherapy for a quick feel-good blast. EVERY staff member is there to make your stay better, and succeeds. Devon at the door will get you going the right way no matter where you are going.

title: Amazing stay at Equinox Hotel NYC
text: We had an amazing stay at the Equinox Hotel NYC! The hotel is beautiful and the sleep system is wonderful with the most comfortable beds ever.  Everyone was very friendly and in particular, Aaron at the front desk went above and beyond to get us a wonderful room with a beautiful view and was very helpful with everything we needed.  Anabela, the Chief Concierge was also lovely and so warm and welcoming and Chris at the concierge desk was also great. Both Anabela and Chris were always prompt to respond to our questions and offer recommendations. It was nice to have access to the Equinox gym at Hudson Yards which was very nice and the spa is also wonderful, definitely worth a visit.  Brunch at Electric Lemon was delicious and we would have loved to have dinner on the terrace, which is beautiful, but unfortunately the weather did not cooperate during our visit. Overall, we really liked the hotel and hope to be able to stay there again!

title: Outstanding stay at the Equinox in Hudson Yards.
text: Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted and provided directions to the lobby for check-in. We arrived early so our room was not ready, but our bags were stored and delivered to the room without having to ask. We immediately began exploring Hudson Yards. When we accessed our room we could not have been more pleased with the size, layout, cleanliness, and amenities. The morning room service was outstanding- efficient and delicious. I will be craving the yogurt bowl and matcha tea for awhile. We spent our days exploring the city and did not take advantage of the fitness classes. We will be returning and make the classes, pool, and spa part of our next visit. This is going to be a very successful hotel due to the location, amenities, and service. A special shoutout to all staff working July5-July 8 Thank you for a great get-a-way.

title: Fantastic
text: Beautiful hotel with top service. Yes some things were not fully operational yet but that’s true of many hotels in cities that were hard hit by covid. I did call ahead of my stay and obtained restaurant reservations in the hotel for some of the nights and they were happy to accommodate. I would advise doing that ahead of your stay. It wasn’t optimal that the restaurant was not open for breakfast but I expect that to change as hotels more fully open. The gym is fantastic and you get comp access. Probably the best gym I’ve been to. It made the hotel.

title: Best Pancakes Ever. The gym is nice too.
text: I have nothing but praise for this hotel.   The service was incredible.  The amenities were perfect.  The bed was comfy and the toiletries were nice.  Let me tell you, best pancakes ever, I mean that.  Being able to use the Equinox gym was a treat and so was the pool.  The hotel provides tickets to to the Vessel which is handy.  The area is full of places to eat and drink and you're near the best train line in all of NYC, the 7.  Valet parking is a bit spendy so we parked a few blocks away but if you dont mind $80/night its available. Did I mention the staff is amazing.  If you need anything they've got it for you.  Ask for Aaron.  He'll get you sorted.

title: Stay at Equinox Hotel
text:
I travel a lot for work and pleasure. The 11 days trip to NYC was both business and pleasurer. I must say that one of the best time I ever have had was staying at Equinox Hotel - the best of the best in business. I gave 5 star to this hotel, because you don't let me give 100 stars.

I started communicating with the Concierge desk few days before my arrival. Anabela has been beyond amazing. Right from booking the car to pick me up from the airport to the hotel, making lots of restaurant reservations, was actually surreal prior to the arrival. 
Upon arrival, if I say the 11 nights stay went flawless and exceeded my expectations, it won't be a lie. The room, the room service everything was to its perfection. But more important the face of the Equinox hotel, the guys on the 1st floor welcoming everytime I'd come to the hotel and leave. The front desk lobby on the 25th floor - I mean everyone is very professional, friendly and helpful. Kudos to Nathan Loga and EVERYONE. 
When I say I didn't feel homesick, you know how immaculate everything and everyone was. 
The high speed internet in the rooms was as fast as my google fiber at home. I had to extend my stay at the last minute for a couple of days and the front desk coordinated everything with the reservation desk and got it done, including changing the car reservations to the new departure.
Electric Lemon, the flagship restaurant on the 24th floor, is one of the best in Manhattan. The vibe was real.
The Equinox gym and the pool area is amazing. I didn't get a chance to use the spa, but its on the list for the next time. 
Needless to say, I can't even imagine to stay any place else, other than Equinox hotels (please open in more cities) The perfect blend of the hotel rooms catalyzed by the professional and friendly employees.

title: Equinox Hotel Review
text: Another great experience while staying at the equinox hotel. Everybody was extremely helpful and friendly. Beautiful, modern rooms and an unmatched service. Looking forward to staying here again on my next trip!

title: Luxe for me and loved by my daughter
text: While not specifically known as a kid-friendly destination the Equinox Hotel was the perfect choice for a staycation with my little. Refined and elevated, but with warmth and a heart--the perfect blend. They had the most adorable luxe robe sized exactly for my 5-year old awaiting her--plus milk and cookies of course. "Wow" was her response. It was perfectly comfortable for her while being exactly what I wanted at the same time. The rooms are impeccable and the Grown Alchemist amenities are so perfect. I wish I purchased the lotion before I left. The total blackout room shades even helped my daughter sleep in! Can't wait to go back.

title: Thank You Equinox!
text: I stayed at The Equinox on June 15-18th 2021, from the moment I walked in the door I was impressed, from the hotel workers taking care of my luggage until my room was ready to the people at the front desk helping me with several questions I had about things I wanted to see, I was shown digital maps of the city with instructions on the best ways to get around, I enjoyed free daily tickets to the Vessel and got advice on the best places to watch sunsets, the hotel staff were on there game everyday, from sending ice to my room to cleaning and polishing this amazing hotel, my room was spotless and I mean spotless, the staff at the hotel took a interest in how my day went and looked at some of my photos as well, there kindness was genuine and it made my trip so relaxing, the room was quiet and I slept great, I ate at a cafe steps away from the hotel and enjoyed the entire Hudson Yards area,  so thank you to the great people at The Equinox for such a memorable visit!!

title: Beautifully designed rooms, very accommodating service, river views
text:
A very beautifully designed room, very elegant, tasteful decor, and a lot of nice touches from the contents in the minimal, to the yoga mat and health related items available in the room, with well detailed bathrooms, beautiful views, a menu of healthy food, and cleverly integrated technology.

A great weekend getaway for a New Yorker.

title: Exceptional ambiance & Outstanding Service
text:
Beautiful - Elegant - Sleek - Everything you wish for in a hotel stay! 

Before even setting a foot on the property I had this amazing feeling about Equinox Hotel. I had contacted Anabela Moumdjian (Chef Concierge) prior to arrival to set up a few appointments as well retrieving information about near by spots and amenities. She is everything a hotel guest can wish for when it comes to customer service, knowledge and perfection. 5***** Service and communication.  

I was genuinely excited to finally arrive at the hotel to see the person I had been communicating with! 

My flight arrived late morning, as soon as I landed I emailed to see if my room was ready for an early check in, which it was. Every person working at the hotel was 5***** from valet, reception, concierge, cleaning, gym. Equally the room blew me away - I stayed in a corner suite facing the Hudson River as well as a perfect arial view of the Vessel. 
The rooms are spacious, comfortable and has everything you can think of, with a very stylish touch on every detail. 

Had lunch at the Broken Coconut and a fresh coconut drink on the terrace. Food was delish and service outstanding! 

I will not stay anywhere else in NYC... :) Equinox is simply magical! I can't wait to be back!

title: Not a full service hotel- just rooms over a gym and restaurant
text:
Ah Equinox, you disappoint on so many levels. Your website brags of a terrace and multiple pools, but the terrace was closed during my stay, either due to weather, or being fully booked by outside patrons. I never got to see it, let alone experience its charms.

Dinner at the hotel? No ma'am. The restaurant was fully booked. Would you like to go out in the rainstorm and walk in the dark plaza looking for an alternate? No, I would not. How about room service, I ask. After all, it's 7 PM- dinnertime. "Oh no, our room service only operates from 7 AM to 3 PM, but you can get takeout from our restaurant."  Are they serious? I have to go down to the restaurant, order from their super expensive menu and then take it up to my room to eat out of a bag at this five star hotel? No thank you!  Ok, can I at least get a bite at the bar in the restaurant? "No, the bar is fully booked tonight, but if you go down and ask, they might be able to squeeze you in."

Breakfast at the hotel? No, ma'am we do not serve breakfast or lunch, but you can order room service. OK. A bowl of oatmeal plus gratuity and a $10 delivery fee comes to a little over $30. Which I would pay to eat in a nice hotel restaurant for breakfast, but it offends me beyond belief to stay in a five star hotel that does not offer the option of breakfast at a table instead of in my room looking at an unmade bed.

Speaking of the room, it's more a showcase and store than a luxury accommodation. The cabinets are filled with overpriced offerings of equinox-branded merchandise. It's shamelessly promotional. There's almost no drawer space because the cabinetry is filled with merchandise.  The iPad in the room offers yet more shopping options. And for a deluxe room, I would have expected two sinks, better water pressure, and hot water. It was barely tepid.

Upon checking in, I was informed that housekeeping would not be making regular visits and that I would have to request replenishment of towels. What's this- a luxury  hotel with no daily housekeeping? Need I make the bed and beg for fresh towels? I'd believe this policy might be Covid-related, but a good percentage of the hotel staff do not wear masks. I was told masks are optional for those vaccinated. So be prepared to make many rides in elevators with unmasked people. That aside, the lack of housekeeping is ridiculous.

The hotel is reached via elevator that leaves from a  small entry room on the main floor behind black glass.  When I arrived at this entrance with luggage in the rain, no bellman greeted me until I had already carried my bags in.  Then after arriving at the 25th floor, I  waited  in line to check in.  But don't look for a word of welcome or a place to sit. There is no lobby to speak of.  The reception area is  a narrow mezzanine that overlooks the elusive, fully booked restaurant below. You can smell the food and hear music and people laughing and having a good time, but guests at the hotel aren't welcome. It's offensive.

One last note about my stay. Upon returning from a meeting around 9:30 PM, I was eager to catch a late bite before retiring. The person at the reception tells me that the restaurant is closed, and there is nothing in the neighborhood open.  Zero. This is the Big Apple on a Thursday night.  She suggested I call Grub Hub.

So, for the hotel to claim it is five star and not offer a restaurant where you can eat breakfast, lunch or dinner, where there is no bar for guests, no terrace as advertised, no outdoor pool as shown on the website, no lobby for lounging or meeting others, where you need to take two elevators to get to your room which is not regularly serviced by housekeeping-- it's a complete sham. This is a health club and trendy restaurant in a cavernous, dark neighborhood that attracts gawking tourists by day and Ubers and limos of plan-ahead diners at night. And they have rooms for rent above it all  for suckers who pay for the brand and are treated like an afterthought.

PS. Overnight parking cost $80

title: Beautiful property, rooms and public spaces - but beware the pool access policies
text:
Amazing and unique new hotel, spa, gym and dining at the amazing Hudson Yards!

Summer weekends are a bit crazy and you need to hit the 5th floor early to get a pool reservation or you are stuck trying to find a place to park and the “scene” was less than friendly!

title: clean, modern, upscale
text: The room was beautiful, the service by all staff members was excellent, and the location was great. The proximity to the shopping mall and the on-site equinox flagship gym made the hotel even better. I would highly recommended this hotel to anyone looking for an exceptionally clean, quiet, upscale hotel in NYC.

title: Girls Weekend at Hudson Yards
text:
Basically all we wanted to do was sleep and watch tv and go to the spa and that’s exactly what we did. The rooms are gorgeous, high tech and designed for a good night sleep. We ate a lot and slept a lot and had an amazing spa experience. Highly recommend getting a massage and trying cryotherapy wow. Aliana is the best and was so helpful in making sure we got two separate beds ahead of time and knew us by name when we saw her in the hotel! 

The only thing I would add was that due to Covid there’s really nowhere to eat in the hotel if you don’t have reservations really far in advance so we had to take our meals on our bedroom floor. Not a big deal. Definitely will be returning!

title: Fitness + Style + Ritz Service  = Equinox
text: The space was beautiful, the staff was over the top helpful. All the facilities were clean and awe inspiring.  The food cost was a little on the high side but to be expected.  This is a place that I would revisit.

title: First Stay
text: Beautiful hotel. Excellent service. The room was very well designed and the food and wine list at Electric Lemon were very good. I would recommend the Equinox Hotel highly and plan to make it a regular stop when I visit NYC.

title: Best city staycation
text: Gorgeous hotel!  Has everything you need/ want!  From the moment we pullled to the valet we were greeting by a friendly professional staff!  Cool black & white uniforms too!  Be sure to pre book the club’s fitness classes with the concierge as they all sell out fast!

title: First Class Stay
text: The facilities at the hotel are first class for those who like to compliment their business trip to New York with some health and wellbeing on the side. And the healthy food was a highlight. One of the best places to stay in NY.

title: RRBFSC
text: First stay at this amazing hotel.  Great location.  Superior service.  Every aspect of the stay was wonderful.  Had an amazing suite with a view of the Hudson River.  I would highly recommend this hotel but realize that it is somewhat expensive.

title: Great Stay!
text: Tremendous service despite the pandemic restrictions. The front door/bell staff was really top drawer. Well thought out room design.  Easy access to the subway and 10th Ave and Chelsea restaurants.  Across the plaza from shopping, but still not much traffic there.  Should be more vibrant as the pandemic restrictions come off.

title: A New Level
text: If you’re already an Equinox member you’re probably able to envision what the hotel version of the brand might be. Take that, and X it by 1000, because the hotel experience is legit more than you could imagine. I hesitate to even talk about it I want it all to myself. Thoughtful abundant amenities everywhere, EQ thinking down to the last detail; comforter. Lighting control, in room bento box meal. You’ll pay for it, and dare I say it’s worth it. It’s not a hotel, it’s life.

title: A calm oasis
text: Relaxing and comfortable space to retreat in NYC! Close to a lot of shopping and easy to get to different sights in the city. I highly recommend the spa and pool! Great service overall. The restaurant is delicious to with a lot of healthy and nutricious options!

title: Best Anniversary Weekend at Equinox Hotel Hudson Yards
text:
My partner and I had the most amazing weekend away to celebrate our anniversary. It was over the middle of the pandemic and we felt so safe and looked after. 

The food at electric lemon was delicious, night swimming in the pool overlooking the vessel was stunning and hitting the gym in the morning was the perfect end to the weekend.

Thank you so much for spoiling us!

title: Excellent service, stylish and comfortable interior.
text:
We just returned from an amazing four night stay in a two bedroom suite. The staff was friendly, professional, and helpful. Adam the concierge was able to arrange dinner reservations and floral delivery prior to our arrival. 
The rooms and common areas are beautiful and comfortable. We hope to return when the weather is better so we can enjoy the outdoor pool and terrace.
Thanks for a great trip Equinox Hotel!

title: Fittest and finest hotel on earth
text:
Amazing hotel and amazing experience… the room is beyond and the food was amazing.. try the electric room lounge and roof top can’t be missed. 
The gym is one of the best and you have to experience it and then you will judge..
One of the best staycation I have ever experienced

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: Hi Tech, immaculate, comfortable rooms.  The service was impeccable.  The hotel staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Amazing gym and amenities!  Love this location and will be back, very soon!

title: Best hotel I ever stayed in so far
text: I love everything about this hotel. I will definitely be staying here again. Employees were amazing very polite. Food was amazing, property loooks exquisite and clean and food was delicious. My friends and I definitely enjoy staying here.

title: Hudson Yards Escape
text:
My boyfriend and I love going here for weekend staycations.  The hotel is fantastic.  The facilities are spotless and the rooms are beautifully furnished. 

All of the staff are so helpful.  Anything you want or need, you just ask and it appears. 

A special shout out to Andy,  who works at arrivals and helped us with our luggage and  bags and escorted us to our rooms.   He was so friendly and so helpful.  

We used the spa one day and also spent some time using the beautiful indoor pool.

We get very sad when it’s our day to check out.  So we keep coming back!!

title: Birthday weekend
text:
Outstanding>beautiful. the views of the New York City amazing
Definitely would recommend to others> thoroughly enjoy the spa treatment,
 Only concern why do one have to paid for the Beverage in the room.  Then one should be allowed to bring their own if you have to paid for the beverages in the room. Otherwise a beautiful facility.

title: Excellent Business Stay
text: Wonderful property! Rooms were immaculate.  Clean rooms and great amenities.  the gym is world class and the staff is attentive to all details.  Highly recommended to anyone who has the opportunity t visit New York.

title: Enjoyable but I would have liked more amenities
text:
Overnight stay was enjoyable. We had dinner across the street at milos. Room was nice and new. Great wellness stuff for sale in each room and meditations for AM and PM right on TV. They also offer free loaner workout gear. 

For a hotel with emphasis on sleep I didn’t sleep great while there. There was under the bed night nights that kept going on at night being tripped by some sensor (maybe the blankets). Also another light randomly opened in the middle of the night. 

Covid dampened part of the stay in that The spa was closed when we were there and there was no offering of breakfast aside from in room dining because the hotel restaurant only serves dinner. Equinox gym use is permitted during the stay but their group class offering was very limited. The hotel also told me they no longer have a partnership with soul cycle to book a bike also.

title: 5 STAR HOTEL - ABOVE AND BEYOND
text: Our stay at the Equinox Hotel surpassed all of our expectations. My boyfriend and I travel usually every month or so and we usually stay at Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton hotels due to their superior service and modern touch. Equinox hotel in NYC is a top tier five star hotel with impeccable service and a very kind staff. We had the best time in NYC and we owe it to the service we received from Nate and his team at Equinox. They went above and beyond for us to feel welcomed and took care of our every request. From helping with dinner reservations, to spa reservations (the spa is AMAZING), and city recommendations, we could not have asked for better service. Nate, the manager,  even surprised me at my boyfriend's request to upgrade our room and fill it with the freshest bouquets of roses in you could find in the city. The hotel is immaculately stunning! It is very modern, and very clean. We only wish there were more Equinox Hotels so we can visit every one in the country! If you are looking for the perfect stay with the best service, don't stay anywhere else.

title: Service Value to Rate
text: Bell Services were poor - MUR Room is not 24hrs. Either get your room made before 5p or you stuck with a dirty room. Room serves as if delivery from a pizza restaurant - a $1,000 room only has one shower stall and no bath tub, towels are limited, staff kept coming to the room to request plates as if there were not enough enough in the kitchen to go round

title: Excellent Service!
text: We just returned from a quick trip to NYC.  The Equinox Hotel made it delightful!  NYC is "barely" open and we understand that many establishments have to run limited staffing at this time for many reasons.  The Equinox Hotel did NOT disappoint.  We were a party of 12 ppl (with a total of 5 rooms) and they handled our reservations, arrivals, reservations, etc seamlessly.  100% recommend them.  If you have a chance, you MUST introduce yourself to ANABELA MOUMDJIAN the Chef Concierge!  She went above and beyond to accommodate our group.  Thank you Equinox Team!

title: Equinox Hotel
text: By far the best experience I had in this hotel. Staff was super friendly and helped me with anything. I will sure be back to this hotel. I will also recommend this hotel to my peers. Thank you for the amazing experience

title: Fantastic Hotel & Staff
text:
We recently came up and stayed for a week of business and relaxation. The staff was amazing!!!! My husband had requested champagne and flowers be set up in the room before we arrived and not only was the arrangement beautiful but the view was magical!!! We stayed in room 3616 so we had a corner suite facing the river and enjoyed it the full week! 
Anabela was so helpful at the concierge she went above and beyond to get us a table at The Edge and setting us up with reservations for a business meeting at the hotel. Ryan at Electric Lemon was beyond helpful with getting us in for Easter Brunch! The food was amazing! 
Our room was beyond amazing!!! We slept so good and enjoyed the treats of the menu bar- all three (food/drinks, fitness & wellness) Also the room had a in room water machine- so we have so much fresh cool water!!! Def cut back on our trips to Duane Reade!!!
The spacious closets and living area made the week easy to leave work in one area and escape to relaxing for the rest of the day. The ease of having the fitness center, SoulCycle and Hudson Yards all in a short pace was so nice! 
We can’t wait to go back. 
The room service was amazing!!! We both tried new items on the health menu and enjoyed the comfort of some of the classics.

title: Second Stay in Less Than A Month
text: Another great stay at The Equinox.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  They all know your name when they greet you and are always asking how they can help.  The rooms are fabulous.  The Electric Lemon is a great spot for drinks and snacks.  Did not use the gym, but walked through and it too is fantastic.

title: Well oiled friendly machine.
text: First time stay - loved the property and location on the river. Pandemic protocols were great and not over-bearing. Touch-free room service awesome. The far west side is a little disorienting at first yet N/S position is ideal. Great relaxing, noise free stay.

title: For the price, should be better and communicate what's available
text:
Beautiful hotel rooms and gym, but was frustrated by the communication between the fitness center and the front desk.  We were there for a business trip and called the front desk after settling into our room to inquire about group classes and spa services available the next day and were told group classes and spa services weren't occurring because of COVID (understandable); however, upon going to the gym the next morning, it turns out group classes were happening.... This was such a shame because we had been up since 6 AM and we would have gone to yoga or spin but by that time we went, only one class was left that we had time to go to.  Rooftop pool was also closed although their indoor lap pool was open.  For a hotel that's priced at $650/700/night and is marketed for fitness, it would have been nice to know what services were actually available.  The fitness services miscommunication was frustrating.  We also had a somewhat funny encounter with the front desk asking where the nearest Starbucks was and no one seemed to know (not a big deal).

Otherwise, seamless check-in, beautiful facilities, fast response when calling the front desk, and friendly staff.  Hudson Yards was beautiful.  Would also recommend going to the Edge while in the area.

title: Exceeded my expectations!
text:
Amazing hotel, super clean and the service is over the top. I will definitely be coming back soon! Wow. 
Highly recommend this stunning hotel to visit in New York City !! 
The staff is super friendly , the food is delicious... and everything is just perfect.

title: EQX Member Stay
text: This was an incredible experience. It starts with the doormen (who could not be more accommodating or welcoming) opening the doors for you with your luggage. They are amazing resources for hotel processes and go out of their way to provide you with anything you may need. Then there is the front desk staff, who are great. We came here for a birthday, and the front desk reached out to me separately to coordinate a surprise for my girlfriend! The room is even more beautiful than I could imagine, with perfect lighting and shade control through the panel. The iPad in the room makes ordering anything from food to laundry service seamless. As an EQX member, I received free gym clothes laundering, which allowed me to pack lighter for the trip! It’s also delivered within 2 hours of pickup, which is unheard of at a normal stay with laundry. The gym is big and had plenty of equipment. Exactly the layout you would expect from an Equinox, and it wasn’t busy either weekend morning. My only complaint is I did not enjoy the pot of coffee, but that is more the fault of La Colombe roast than EQX hotel’s. Lastly, the location is perfection. Hudson Yards is a blast, and it has an easy in/out area for ubers/cabs to drop off/pick up. Strongly recommend. This place was worth every penny.

title: A memorable stay
text:
I recently stayed at the equinox at Hudson Yards with my two children. From the moment we pulled up to the hotel until the moment that we left we were treated with the upmost respect and consideration. The staff provided discrete support for me and my family. They inquired to our needs listened and responded swiftly and efficiently.

Of particular notability was a young man by the name of Eric. He was extremely attentive to our needs and seemed to really have a strong affinity for his work. He was alert conscientious and responsive. He was careful with our belongings and respectful with our space and our time. He was prompt and efficient. He demonstrated all of the features of our room with knowledge and ease. Eric seemed to know exactly what we would be interested in and sparked an interest and excitement  in my kids.  Eric‘s care for me and my family continued throughout our stay. He was helpful with his knowledge of the area and always seemed to be one step ahead of us. It was my son‘s birthday and he certainly felt special; a big part of that was due to Eric and the rest of the amazing equinox hotel staff.

title: love this property
text: From the very moment you walk into the property you already know this is going to be a hotel stay unlike any other. The room technology is out of this world. The bathroom...TO DIE FOR. The bed makes you feel like you’re floating on a cloud. My girlfriend and I were blown away. It was the PERFECT place to celebrate her birthday

title: Above & Beyond!
text: Just returned from three nights in a gorgeous junior suite. The facilities are top-notch. Even better is the staff, all of whom went above and beyond. I had a very serious issue with my car and the wonderful general manager (Ginny) found an incredible solution. I'm so thankful! This is now my go-to hotel in NYC!

title: Perfect staycation
text: Beautiful property, beautifully adorned rooms, excellent hospitality. If only the outdoor pool, which has views of the Vessel,was open for the season! But alas, this only prompts me to want to return in the future to better enjoy Electric Lemon's Terrace and the outdoor deck pool.  Super clean, thoughtful touches. They gave a slice of cake for us  upon checking in because of our birthday.  Linens are comfortable, nespresso available. Slept very well. Loved being able able use the gym and indoor pool. Convenient to have the shops nearby and Electric lemon right above!

title: Relaxing Staycation
text: I’ve been to many properties across hotel brands but this was the most relaxing. They put a lot of care into making your room a sanctuary and the body cleansers and conditioners offered aromatherapy. It makes the entire room smell like a spa when used. Also, the service was exceptional. Will definitely return!

title: Momcation
text: The service, cleanliness, and location was fabulous. My best friend and I booked the Momcation package, which was excellent. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. I will definitely return when the weather is nicer and I am able to utilize the the terrace.

title: Home away from home
text:
Efficient + relaxed valet! 
Devon and Eric are so friendly always welcoming with the warmest of smiles. 
Jinny,  Nathan + all of front desk/guest team are incredibly accommodating (even if you forget to make your reservation. Oops) A pleasure to see them + always ensure I feel welcomed and at home. 
Each room is uniquely different yet all have the same warm, cozy, spacious and understated luxe vibe you could want. 
Room service is SO quick (no phone call necessary, all done on tablet) the spelt bread at breakfast is bomb! 
Mini bar is superior to most and nespresso machine is so appreciated. 
Spa lounge has a gorgeous view of the river (amazing at sunset) 
Everyone in the hotel (seriously, everyone) are so friendly it’s refreshing. A true respite from the city. 
I’ve never received a bucket of ice quicker. Every time. It’s almost instant. HOW?!
Also... the best lighting. We all look gorgeous at Equinox. 
Every time I’m in house (almost weekly) it is a real pleasure. Thank you for always taking incredible care of me (and my sensibilities) xxx

title: Perfect escape
text: the rooms views are insane! the silence of the room is definitely one to be envied! The room service is top quality as are all the facilities within the gym themselves! absolutely have to hit up the spa for the massages as they were a perfect way to wrap up a long week!

title: Weekend Escape in the city
text: Loved the stay and hotel staff was wonderful. The room was awesome and loved the location and views. I would love to stay again in the near future. If you like to stay near everything and are visiting the city this should be on your list

title: Exceptional Experience
text: An amazing experience to say the least. Husband and I had a weekend "staycation" here and my expectations were exceeded beyond my imagination. Clean, modern, 5 Star guest experience. A perfect place to stay if you are looking to hit the "reset" button. Will definitely be coming back!!!

title: 1000% recommended
text: I brought my boyfriend to Equinox hotel for his birthday and we absolutely LOVED it . The staff was very very accommodating from the jump. They ensured that our stay was beyond what we expected as well as comfortable. I never leave reviews, but this is a must do. Definitely stay here !

title: Equinox superb, beat expectations by a mile
text: Not cheap but well worth it.  Location, view, staff all excellent.  Exceptionally clean, felt very safe with Covid protections. Minor quibbles with (very) low couch/table and coffeemaker wouldn't stop me from coming back

title: Trendsetter hotel, sexy rooftop dining in a bomb location
text: What can I say but that you're transported into a world of money, bright lights and glitz the minute you roll up to the hotel - prepare to be shocked and awed esp if this is your first visit to the Hudson Yards. I am a new yorker and admitting you like HY may be just a tiny bit worse than liking Times Sq...so this was an eye roll choice for me initially for a valentines day/anniversary staycation at first, but one that ultimately left me wanting more. I am already not-so-secretly looking at off peak dates to go back :D In terms of our room, for a 5 star I was expecting flawlessness so my two complaints: drink glass stains all over the cafe table in the room, we called to complain and nothing was done about it.
