title: amazing staff
text:
A place is only as good as it's staff. From the gentlemen who opens the door upon arrival to the desk staff were some of the nicest people I have encountered from any hotel from the Caribbean to NYC.
The food and shopping just outside the hotel at Hudson yards is amazing.

title: Great staff at the Equinox Hudson Yards
text: Love this hotel! We have been there twice in the last two months.  Everyone that works there is so friendly and helpful especially Andy Delacruz. He seems to be everywhere doing everything with his big smile and great personality! We will be back again soon.

title: New Favorite Hotel
text:
I recently stayed at the Equinox Hotel for a staycation in the city with my girlfriend and our experience was incredible! While the room, the amenities, and the food was beautiful, crisp, clean, and best in class, the staff is truly the reason for our amazing stay at the hotel. Alex, Sheena, Charlie and the entire staff were all so friendly, cheerful, and work so hard to ensure that each guest feels appreciated and pampered. 

Our experience would not have been possible without the help of Gregory, the front office manager. When my girlfriend and I were unable to make our reservation, Gregory went above and beyond in order to accommodate us and made us feel like first class guests. I was overly impressed with his professionalism, and he is the reason I will be telling all family, friends, and coworkers they need to book a stay at the Equinox Hotel when they visit New York next or when they are looking for a weekend staycation. I cannot picture myself staying anywhere else in New York other than the Equinox Hotel. And I am extremely excited to see how Gregory will continue to make the Equinox Hotel brand the best luxury hospitality experience for those who truly want it all.

title: The BEST hotel in New York City for sure
text: The Equinox hotel delivers a six star service in a luxurious environment - the hotel and fitness space is fantastic so much so you don’t want to leave the hotel! The staff are absolutely amazing - with a big shout out to Andy (a baby version of Chris Brown or Ludicrous ) and all of the Concierge and Front Desk staff, who remembered us by name and always very happy to help. The rooms were immaculate clean and we honestly had the best sleep in this hotel compared to the other hotels we have stayed in over the years. This is a real five star hotel - for sure we are coming back in the summer!

title: Spectacular
text:
My husband and I were to stay in New  York to see some friends that were coming in from L.A.. Being that we are only in Connecticut, and members of the Equinox gym here, we thought we would give this new hotel a shot. 

We went in on December 6th and stayed through the 9th. We arrived at the hotel around 3:30 to be told that our room was not ready yet, and if we wanted to go to the bar, they would buy us dinner and drinks. My husband was not happy. We asked to speak to a manager.

 Gregory Gottlieb is the front desk manager. Gregory was amazing! He had us in a upgraded ( no charge) room within 6 minutes. He was kind and friendly and most of all sincere about wanting to make our stay perfect.

The hotel is amazing, the food is wonderful, the bar is cool and the gym is superb.
We will make this our new hotel whenever we want to stay in town for sure.
Everyone from the front doormen to the cleaning staff was friendly and helpful. 

I give The Equinox Hotel and Gregory a huge thumbs up!!
We look forward to seeing you real soon!

title: New Favorite Hotel
text: Amazing hotel. I booked a Premier King River View and upgraded to a Junior Suite on arrival for an extra nightly fee. Could not have been happier with the room. It was large for a NYC room, perfect bed, great couch. Excellent view of the Vessel and the river. Staff was great, super friendly. Restaurant was quite good. Gym was perfect.

title: Everything I need and more!
text: Writing this review after staying here on two different occasions. The entire staff was lovely from the beginning to the end of my stay. The rooms are beautiful and so efficient! Had a great workout at the gym and treated myself to a cryo session (highly recommend). Great options for room service, quick too. Will have to try the hotel restaurant (Electric Lemon) next time. Looking forward to my next stay!

title: Spectacular Hotel Experience in New York City
text: Excellent service and attention to detail.  Rooms are sleek and stylish.  Comfortable bed and bath linens.  Access to world class gym and spa.  Can't beat the views!  Friendly staff. Great people watching in lounges and lobby!  Good for meeting for afterwork drinks.

title: New Year-New Hotel
text: First time we spent anytime at the Hudson Yards and to be next to the Vessel, the High-line and all the new developments overlooking the Hudson River was a great experience. The hotel is new and offers all the amenities and comfort we had expected. We had a King Bed room overlooking the Hudson River which was spectacular. Great bathroom (would prefer two sinks) but the shower was the best and the room while on the smaller side offered all the comfort and amenities we expected including a very comfortable bed. Spa and health club were top of the line and what we expected Equinox would want to showcase in their NYYC hotel.

title: The best hotel in New York
text: This was my first time staying at the Equinox Hotel and I plan on coming back for many more visits. I was with friends that had never been to the city and they were extremely impressed as well from the front desk and hotel staff for their diligent work ethics and eagerness to help customers. I was so sad to leave, but am excited for my next visit in the near future. Also shoutout to the front office manger that assisted me with my bags while the bellman was busy with another guest. I forget his name, but he was great!

title: Equinox Hotel, a gen in NEW Hudson Yards
text:
We LOVE Equinox Hotel! We only ever stay uptown in the city because that’s where our friends live and that’s where most of our work is. We will gladly make the somewhat inconvenient commute from this hotel moving forward.

I’ve never seen a more polished hotel staff nor a more beautiful hotel space.

The room has a yoga mat that you can pair with a custom app on the Apple TV called “Ritual”. It lead me through a meditation each morning of my stay. What a way to wake up in bustling NYC.

The club, of course, was not to be believed. The sheer size of it is the best part - it never felt crowded, despite many locals enjoying this space as their everyday workout facility.

Can’t wait for our return in a few months.

title: First visit to New York!
text:
First visit to New York!

Someone told us not to stay in the Hudson Yards neighborhood for our first visit to NYC (no culture, just tall buildings and construction) but that was bad advice. Of course, you might find more culture/history/charm near The Park or Flatiron. But coming home to the comfort and serenity of this sanctuary after long days of walking through those other neighborhoods was what made the trip.

We know about Equinox from our friends who are club members in LA and they begged us to come check it out. We are so glad they did.

There were other good, more affordable options in New York. But the Equinox Hotel could not have been a better addition to our trip.

Recs: E-Massage after walking NY all day, Cryotherapy in the spa, open up your laptop in the 25th floor seating area for a beautiful view while you get some work done, and of course, the indoor saltwater lap pool.

Lastly, THE STAFF!! Friendly and accommodating. They were so helpful in helping us navigate the city - ask Adrian to point out the High Line Park and subway stops on the beautiful digital map behind the Concierge Desk.

Thanks for making our first visit to the city so memorable!

title: Weekend getaway
text: Great location. Next to subway and shopping and not far of a walk to everything NY has to offer. The hotel was luxurious, staff were friendly and bed was soooo comfortable I felt like I was sleeping on clouds.  I would definitely stay here again. View from 34th floor was amazing overlooking the Hudson

title: Absolutely Stunning
text:
I've been living in Brooklyn my whole life, and staying in NYC hotels whenever i can. So I've seen them all at this point. There is something special about this Equinox hotel. First off, is location cannot be understated. Its located in the brand new and beautiful Hudson Yards. When you exit any other hotel in NYC, you're greeted by a rush of taxis and pedestrians bumping into you. When you step outside the Equinox hotel into Hudson Yards, you can stand in the open spaces the have designed. Take in the views, go for a stroll, go shopping, get something to eat, all without crossing a street. this type of space is so rare for NYC, and appreciated by a New Yorker.
the Staff are all friendly, always with a warm welcome, looking to see what more they can do for you.
the rooms are outstanding. truly beautiful modern design.  the word I'm looking for is thoughtful. each little touch in the room has been designed by someone that stays in hotel, not just a fancy architect. When your toes hit the floor in the middle of the night, a very dim light goes on, guiding you to safety, or the bathroom. This is just one of the many beautiful details that have been thought of for you. Plus, a personalized note was left in my room, which i really appreciated.
The restaurant and bar are gorgeous and have stunning views of the city and Hudson Yards.
I can't wait to go back!

title: Christmas Weekend
text: Unbelievable hotel down to every last detail. Decor is unmatched!! Electric Lemon restaurant was fabulous. The outdoor pool and Sauna Barrels were quite an experience. Hotel staff were so accommodating, especially Andy the front valet. Can’t wait to return!!

title: Equinox sets the bar
text: I’ve stayed everywhere in nyc and Equinox is fantastic.  Staff is super helpful and friendly, rooms are state of the art.  Best minibar I’ve seen with healthy snacks and supplements. This was our second stay and we will back for sure.

title: Spa Day
text: Amazing day at the Equinox Spa.  From the Wave Table, to the Cryogenic Chamber, to the Power Down IV, this was by far the most incredible spa experience of my life.  Staff and facilities were all first class, and I will definitely be back!

title: Hudson Yards
text: The New Hudson Yards hotel made by Equinox is just beautiful. Love the room and definitely love the idea of fresh/filtered water coming out of the wall. The IPAD in the room was a bit bland but makes sense with what its showing.

title: Luxury at Equinox
text: Service and stay was top quality.  The staff were extremely welcoming, the room and amenities were superb.  The room had everything you could have wanted, very modern and tech savoy.  Love the location, new heart beat of New York.

title: Fab and fit experience
text: Beautiful new property with a fitness vibe. The most professional and friendly service we have experienced in years...we travel a lot! Best room too...you will sleep to your hearts content! The location is up and coming so you will have to Uber around for shows, better shopping and other neighborhood restaurants, which are part of the NY experience!

title: A nice memory from New York
text:
Excellent location, great service, friendly staff, clean and beautiful room !
The Shops across the street are a big plus to the hotel, made our Christmas shopping easy.
Restaurants' selection would satisfy various tastes.

title: Must stay HOTEL
text: I have traveled all around the world and have stayed at many 5 and 6 star hotels. This hotel is better than all of them combined. They are so accommodating and pleasant. If you needed anything like a restaurant reservation or a place to visit they help me. Also for shopping they help me.

title: WILLIS REVIEW
text: House keeping, luggage and greeting assistance, and amenities to the hotel were amazing. Food menu also phenomenal and the rooms themselves perfect complete with their functionality. I had cloths pressed with the housekeeping and they were quick. The concierge was also great. I was there for the Centurion event and unquestionably will be a regular guests now.

title: Equinox Hudson Yards!
text: The hotel was gorgeous and i loved the decor.  Service was excellent and the help was professional and very friendly including the General Manager.  The food was good.  They even had really crispy bacon which you never see on a buffet.

title: Expensive but worthwhile
text: Comfortable, high quality hotel at Hudson Yards. Rooms have good size and impressive amenities. Free access to the Equinox Club at the hotel, nice unobstructed views from the room, close to a subway station, right accross a shopping mall with great quality cafes and restaurants. The farthest possible place in Manhattan from JFK, it will take a while to get there from the airport by taxi, but a good option if you want to stay at a less common neighborhood.

title: Centurion Event
text: The accommodating staff could not have been better prepared or friendly with the rapidly arriving large group for the event we attended. The service was over the top! We did not wait or want for anything. The greeting at the door by name was a unique touch. Even the valet was quick and easy!

title: Best Manhattan Stay!
text: If you are looking for something out of the norm, a refreshing, modern stay then search no more! The focus on health, the quality of everything used, from shampoo to bed linens and service l, all is top notch!

title: Todo espectacular.
text: Leyendo los reviews de este hotel en trip advisor no sabíamos muy bien que esperar aunque nos llamaba mucho la atención el hotel, y por suerte lo probamos. Todo fue espectacular ! La habitación es minimalista pero muy bien decorada, los productos de tocador son de excelente calidad, el gimnasio es increíble, la atención de todo el personal muy buena, la ubicación del hotel es increíble. No es un hotel barato, pero definitivamente vale la pena!

title: Will be great at some point. Now just ok...
text:
I was excited to try this new hotel (opened in July ‘19)- brand new, fun location, lots of hype about their investment in optimizing sleep quality, great workout facilities. 

Here’s the good: Hudson Yards is a fun location.  The rooms are large, new and have great views (the large and new parts particularly hard to come by in NYC). Health club was great- fantastic views, a sea of equipment and a large and varied class schedule free to hotel guests. 

The not so great: service is well intentioned and there are always people around who want to help but they don’t have the kinks out.  A couple of examples: Check in is at 3 but we couldn’t get in room til 530 (and only then because we had an early dinner pre show so needed a room). Many people in same predicament.  We were offered a $100 credit for the inconvenience which was nice but the credit wasn’t on our bill at checkout.  There are no water bottles or even cups in health club which I support environmentally but I don’t travel with my Swell.  I was told to go back to my room and get a glass bottle but unfortunately the way hotel is set up that’s two elevator rides away. 

I also didn’t notice any difference in the mattresses, pillows, rooms that are supposed to enhance sleeping. 

Small things but they added up to create an “ok not great” impression, especially when you’re paying $1000 a night with tax at peak Christmas season rates.  

At those prices, “just ok is not ok!”

title: My new favorite hotel in NYC.
text: Looking for a hotel with an incredible staff, excellent rooms for sleeping, great views, and an awesome gym?  This is the place.  The Juice Press on the ground floor is another bonus.  Thank you Robbie, Sheena, and Alex.  I will return.

title: Amazing stay at Equinox hotel
text: Amazing service, room, and gym.  The bed was so comfortable and the bath/shower was incredible. I loved all of the products (shampoos, lotion) and the closet was well appointed with robes, slippers, steamer.  Really felt like a 5 star experience

title: Beautiful hotel with great quality stay
text: Great place to stay with emphasis on health and wellness. The perfect way to travel while on business. Readily available and attentive staff make a huge difference. Usage of the gym was optimal and the expedited “gym clothes” laundry is an excellent touch

title: Disappointment
text: Has many kinks yet to be figured out, particularly the A/C and water systems.  The air was on and off all night and kept me up for a terrible night's sleep.  The bed does not have a proper flat sheet (ask for one, they will deliver).  I really wanted to like this place but can not recommend at this point.  Will try again in six months.

title: Thanksgiving trip
text: Everything was five stars except for two things.  First, there is no table in the room.  This makes things difficult for someone traveling at least partially on business.  Second, the in-room dining menu lacks conventional breakfast items.  Beet yogurt with no option to order plain yogurt?  Sweet potato pancakes?  I would have preferred some healthy (that's the whole theme of the is place) but more familiar breakfast options.

title: My favourite NYC hotel Gym/Sleep/Work/Eat
text:
I loved everything about this hotel. The rooms are spacey with glass windows from floor to ceiling. The rooms are equipped with all the latest gadgets and next level snacks. I love all the bathroom products carefully selected. This hotel understands the importance of sleep quality, healthy level and health optimisation. I also had a few spa treatments which were all amazing. One of the best feature for me was the infra red sauna. So worth it. Great for mitochondrial health. 
The in room dining menu was packed with amazing options and good quality ingredients including grass fed cows. Hotel is in an excellent location. 

All in all, Equinox deserves more than 5 stars today. I love this hotel and the amazing staff. Thanks so much for making my stay so memorable.

title: New York Trip
text:
Outstanding Location,Hotel is top shelf.
And the people could not do enough for you. The gym is the best gym in a hotel that I have ever seen.  You can even use short and shirt if you need them.  This concept is one that is going to be a winner.  Other hotels in the area will have a lot of catching up to do to top the hotel  
Book you nest trip to new York and stay at the Equinox.

title: Unique hotel experience in NY
text: Amazing views, outstanding service, great location and ultra modern design. Concierge is capable of making your dreams come true. The modern gym located on the 4 floor, the bar and restaurant at the 24th floor and the superb location (walking distance to the shops at Hudson Yards and the Vessel) are just a few reasons for me to definitely say I need to come back to Equinox hotel soon!

title: Sets a new standard for Manhattan hotels
text:
My family and I spent a weekend at the hotel and it was amazing from the time we first walked in the revolving doors until we left. 

Hospitality: Every staff member made us feel like we were the most important guest on property. Check in and check out were quick and efficient. 

Room: Spacious room. Incredibly comfortable bed. Clean room. Loved the tablet controlled lights, shades and services. Great views. 

Food: Delicious 

If I forgot something, I'm sure it was top notch. 

Looking forward to returning. 

AB

title: Needs some tweaking
text: The room was loud, the coffee maker too difficult to work, the staff great, the room dark and it was hard to operate the lights, TV too long to hook up my own codes to get to turn on to things like Net Flix and way too many products in the room with too many temptations to purchase. I felt like I was sleeping in a mall with a great looking door man.

title: First Class Service
text:
We visited the Equinox hotel for the first time this month for my son's birthday, and immediately received a warm and attentive reception. While the hotel itself offered abundant luxury that exceeded our expectations, we were even more impressed with the level of professionalism and service provided by Greg, the front office manager, as well as his supporting staff at the front desk and lobby area. 

Although we have stayed at other high-end hotels in our numerous visits to NYC, the holistic approach to wellness that is offered by the Equinox, in addition to its convenient location across from the Hudson Yards shopping mall, make this an easy choice when returning to the city. 

We will definitely be returning to this hotel.

title: First time experience in a new hotel
text:
super sleek design, friendly service. good location and availability of restaurants at Hudson Yards
I found the bed to be far too firm and the coffee machine difficult to navigate, you could use a light of some kind in that cabinet.
restaurant service was a little spotty.... tea arrived after the food.

title: Absolutely Amazing!!!!
text: I've stayed in many hotels in NYC and around the world. Wanted to see what all the buzz was about at Hudson Yards and the new Equinox. Reviews were amazing so I figured I'd see for myself. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the staff and management made us feel like they couldn't do enough for us. Dare I say that this might not be a Ritz Carlton, but there's a Ritz Carlton service philosophy that pervades this place. For that, the management team deserves enormous credit. Besides being new, immaculate and efficient, there was an aura about this place. The vibe was luxury/hip without trying to be too hip which can cause service and design deficiencies. As our car pulled up, it was like they knew we were arriving. An impeccably dressed gentleman opened the car door and warmly welcomed us to the hotel. He immediately introduced himself, grabbed some bags and brought us into a warm and understated lobby where we were whisked by a dark blue leather lined elevator to a clean and simple registration desk where the smiling desk agent welcomed us by name (apparently the bellman radioed the desk). Black room card keys were in our hands in about 20 seconds and one of the staff escorted us to the 35th floor room overlooking the Hudson River. His brief monologue explaining Equinox philosophy about the design and intent of the room was mind-blowing! You'll have to hear it yourself as I can't do it justice. Let's just say, that when it's time to sleep, there's nothing they haven't thought of....right down to the scents and oils put into the "nighttime shower soap." A simple but customized iPad controls everything in the room and when you push the "sleep button" on the iPad a quick series of things take place int he room to enhance the bedtime experience. If you suffer from insomnia, Equinox has the cure! I could go on and on about the food at Electric Lemon, the room amenities (very unique), the spa, the enormous fitness facility, the cleanliness, the Vessel, the incredible shopping and restaurants  at the Hudson Yards Shops, the proximity to a brand new subway station but I'd have to write a book. Here's all you have to know.... even if you can save $200 $300 or $400 by staying somewhere else, don't do it until you experience this place. There's nothing like it in NYC!!!!!

title: My New Favorite Hotel
text: I was impressed from top to bottom!  The look and feel of the hotel to the courtesy of the staff throughout.  I also enjoyed the gym, which I saw the same consistency with the staff as I received in the hotel itself.  Great job!

title: Zen heaven
text: I was blown away by the pristine condition of the room; not a hair to be found. The amenities in the room are wonderful. All help to sleep and wake up gently. Dyson dryers in room fantastic and love the recovery rollers/yoga mat and ball  So many products to choose from- from face masks to supplements and workout wear for men

title: Cartier Gala
text: We enjoyed every moment from the time we checked in.  The entire staff was helpful, courteous, friendly and went out of their way to ensure that our stay was as smooth and pleasant as possible.  I own several hotels myself and was impressed at the level of professionalism.

title: Birthday
text: We loved equinox. Loved electric lemon. The best part was the people that work at this hotel. Especially ANDY. He provided us with the most incredible service and we got to know him throughout the weekend. A person who truly cares about your experience. The room was amazing and so comfortable. Designed with the highest end but yet homey and comfortable. We will be back!

title: Birthday weekend getaway
text: I just stayed at The Equinox this past weekend with my family. We had a great experience. The hotel room is beautiful and very clean (which was a major plus since we were staying with kids). The staff are extremely friendly and very helpful especially Andy (the bellhop). The only bad review is we wished that there were better options for kids on the menus. Aside from that, our stay was awesome and we will definitely be coming back.

title: Great Fantastic Service and Revolutionary Accommodations
text:
A unique experience and location rolled into one. You've never been to a hotel like this one!

We booked a king deluxe corner suite and a premiere king bedroom for work. There's a good amount of  shops, sights (The Vessel), and dining available. It's also conveniently located next to the 7 subway trin.

title: Very nice place
text: Beautiful atmosphere! The food and drinks were amazing. Would definitely go back here.A nice staff so friendly.The view it’s amazing you have a sea view from the west side would definitely go back here.

title: Very convenient to Hudson Yards businesses
text: Walking distance to the growing businesses in Hudson Yards. Very friendly service. Chic vibe in hotel lobby and bar. Lots of black, white in greys in room. Loved all the toiletries in and more for purchase in the room.

title: Stay at Equinox Hotel Hudson Yards
text: I had an amazing stay at the Equinox hotel, everyone was very kind and I had some of the best sleeps of my life! The rooms are very clean and high tech, I was very surprisingly happy with how much I enjoyed staying here.

title: Great location - but overpriced and no cleaning??
text:
Great to be able to use the EQ facility. But all the other great things they tout you have to pay for - I have never seen such a large and overpriced mini-bar, ever.  All the goodies for sleep, wellness are super jacked up expensive and not included in your room price. They should make that clear.

Also, the cleaning people will NOT clean your room unless you specifically ask? So odd - I have never heard of that in my life. Especially at this price point.  When my room was not cleaned by 1pm I called downstairs (actually, I emailed bc nobody would answer the phone) and asked about my room being serviced as was told I had not requested it?  For $800/night I have to ask to have my bed made? Maybe they could have told me that when I checked in.

If you are here for business there is not a suitable desk - there is a table and you have to sit on the couch and the only outlets are at the bed. So, not ideal if you are here for work.

The blackout shades are awesome.

Ate at the restaurant - also a disappointment. Waitress never asked how I wanted my meat cooked, burger was literally raw on the inside.  Sent it back to be cooked more and it took 20 minutes to get another burger. Also ordered a side of polenta fries (delicious) but she could have told me they *already came with the burger*?

For this price I will not be back.

title: very cool
text: hotel is amazing! the rooms are spacious quiet for sleetping at night electic t black out shade amazing best curated mini bar on the planet Greg at check in is great guys Electric lemon resteratunt amazing food  gym is great

title: Weekend get away
text: Must do the spa and very convenient environment. everything is at walking distance ,mall,Madison square garden,restaurants,empire state building, beautiful views of the city and must climb the vessel structure.

title: What a hotel!
text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful, sleek but not industrial.  The service was excellent, from the time I walked in the door, check-in was fast, the staff was warm, professional, helpful, courteous and polite.  This is the kind of service one reads about in a book.  The room was spectacular, elegant, very contemporary but very warm.  You will not be disappointed!

title: Modern Tech Friendly Hotel
text: The hotel lobby and rooms were very pretty and clean. The gym was also very big and beautiful however you have to go through the lobby and to another elevator bank to access the gym and pool/spa area. The rooms are paperless (i.e. no information book) so you have to find details about all hotel services and amenities via an iPad. Overall, beautiful hotel and loved that it was attached to the High Line.

title: 4 day stay
text: Really enjoyed the stay.  Everything is really slick and well appointed. Room, gym, food and bev, everything was very well thought out catering to business / health / modern traveler. Slept like a champ!

title: This spot is simply AMAZING.
text: I travel all over the world and generally stay at 5 star properties. My standards for service, views, cleanliness, and room/food quality are high. The Equinox Hudson Yards surpassed even my high expectations. As a new property, the rooms are spotless, and all have incredible views. The staff is expertly trained - kind, composed, attentive. The feeling is modern but warm. Above all, it's designed for people who appreciate a first class gym whilst on the road. The salt water lap pool and gym are world-class. I simply can't wait to return, and recommend this property without hesitation. It's absolutely amazing.

title: Perfect hotel for the perfect guest
text: We stayed her for 2 nights. The staff were amazing, food was wonderful, amenities in room were great and the room itself was massively comfortable. Great hotel experience for sure! I stay in a lot of hotels and this was one of the best USA hotels ever (and in fact anywhere)

title: AMAZING HOTEL!!!!
text: The equinox was a very comfortable stay. The hotel has spacious and well designed rooms. The views of hudson yards and the vessel are pretty incredible and the restaurant doesn't disappoint. The facilities are clean, well taken care of and the staff is friendly. I'd like to stay here on every visit to NYC.

title: Great experience
text: The location is fantastic, the staff is super friendly, the desgin is great and so are the ameneties. It is very new hotel so there are still technical issues but they are dealt with very efficiently. Will come back.

title: Beautiful Property
text: Open only 87 days this beautiful hotel has great potential. The service does not meet the standards of a 5 star hotel. No turn down service ( did not realize it must be requested), my bags did not reach my room until 5 hours after check in, can take up to one hour to retrieve your car. Overall. Wait staff was adequate but not great. Inly standout was gentleman by pool restaurant..outstanding!!

title: Magnifique
text: Tres bel hotel confortable dans un nouveau quartier époustouflantle personnel jeune est particulièrement agréable. En revanche le petit déjeuner n’est pas a la hauteur du luxe de cet hotel.  Les toasts sont réchauffés et mauvais les fruits décongelés. Dommage

title: Excellent New York Hotel
text:
My second and enjoyable business stay in the new Equinox Hotel. 
The rooms are beautifully designed and comfortable with an excellent bathroom. 
The bed and bedding are a game changer for a city hotel. 
Looking forward to coming back.

title: Equinox NYC Hotel
text: From the spacious rooms to the wellness qualities abound I highly recommend this new property in NYC for the health minded as well as those looking to relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of daily life.  Staff was very gracious and always accommodating any request.   First class all the way

title: First Stay at the Equinox
text: The Equinox is a very pleasant contemporary hotel.  The service from the concierge desk was particularly noteworthy.  As a new property, all the facilities and amenities in the hotel are outstanding.  There were a few challenges attributable to newer staff learning the property and a few room challenges due to new and first time use.  Overall a very nice experience and being in Hudson Yards adjacent to all the new offerings there with easy access to Chelsea and the West Village, this is a winner.  It's very pricey.

title: A wonderful change in hotel industry
text: Had a wonderful staycation here at Equinox Hotel. The things I loved the most are their full sized amenities and their sleeping system. I was there for 2 nights and I felt completely rejuvenated on departure. The concept around “Dark, cool and quiet” is brilliant and it is perfect for those travelling from far or in need of a proper sleeping in without interruptions. Many hours were spent behind the scenes to create such a unique product, I can’t wait to experience other Equinox hotels once they are open.

title: Equinox Hotel was EXCELLENT!!!
text:
We spent the weekend at the Equinox, it was absolutely perfect. Our room was a corner suite which was unbelievable. The view over the Hudson was spectacular from both rooms. The Suite was very spacious. The closets were large. The bathroom was beautiful. The shower was fabulous.  All the soaps smelled so pretty. 

There were control panels to control the shades in the room, which made the room pitch black, perfect for sleeping in NYC. The lights could be made dim or bright which is very helpful when you apply make up..:)
The mood in the suite was perfect. The decor was on trend.

There were robes, slippers, gym equipment such as foam rollers, yoga blocks, bands, mat if you want to work out in your room. The gym was fantastic. There were numerous classes going on, plus all of the most current gym equipment. The gym was so clean. Everyone was very helpful.

We had drinks watching the sunset on the rooftop, its was beautiful.  We eventually hit the bar inside which had a great vibe. 

We also had breakfast at Electric Lemon. The avocado toast was GREAT!!! Open egg white omelette too. 

We definitely could have spent more time, we will definitely be back. This hotel did not miss a beat. No detail was missed. The service was excellent!!!

title: A perfect stay
text:
Health and wellness mixed with indulgence in the best possible way. My husband and I had the best time here.

Room: expansive, with mood-setting echo lights, drawers that are full of surprises, big closets, water bottles, snacks and Nespresso coffee machine. The shower is huge and the personal care products make you go mmmmmmmmmm. 

Food and beverage: in room bar with great snack options and alcoholic / non alcoholic drinks, including specialty teas recommended for specific use around the day, by the “Rituals” Manual offered in the room.
We visited the Electric Lemon hotel restaurant for a Sunday brunch and were surprised by the delicious and creative food. Perfect meal.

Mood: lights, temp and blinds can be controlled from the iPad in the room. smart tv that enables to check into your accounts if you wish, and checks out for you upon leaving. Modern, sleek design - The hotel itself changes the look/feel around the clock to suit the required mood. 

Bed: the exact hardness of the bed, exact softness of the duvet and pillows. Felt like sleeping in a cloud and it was the best sleep I’ve experienced away from home. You can even ask for specific pillows etc if you wish.

Fitness: you have access to Equinox club with Hudson River view - need I say more?! It’s an amazing club, with the best fitness equipment and studio classes, towels, and vibe.

Location: on the fashionable Hudson Yards neighborhood, close to everything and with a subway station right there.

We will definitely spend every possible staycation in the future here. It is a perfect hotel - can’t ask for more!

title: Recommended for several reasons
text: Excellent location next to Javit, I was speaking at an event there and could walk to it. Very modern and minimalist, relaxing. Incredibly well stocked room with  bar, workout gear, and more. The food is excellent, fresh, healthy, but still interesting and creative.When was the last time you intentionally “dined in” at a city hotel? The gym of course is what you expect, large and encompassing. Greg, the hotel manager was very accommodating and friendly. I’m a Marriott Ambassador level, but here I’ve been swayed. We will definitely stay there again on future trips.

title: Excellent Spa and gym facilities that is beyond compare in New York City
text: Recently took a tour of Equinox Gym ans Spa at Hudson Yards. The facilities are beyond compare. The hotel also had a very beautiful restaurant with great outdoor space and fireplaces and great style. Unfortunately I tried to get a full tour of the hotel including the rooms, Since it was a Sunday the right personnel was not available for the tour. In my opinion the Equinox facility is the highlight of the Hudson Yards Complex. I did not find the the Shops at Hudson Yards or the other restaurants compelling in any way. As it stands to day the outstanding part of the Hudson Yards Complex is the the Equinox gym and spa facilities.

title: Check your bill after you leave
text: The hotel was nice however they tried to tack on $139.99 of mini bar fees days after my stay. We didn’t even touch the mini bar. This is really not an acceptable practice when you’re spending upwards to $700 on a room. The hotel was decent however this experience left a bad taste in my mouth.

title: My dream hotel
text: We loved our stay at Equinox! The rooms are amazing from the blackout shades to morning and evening body cleansers. We loved having access to a full workout center! I hate hotel gyms and this was beyond anything we could ask for! The staff is by far a big highlight for the hotel too! A hotel you must stay at at least once!

title: Equinox has done a fantastic job with this new hotel.
text: Staff was amazing all around. Attend tonally of our needs perfectly. Room was perfect , modern , comfortable and designed beautifully. We cannot wait for our next chance to stay at this hotel again. Did not get a chance to use the gym facility but did tour it and it was fantastic.

title: 3 Day Trip
text: The Equinox Hotel is a beautiful property with a state of the art fitness and wellness center. The entire concept is brilliant. The old hotel chains should take note , this could change the entire landscape.

title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Hudson Yards
text: We stayed at the Equinox for 3 nights and I wished we had been able to stay much longer!  A lovely hotel with views of the city and the river with a state of the art health club.  Our suite was elegant, tasteful and had many nice touches which demonstrated their attention to detail.  The room was nicely appointed and "high tech" with everything (e.g., lights, drapes, information about the hotel) either on the IPad  or the electronic switches located bedside.  The bath products by "Grown Alchemist" were so nice that I came home and searched for them online, but the ones at the Equinox must be specially made because I could not find the specific scents/herbs they had at the hotel.  Our experience overall with the staff was excellent, they went out of their way to be helpful and engaging.  We did not unfortunately have an opportunity to eat at the restaurant, but had drinks at the bar one night which we enjoyed.  It was too cool to sit outside, but there is a very nice outdoor bar which looked great. We were sorry to leave but would highly recommend the hotel and would stay again without question.

title: Business Event Well Done
text: Spent a week there. The staff is very attentive and accommodating. Rooms were well appointed. Great, great gym and workout facilities. Awesome smoothies at the Coconut Garden (which really needs to open before 10AM). Good room service and salads at the Grill. Navigating the hotel is super confusing so expect to get lost. Right across from a great mall. Lots of construction around the area so hopefully that gets better in time.

title: Great Hotel - Too Bad about Unnecessary Hassle
text:
This hotel was booked for me by a client for essentially a shower and 1 hour nap before the work meeting at 8am. Since I checked in at 5:45am (for the night before) I was able to experience this new and gorgeous hotel with no other guests around. It was definitely love at first site and every staff member along the way was kind and helpful.

Unfortunately this potentially magical experience was marred by unnecessary administrative issues. Even though the client 100% paid for the room, I was told upon check-in that it was not, so I had to put down my card and pay for it. Thinking that I was going to breeze in, get my key and go to bed instead became a situation of confusion and misunderstanding - putting my relationship with the client in doubt.

Fast forward to the next day I have to contact someone about the hotel room and they have to contact the client and the client has to call the hotel and I have to check with my credit card and on and on and on. This over-prudence by a hotel is not unfamiliar. However, I have only experienced it in places like the Sheraton or Radisson or other hotels in a lesser category. These hotels would rather protect themselves and let the guest have to deal with the hassle of being reimbursed. 

The problem with this model is that my memory of the experience could have been 3 perfect hours of heaven. Instead, I am dragged into admin hell writing emails back and forth because the hotel chose an easier path for themselves - foisting an avoidable problem onto me. It's a bigger risk than they realize since the travel agency for the ginormous law firm may think twice before booking them again.

Incidentally - $658.00 is not an Authorization Hold. So the hotel also lies.

title: Beautiful hotel, amazing restaurant and lovely roof terrace!
text:
A gorgeous hotel with great views and stunning terrace with. Rooms are high tech and chic as you'd expect and the bath products are divine! 
The restaurant menu doesn't do the food justice, whilst all very healthy the food is spectacular!! Can't recommend highly enough, incredibly tasty!
Amazing area with the Vessel and the high line in stones throw, a great place to stay!

title: Top notch Experience
text: Staff went above and beyond to make our stay a special one as we  were celebrating two birthdays!They made sure that we were taken care of every step of the way from making reservations for our meals to setting us up with a spectacular sail around the City.  Also the rooms were super clean and the beds were the most comfortable of any hotel I've stayed at! We will be staying here again for sure!

title: Nightmare
text: They do not have their act together, wait wait wait, SPA services are done in a hotel room that you have to walk through general public, Valet takes an hour etc. Smart room but not everything works, workers making noise at the crack of dawn Sunday etc.

title: Nothing like it...
text:
Nothing like this place. Room itself is what really blew me away. loved the iPad that controlled everything and especially the  “dark, quiet, cool” button that transformed the room into what would provide me with the best sleep I’ve ever had. The staff are friendly, the uniforms are charming...and I’ll miss the friendly people at my former usual hotel in New York. This is my new nyc hotel.

One more thing: THE QUESADILLA on in-room dining menu!!!

title: Outstanding Experience!
text: This is a beautiful hotel! From the professional and obviously well trained staff to the room itself to the food, everything was perfect, and I am not easily impressed.  I visit New York often, and the Equinox Hotel is my new absolute favorite place to stay. I will definitely be back with my family and friends.

title: First time
text: great view of hudson river. Great rooftop terrace, excellent food and overall great service. The location in Hudson Yard is excellent and I also visited the very impressive GYM. Overall very happy with the service so next time in the area, I will return .

title: This place is incredible!!!!!
text:
The new Equinox Hotel is probably the best hotel I have ever stayed in! Some of the best bits: the staff - level of engagement and care all interactions super friendly and professional - you feel they are motivated and care (which is not always the case in 5* hotels)
- the room product - amazing levels of details and high end 5* finish - love the amazing technology and little touches like the cool mini-bar and fitness items to use - they even have yoga and meditation on the TVs - equinox has thought if ever detail to make the stay relaxing and regenerating! Other hotels just talk about it but equinox actually do it! 
- room service had a great interesting selection, was quick and looks great too
- the bath amenities are amazing
- the whole equinox gym experience for a hotel guest is amazing! Best gym ever! Huge and loads of classes too 
- the spa is great and the cyro and wave machine something to remember 

This hotel is amazing - really above and beyond even what I expected it would be - the design, staff and brand curating has been done exceptionally well and it really feels like something new that is not out there - can’t wait to go back!!!

title: Feel like prince!
text: This hotel....from drop off to the inside and service, if you enjoy luxury lifestyle and pampered services and attention, Equinox is your choice!  They make you feel welcome, like a prince!  The view is awesome, you feel like you have arrived to a new corner of New York.  Pricey, but it’s outstanding.  One thing you will notice from all staff when you see them, they look at you in the with the gigantic, sincere smiles, and a big “hello”.   Try it for yourself.

title: AMAZING.
text:
My girlfriend and I had a great stay..We would have loved some space at the pool carved out for hotel guests...it was difficult to find chairs out there for us, but we eventually did when others left.

The room was amazing...“Cool” is the best way to describe it....the colors, the temperature, and the vibe. The bell boy referred to it as a ‘sleep chamber’ and I can attest as to why....it was the best sleep I’ve ever gotten in New York City....Hands down.

I am not a member of Equinox, but they made us feel that way during our stay.....Awesome, awesome weekend at your hotel!!

title: Lads this place is top dog
text: Honest to god bruv this place great to kick with the lads made me feel right home did it kicking watching some good ol footy on the telly with a beer in me hand top qual lads dont come to my ends ye ille shank ya up bruv in my top god hotel

title: New Gem in NYC
text: This new hotel is exceptional.  From the amazing staff to the incredible gym with 2 pools (both outdoor and indoor).  This room was very spacious, get style, I loved that everything is thought, the black out curtains are a must and having them on floor to ceiling windows was a wonderful perk.

title: Great stay
text:
We had fun at this new hotel. Great views, slept well, great gym and yoga classes (for my wife). Good location close to the Hudson Yards mall, subway, and High Line walkway. 
We will definitely return.

title: Most impressive modern exciting hotel ever
text:
Magnificent modern design.  Completely quiet dark sleeping chambers.  Sleek and anticipating.  My hotel in New York.
Restaurant is amazing.  Try the chicken.
Access to the magnificent gym is a treat!
Run don’t walk to this cathedral of health rest wellness

title: Something special
text:
Had a truly wonderful stay here at Equinox Hudson Yards!

I like to indulge while I’m traveling for work, so I was really happy to see that even a health-forward brand like Equinox was willing to give guests options like an delicious burger on the dining menu and also leave me some chocolates in my room before bed.

Two minor critiques

1. there is not much space in the common areas to bring my laptop and get work done. There is a beautiful sitting area overlooking the new Hudson Yards, but not much “work” space to plug in and get work done if you happen to be traveling on business, as I was.

2. The hotel staff was amazing and so attentive, however, I was disappointed by my experience in the fitness club.

I wasn’t pleasantly welcomed into the gym as I was in the hotel. Quite a few employees leaning against walls, yawning, and not the warmest greeting as I entered the facility.

Other than that, I truly enjoyed my experience here and I can’t recommend enough. I will be returning soon!

title: Awesome hotel and gym!
text: My husband and I came to NYC for a family reunion and stayed at the new Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards.   The property lived up to the hype and even exceeded my expectations, from the room with black out shades, to the amazing Equinox gym, and outdoor pool.  The restaurant has amazing food, the Equinox Breakfast was the best, loved the avocado toast.   The weather was gorgeous and we took advantage of the incredible outdoor patio.   A nice perk because I belong to an Equinox gym back home, I got free laundry service for my gym clothes!  I am a hotel snob and if you are too you would love it.    Looking forward to coming back soon.

title: Exceptional customer service
text: As we entered the property, we met our doorman. He stated how wonderful the hotel was and how great the views were. We got to our room and we were not impressed.  I told him about my thoughts on our view on my way out lunch.  When we returned, he mentioned he spoke to his manager and they wanted to show us additional rooms.  We settled on the view we liked and was moved.  I honestly didn’t think they would make the switch.  What impressed me the most, was this was all coordinated by our doorman.  Exceptional customer service throughout the entire hotel! I was impressed!

title: Wonderful new hotel!
text:
We stayed in the hotel for two nights. The hotel is definitely luxurious but very lively. All the staff that we met was super friendly and helpful. 
Rooms are pretty spacious for NYC hotels and nicely designed. We had a river view, that was stunning! 
We did not have a chance to use gym, but we tried the cryotherapy in SPA! Great experience! At first, it is super cold, but you feel so good and rejuvenated after that. 
Also, the whole Hudson Yards is a destination itself (The Vessel, shops, restaurants). The subway station is 2 min walk from the hotel. 
We were able to get everything we were asking for it the hotel! I was impressed and definitely recommend the hotel.

title: Beautiful Hotel in a great location.
text: My husband and my 3 year old daughter stayed here on the last night of a trip to NYC and we loved it. Great location with fantastic staff. They could not do enough to make our stay more memorable. We had a late flight home the next day and they very kindly allowed us a 4pm check-out. This was so helpful especially with a 3 year old in tow. The rooftop bar is amazing and definitley worth checking out as was the gym. Hope to return again soon!

title: A stay to be repeated!
text:
My stay was exceptional starting with the arrival/check-in experience, the in-room dining presentation followed by a good nights sleep and a great breakfast in the restaurant, all made my short overnight stay left me wanting to return soon to fully experience all this property has to offer. I recommend the Equinox Hotel for anyone coming to NYC that is looking for a unique luxury experience! 

,

title: Very Good
text: Enjoyable, my suggestion is a cab & Uber area. Had to wait too long for public transportation and many wasn't familiar with the new location. The room service menu was slim, not a good choice , especially after partying, need  chicken wings on the menu. Even those with money like wings! Besides that, it was a very nice location.

title: Best of everything in one place
text: Great location, excellent service, spacious rooms with views of City and water, beautiful pools indoor and outdoor, had all we needed. Concierge helped us with tickets to Hamilton, looking forward to being back soon!

title: Service!!
text: Did not expect much by way of service at this hotel - they’re young and they’re new. This is what blew me away about my stay. Service was phenomenal. No one stood out because they all did. I wasn’t thrilled with having to take 2 different elevators to my room, but I get that the sky lobby is “in” now. Didn’t use the club, but paid a visit and it’s as stunning as i imagined it would be. Love this hotel and likely won’t stay anywhere else in the future for my yearly trip to NYC.

title: wonderful staff and lovely and exciting hotel
text: Dear Equinox owners, I think your hotel is absolutely smashing and every single team member was polite, kind and helpful.  I will be sending a letter from me on behalf of my company with the dozen names of staff who helped me since they deserve special recognition.  I hope to visit often.  THANK YOU for a wonderful time in a beautiful hotel.  Barbara Groves

title: Amazing Hotel!!!!
text: Excellent hotel where service,meets design and luxury. Beyond 5 star. Staff is welcoming and friendly. Meeting space and catering was fantastic. The Club amenities are outstanding with great spin classes. It was a pleasure to meet Nicole Menda and the team.  Food and drinks are stellar. The rooms were beautiful with great views and extremely comfortable. Guest Services was awesome from Antoinette to Jasmine, Will Louis  Devon ,Alex and Aaron at reception. In addition, there are lots of things to see and do in the area and the concierge team is fantastic   Our Company Executive Meeting will be returning next week!💗

title: Extraordinary!
text: Extraordinary service! Outstanding stay! Wonderful staff like Alex at reception, Adrian at the concierge desk, Will Lewis who ensured that I had an umbrella and a fresh bottle of water before I headed to my meeting and Devon, TJ & Norman who greeted me royally on arrival, valeted my car and made sure that my luggage was sent up to my room immediately. This hotel experience has been nothing short of amazing! Their attention to detail is impeccable. Can’t wait to come back!

title: Best Luxury Hotel in New York City
text:
When I travel to NYC for business and leisure, I have high expectation for hotels -- booking at 1 Hotels, The Greenwich Hotel or The Baccarat Hotel when I xan.  The Equinox Hotel blows them all out of the water -- on every level.  

For a weary traveler (like me) the rooms are completely soundproof and I had the best night of sleep I have ever had in a hotel... everything is designed for health, comfort and sleep.  I arrived at 6am (after a redeye) and there was a pot of coffee already in my room, and at night, the turndown service set everything up for a great night of sleep.  

The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  The location works well -- and if you are traveling for business, getting both uptown and downtown is pretty simple.  I walked across the west side highway to take a 5 minute ferry over to Hoboken for a meeting -- avoiding the Lincoln tunnel at rush hour.  

I did take a SoulCycle class during my stay, but did not venture into the gym --which is on my list next.   Also, lots of food and shopping options outside the hotel, which I will explore when I have more time or am traveling with my kids.  

I could not recommend it more for business travel, and look forward to staying there for leisure.  Loved, loved it.

title: Amazing Hotel and great addition to NYC
text:
Very special hotel with unparalleled service, great outdoor space for cocktails, amazing restaurant and room decor to die for.  Got everything right!  Convenient location near restaurants, shopping mall and transportation (near the subway -line 7, Soul Cycle/gym on premise and easy to access.  Away from the craziness/noisy uptown...
Still difficult for an Uber/Lyft to find the entrance but they will eventually get used to it.

title: Outstanding Overall
text: We had a great time here. Pretty much exactly what I expected from Equinox - stunning, understated, and well planned out. The bellmen remembered us every time we returned from our days out in the city. The terrace just might be the new best place for casual drinks in Manhattan. Can’t wait to return next year.

title: Cozy stay
text: Tried out the hotel for a staycation and had an enjoyable, relaxing stay. The room is spacious and clean with plush towels and bedding. We had an amazing view of the Hudson River. Floor to ceiling windows watching the sunset was unforgettable. The bathrobes are so unique- nothing like the typical terry robes you find in other hotels. Very nice bathroom amenities- smells nice, high quality and large sizes! All the staff encountered are polite, courteous and friendly.

title: Beautiful new hotel
text:
Stunning new hotel in Hudson Yard.

Location:  walking distance to bars, restaurants, nightlife, and tourist attractions. 

The property:  modern highrise.  The entrance and check in to the hotel are not on the same floor.  Guests need to take the first elevator to the 25th floor and then transfer to the main house hotel to your room. 

The room:  Modern, clean, luxurious, and well-appointed. All the furniture is beautiful.  The washroom has a stand-up shower that is glass-enclosed.  the sink area has a large mirror and the toilet area is also glass-enclosed.  Toiletries are from Grown Alchemist, awesome brand that focuses on quality ingredients and natural wellbeing. 

Amenities: the restaurant and bar are great, a little on the expensive side, but high quality.
The gym is great, full Equinox equipment and staff.  BUT - hotel guests can only use the gym, indoor pool and terrace pool during club hours.  The Equinox club closes at 6 pm making it impossible for a business traveller, or leisure traveller wanting to get a workout, dip in the pool, or sunbathing after regular business hours.  Definitely something management needs to negotiate and work on.

Staff:  super friendly.  The Equinox staff need to focus on service for hotel guests.  Many of the staff were rude, non-personable, and pretentious.

Overall - great property.  Being a new hotel with 100% new staff they will need some time to work on their service standards and also how the gym can become a better feature for hotel guests.

Would I stay again: for a low price, yes.  I image this hotel's room rate will go up as time goes by.  At the time of booking, the room night rate was comparable to neighbouring hotels.

title: Great new offering
text: Equinox has launched a long needed option, getting away from a more formal and stuffy five star to one that  offers luxury, comfort, privacy and modern day amenities (gym,spa,dining, in a contemporary box.

title: Stunning hotel and views!
text: This hotel is impeccable!  Thoroughly enjoyed my time here.  The pool is incredible with beautiful views.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  I would highly recommend to anyone traveling with friends, significant other, or business travel.

title: Amazing experience!!!
text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for a weekend to enjoy the city. In short, hotel is amazing. No detail was missed in the creation of this oasis. From the TJ at the front door, to the front desk staff in the lobby, to the waiters at the pool - everyone was extremely welcoming and made us feel right at home.  The rooms were fantastic. Absolute luxury. We stayed in a junior suite and it did not disappoint. I would highly recommend to anyone interested in visiting NYC!! We will be back again!!

title: amazing experience
text:
My partner and I stayed 9 nights at Equinox and it was a pure bliss. Even if the hotel is not completely finished (a bit difficult for the drivers to find it) , it was a delight. The rooms are spacious and modern, we kindly been upgraded with a view on the Vessel. The SPA and gym facilities are stellar and the Bar excellent.
Kudos to the concierge who gave us very good suggestions for fine dinning.

title: All around great!
text: This is my second visit to the hotel and I love it...Greg was particularly wonderful but so was everyone! The gentleman who took luggage, server who brought breakfast, the Gym! I will always stay her when in New York!

title: A breath of fresh air
text:
I have never written a trip advisor review as it seems there are enough opinions out there already but I have such respect for what I just experienced that I felt it was time.
I had booked to stay in the Equinox as it was convenient for some work commitments and I imagined it would be my one and only stay as I have a number of other hotels and neighbourhoods that I enjoy as I visit multiple times each year. I’d heard the claims about achieving an amazing night’s sleep and I thought it may be marketing talk. But I slept for 10 hours straight which I rarely do anywhere in the world, let alone with jet lag. Staying there I felt a part of something. It’s a new  concept and you can palpably feel that the people involved want to create something that goes beyond what is on offer elsewhere. The staff are excited to be part of something new and you feel that passion in the service and you taste it in the food.They have really thought about this. The restaurant,Electric Lemon is the best I have eaten in a New York Hotel and they do simple things well like being able to order a celery juice in the morning, great teas, good coffee - simple things but really well done and always pretty plates lots of colour and texture which is my measure of good food. I tried the infrared sauna and cryotherapy which were great. And the gym is amazing obviously being Equinox. It’s ten times the size of any gym I’ve ever seen in a hotel. I’m not even into gyms but one day I went twice! It’s the little touches like having two shower gels in the bathroom one for morning and once for evening, or having special dishes designed for winding down for sleep on the room service menu like the melatonin smoothie. Is it the finished article? No it still felt somewhat like it’s finding it’s feet as it has only been open a few weeks and I get the sense that there is more to come. But would I stay there again? Without a doubt it’s where I will stay on my next trip to NYC. Oh and given that I’ve written this and that it may be my one and only review I want to thank some of the characters that worked so hard to make me feel welcome. TJ, Andy and Eric at the entrance; Jackson and Peter at the bar; James, Kyle and Bowie in the restaurant team and the girl who made a great flat white at the first attempt despite never having heard of one; Sarah, Tara and Abad in the spa; Aaron and Ali on reception; and Chris, Philipp and Emily in management. They and many others whose names I don’t recall treated me like family and I am very grateful. Oh and the outside terrace is  beautiful at sunset.

title: What an experience!
text:
I recently stayed at the new Equinox Hotel in Hudson Yards.  It is an incredibly sexy property, especially for NYC standards.  The rooms are very high tech, everything is automated from the blinds to the shower that is see through but the flick of a switch makes it shaded instantly, very cool feature.  Also the concierge has a huge full touch screen display which they use for their guests to show maps and info.
The robes in the room are also incredibly comfortable, I wish I had bought one! The unique feature of staying here is having the gym access which is brand new and 100 times better than any hotel gym you will ever experience.  ANYWHERE.  I travel often and am used to having a Mickey Mouse gym to work out in, this was a great change of pace.  There is also a state of the art spa with cryotherapy chamber which was super intense but I felt incredible after.  
On the 24th floor is the main restaurant, which also has a terrace at the end of it.  Absolutely stunning place to sit outside there's a fireplace and water feature as well as unique sculpture.  I can not wait to stay in Equinox next time im in New York!

title: About time..
text: Had the pleasure of staying here for 4 nights. Far and Away the best hotel experience I have had in NYC in 15 years of coming to the city. The layers exist to back up any claim that may be made. Nourishment, Movement and Rest equally taken seriously underpinned by a friendly and personal yet highly professional approach to service. Massive thanks to Philip, Emily and the team. I predict this hotel will raise the bar for may years to come.

title: Antiseptic and not good value for very high price
text:
I came for business in Hudson Yards, this is the only hotel on site.  Walking into the lobby is disappointing; it's just an elevator bank which takes you up to a small lobby on a higher floor--not a lot of public space to relax, have a drink, do some work without being trapped in your room.  The staff were very helpful and kind but they were EVERYWHERE--like you're walking a gamut of staff people saying hi at all times.  Chill people!  

The big sell of this place is supposedly access to the gym--however, I asked for a class schedule and was given a run around--basically I'd have to go speak to the concierge and get the schedule, which is not made easily available.  There are iPads in each room and wouldn't it make sense if you could easily book yourself into a class from there? I got the distinct impression they are making it a bit hard to use the gym b/c they don't want it overrun with hotel guests, since they have regular members as well.  In addition, the spa closed at 6--useless for a business traveler.  

The room had some cool lighting features but was average sized and not really remarkable considering the price--not a lot of character.  The room service charges were comical--hot water and lemon was $4, with a $10 delivery charge and tax and tip. Even on the company dime that is beyond the pale. 

I stay in nice hotels frequently for work and short story is for the price, there's nothing "special" here especially when the gym and spa weren't made easily available. I hope they realize that as it is convenient for all the people with new offices in Hudson Yards--for now, not worth it at all.

title: Wow!!!!!!!
text: Beyond blown away by the level of luxury!  From the moment I arrived into the private drive within the Hudson Yards plaza, I was escorted to the elevators and came up to the gorgeous sky lobby. The staff is authentically kind and the views over the city and river, as well as overlooking the restaurant, take your breath away.  My room was a Deluxe River with gorgeous water views from the 28th floor.  Spacious, quiet, modern and even had separate morning/evening body washes!  The mini bar was the best I’ve ever seen- with organic products and face masks.  The fitness club is the largest I have ever seen, and everyone was friendly wherever I ventured.  Hudson Yards is so fun- with the Vessel and all the shops and restaurants just in front of the hotel.  I cannot wait to return!!

title: Don’t stay here
text: Place looks nice on surface they don’t know how to run a hotel  also the rooms are like bad ikea furniture  that don’t work  not a bussiness friendly hotel    I has over charged for room service bar tender needs anger management classes buyer beware

title: NYC and US Open
text: Equinox Hotel is world class. The rooms, the location, the service, food...can’t say enough about this 5 star hotel. Incredible experience from beginning to end. Rooms are modern and elegant. We took a yoga class and had coconut yogurt at the spa- delicious!!  Then finished our stay with a tour of the vessel and a plunge in the salt water pool. The service from the valet to the concierge and check in as well as meeting the hotel manager was a warm, welcoming and friendly experience. We will be coming back every year!

title: Work out the kinks...
text:
Excellent hotel in terms of design, but not sure the value is there for the price.  If it's a "workout-oriented" hotel, there needs to be more included for the exorbitant rack rate (i.e., a personal trainer session, or a spa experience).  Also, the kinks need to be worked out - the hot tub was not working during our stay (if you're going to tout the water features of the hotel, make sure they are actually functional), there is no sound system in each room (given the advanced technological features, it was surprising there wasn't a speaker we could connect our phones to), there was not an iron in the room, the closet light did not turn off via the iPad (we had to get up to close the door manually), there were too many items for purchase in the closet area (took up too much real estate), the USB port on one side of the bed did not work, etc.  Too many things went awry considering how much we were paying - in a city like New York, there are so many options that don't have these "kinks" for the same price, so not sure we'd stay again...

There was many things we did like as well - we enjoyed the lighter fare in the restaurant, the service was good, the modernity of the hotel was nice, and the mattress was nice.

title: New hotel at great location
text:
The hotel is at a very good location with lots of restaurants and shopping just minutes away at Hudson Yards. Also there is a subway stop right outside. I liked the airplay function on the TV.

It could be noisy due to construction still going on in the area, bring earplugs.

title: Horrible Experience!
text: Truly the worst hotel I have ever been to. I wish I chose to stay somewhere else, staying at the equinox hotel ruined my most special occasion. I chose it because of the location, I came for my bar exam. I couldn't sleep because of the construction, the alarms that went off for hours, and the men outside my window at 6am. I would like to specifically point out how incredibly rude and unprofessional two of the managers there are. Emily [-] and Alec [-]. I have never encountered anyone like you. The way you treated my family and I was despicable. You ruined what was supposed to be the most important time of my life. I had to take to my Bar exam on three hours of sleep because you made me cry and harassed me in the lobby. I wish I never stayed here.

title: Awful
text:
The re invented the wheel by making it square

The mattress is numbingly hard barely slept.

The whole room has been designed by self proclaimed expert on design for sleep - typical nyc marketing nonesense 

Terrible experience but on the upside if you want to hate life but Instagram something to people who would think it’s cool stay here

title: The Pool Is Great!
text: It depends on what you are looking for whether or not this is the place to stay.  The pool atop the fourth floor roof was what we were most interested in, and on that, the hotel delivered.  While the pool is overcrowded with people that belong to the health club, as a hotel guest you do have access to a lovely area and since you are staying there, perhaps you have time to wait for a lounge chair.  When we arrived at peak time on a Friday afternoon there were 142 people ahead of us waiting for a text to tell them a chaise had opened up.  Unlikely to get two together, we found an arm chair and some space on a bench in the pool and still enjoyed it.  Indeed, the pool was the true highlight of an otherwise average stay.  Staff in their all white suits, or some in all black, were aloof and not terribly welcoming.  We had tried for an early arrival and were turned down - we arrived exactly at 3 for our 3 PM check in only to be told we couldn't check in because there was a photo shoot going on.  We were corralled into an area, then told to move against the wall as to not interfere with long shots from the photo shoot.    No apologies, and really staff seemed to think we should be excited to be delayed by others who were so much more important than mere guests.  This held over to being escorted to the room - the only time we saw the staff person animated was when she described the mirrors in the room were modeled on those at French fashion shows.  The hallway is plain and the room doors look like elevators.  Upon arrival a lackluster bowl of grocery store apples adorned the table at the elevator on our floor but not long afterward that had disappeared leaving the elevator and room doors to all look the same.  The room has typical amenities in a high end hotel - it was spacious, comfortable, modern - but not special.  The only way to watch the oversized television is to have a subscription to HBO, Hulu, Netflix, Amazon Prime.  Once we realized there was no television service other than what you could log into on your phone, it was easy enough to use - but we spend some time trying to find the channels provided with the room first, before realizing there was none.  There are some yoga and exercise videos that can be accessed though, even if you don't have your own video service to log into.   The absolute lack of any art other than an odd photo in our room added to the lackluster appeal of the the hallway and room.  The elevator from the concierge to the the pool and street level operated normally but the elevators to/from the room floors operated fairly slowly.  Decent toiletries are provided in the room and in generous, full size amounts.  Towels and robes are lovely.  The environmental controls - lights, temperature, shades - are easily controlled by the provided iPad.  There was an odd flashing green light from the ceiling that blinked all night - with the room darkening shades it was particularly noticeable.  Ultimately we put a pillow on top of the cabinet to reduce the impact.  From the 29th floor traffic was louder than similar floors in other hotels in NYC.  Being right near the West Side Highway and the helicopter launches created a fairly consistent noise.  The hotel restaurant was superb - some of the nicest staff we ran into (except one staffer - Jeff - who was the most welcoming, helpful and informative of all) as well as a very good menu of very good food, excellent service and a little bit of brightness in the decor.  Overall, for us, we went for the pool and it was worth it.  It's a terrific location too.  But if you just want a luxurious, nicely decorated accommodation around midtown, with excellent service and there are better options.
